23xiqsad25ozORKrblPAtg.text: Had breakfast in here once during our four nights at Cesar's Palace.  A very eclectic menu for sure.  Many things you've heard of, but I went adventurous and had the Hand Held breakfast menu - with the short ribs, eggs, muchrooms, bacon and cheese on Cuban Bread.  It was a little dry, so I ordered the Ranchero sauce on the side and that fixed it up nicely.  Ordered a glass of OJ and it comes in a tiny little mason jar...not much if you are thirsty.  Waiter was decent.  I'd try a more routine item next time, but for a 24 hour restaurant, it wasn't bad.  I'd go back.

-vlsgsrJBTpGdmKK2IbEYA.text: We ate here a lot after the club. Everything is very good here. From the wings, to the nachos, chicken strips and the turkey sandwich ! Bartenders are VERY nice !

ALQR-rNnuyLiG8-ezxtxYQ.text: We had to go back again the next morning!  They have the most delicious french toast with berries and whipped cream.  They have this amazing aged Bourbon maple syrup to go with it - which seems lighter yet super complimentary to an already sweet dish.

Qb1d3k5nJbt1W8OYbYfI6A.text: A must-go-to!...the staff (friendly, energetic, like family by the time you leave), the food (big portions, reasonably priced, especially for vegas, atmosphere (outside the Caesars Palace entrance with incredible views of the strip, can even hear the Bellagio fountains dance, good music and tvs all around the bar). I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!!!

JQ_yUElCL44EdJeT06vKuQ.text: Sit at the bar - great for people watching in the lobby. We split the Asian salad - fresh and delightful. Drinks are over-priced. Service was slow. With so many options in Vegas, not sure why drinks are so over-priced and service can be so lousy.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

n1cbT84d-7_vC880ZC2uaQ.text: This is an outstanding 24 hr Cafe. The prices are somewhat high but comparable to the other casino restaurants. Breakfast particularly feels overpriced though. The service is impressive for being a "Cafe". The menu holds a wide variety of options for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or those late night cravings. This place is usually somewhat busy but the bar always has somewhere to sit down and place your order for what seems like quicker service. Your food tends to be ready alot sooner than if u were in the dining room. My #1 suggestion no doubt is the short rib nachos. Unbelievable! Whenever i go i just can't pass up on those nachos. Give it a shot!

oQWLMefuYxrqJL_e_vGtQg.text: Great breakfast! Fruit platter was beautiful and delicious! Keith was our waiter and he was by far the best waiter in Vegas! We will be back just to see him.

z7EmjtMXl35HhKK6iU2kmg.text: It's in a prime location, right near the hotel check in and looks nice. It's open 24 hours, but the items aren't. I wanted a couple of smoothies to go late night to rehydrate, at like 2 am, and was told they don't do them until 6 am. I came back in the morning to get some before I checked out.   I tried the red smoothie and the tropical, 16 oz each. $11 a piece. Taste was lacking and not very cold. Would've been better off with a Jamba Juice. Seems like a tourist trap. Lobby location, nice look, high prices, subpar everything else. I'm sure if you want to get drunk at the bar, it's great, but there's plenty of other options for that.

z6yvKIatdMRujE0gG9QpKA.text: We ate the all American breakfasts on the lunch menu. Food was decent, but service was terrible. After being seated immediately we waited about 5 minutes as waiters were flying right by us without stopping, before going back to hostess stand and asking for a server. Manager came over and apologized and attempted to take our entire order without writing any of it down. A server stepped in to save him at the last second.   We never saw a server again until we had to flag someone down to ask for the check. A food runner brought our food to us in a timely manner but the server never came back to check on us.  It was as if his area was on the opposite side of the restaurant because we literally never saw him even though plenty of other servers walked past our table many times.

xR-eU0LOm8oz_2Vb5P4a4w.text: Great breakfast, quick service and our waiter was friendly and provided good advice about our adventures of the day.

GX623qh9S1eT0aTATGzoHQ.text: $50 for a plain lettuce wrapped burger, a few slices of grilled onion, garden salad, fries and coffee. The waiter was nice but service was slow. A waste of money but I was in a hurry and starving.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ymcXhUpuEos9bmd5mojm-w.text: I would highly advise not dining at Cafe Americano's patio. Our server, Allison, was fantastic but was setup for failure by her manager. She was the only waitress for the entire patio and received absolutely no help from the bartenders at the empty outdoor bar or manager. It took us over an hour to get a drink even though we could see our bottle of Rose sitting on the bar while the bartender did not lift a finger. After speaking to the manager about our experience he promised that he would be checking on us to make sure the rest of our dining experience went off without a hitch. He was never to be seen again.  The food was good though!

rWImJzeq76hGt48iO3JPqQ.text: Over cooked omelet and slightly burnt toast. No jam and very little filling in the omelette. Fruit bowl was good. Overpriced. Waiter was pleasant.

Q_jHB_frI06hObMqA5P60g.text: Walked in just for a late/early snack at 4:00am because only place open, came out  with amazing experience, starting from amazing food, awesome service by Daniel he was on point, anything we needed he took care of us, also management by Carlos is fantastic! Couldn't ask more from the place or employees if you have time make shure to stop by even if you're not staying at Ceasers palace!

_qXAaH0y5hv0pbeII3peHA.text: The food is great, but unfortunately the service is non-existent.  We waited over an hour for a BLT and roasted chicken.  The manager was less than helpful, although he did remove the charge of our food served cold.

nxWfaImvZnbRci0Q6JbDCg.text: This place is great, and the other yelpers must not have had our server, busser, and manager.  My cousin and I walked from MGM to Bellagio and were really hungry, so we hesitantly walked into Caesar's "Cafe." They only had 3.5 stars, and I saw on yelp that their service was bad and their food overpriced. SO WRONG. My cousin had the chicken fingers w/ fries and got like 4 different sauces for $16. Expensive? Wrong! It was so much food and she took half of it home so in my opinion, it was like an $8 meal. I'm vegan, but my server, despite needing to take an order for a table of 12, patiently explained to me even more vegan options which expanded my options to about 9. At a lot of restaurants I go to, servers typically just offer me 1-2 modifications with an attitude. I ultimately settled on the spaghetti with giant meatballs but got the meatballs replaced with veggies. Our server also made sure that they didn't put Parmesan cheese in my spaghetti and gave me bread and olive oil to replace the usual nonvegan garlic bread that comes with the meal. Service stayed good throughout the whole meal, even though the place was short-staffed as we later found out after having a chat with Suda, the manager. She said that three people called in sick probably because it was Christmas night. Anyway, I had a good experience overall and would give more than five stars if I could!

vzEe-IgiTAYX2UrEJX434Q.text: We went to Cafe Americano on a Monday for lunch, and got just what we wanted- a simple sit-down that served good food.  I had the chicken barbecue sandwich- a sandwich that features chicken with a guava barbecue sauce, cheese (I think it was Swiss), a fried onion ring, and bacon. All of this delicious middle was put in a sesame brioche bun. The chicken was tender, the bun sweet and fluffy, the bacon not too salty, and the onion ring on point. The only complaint I have is that they didn't put enough cheese on the sandwich, but it didn't make it or break it. All of this came with fries.  Overall, the service was good. The major issue that you will find in most of the bad reviews is that it's pricey. But with a sushi place selling 90 dollar sushi not too far away, I think that the prices are justifiable.

PG8rvTrSjXtXC3ZyAd0f9A.text: We visited here this evening. I ordered the blackened mahi tacos. They were the worst tacos i've ever had anywhere. The food is more pricey than is should be to begin with anyway. Our server took our order and never returned again until we needed the check. This is not worth the visit.

ntS53P6fDcpnl_EiC2rGuQ.text: I got food poisoning. Honestly there are way better places to eat in vegas. Would NOT recommend. And the BLT was soooo gross

jsRY5x6CleUv9O9uYjtCCA.text: This place was a great convenient location for me & my hubby to get a quick bite to eat before we headed out for the night on the town. We had the quesadillas and the guacamole to share together. Guacamole had a really great flavor and came with chips. The quesadilla was an excellent munchy option, it had chicken and jalapenos! Overall I recommend this place and make sure that you tip your server as they do provide great service.

The Cuban was delicious, martinis were made to perfection and the chocolate desert was incredible paired with the espresso martini (as recommended by Saul). Highly recommended!

pzu7z1vZKDKberDds1huXQ.text: By far the most overpriced breakfast I've ever had lol, but it's at Caesar's so whatever! I got the 3 egg breakfast with chicken sausage and sourdough toast and I absolutely loved it. Best hash browns I've had in years, the eggs were stupid fresh and the sausage was incredible. It had some kind of sweetness in it, probably apples. The service was pretty good although the waiter paid much closer attention to my male companion  I eventually got what I needed. The decor delighted me, their light fixture includes giant stacks of plates. Good was definitely better than the service and of course the location is perfect

XvQ3E4lPzAdkBXrDKG-Duw.text: Service took very long to get our food out, but they were definitely very quick to clean up our empty plates and keeping our water glasses full.   I would consider this very pricey for the amount of food for the price and taste, as many seemingly simple dishes were upwards of $24 a plate.  I got a box menu, which is a choice of two items on a designated menu. I chose the quinoa salad and the Cubano sandwich. The salad was mediocre at best, as it was very bland and lacking in depth and flavor. On the other hand, the cubano was crazy salty (and also made without mustard!) and dry. One bite is all it took to lose the integrity of the skin on the roof of my mouth.   My brother ordered "The Best Fried Chicken", which was not quite as great as the name suggests. It was reported to be "bleh" and dry.   Needless to say, we are going to venture out for some more food after this. So much hunger still.

id8rMIDE83SUSq_Dg1fXKA.text: real solid breakfast on the strip. There chorizo dish had some real flavor to it but you cant go wrong the pancakes.

fmQmpxKyYJ9RVOkNbj6Cww.text: The food was alright, but it was overshadowed by how rude the hostesses were (Jennifer and Stephanie).

sOu29vRphOLHM6jTelJEEQ.text: Greeted by a rude hostess names Fashka or something close. Didn't smile or greet any guests including us waiting in the VIP line. amTzL5Y-HtlIxJd4rawOEw.text: The staff was very friendly and prompt with our order. Ricardo was our server and he it the only reason they get 3 stars. He helped one of our party that is vegan find a great alternative. He really came through. Other than that. The beer is cold but the food is just ok. It doesn't help that it's $20+ for a sandwich that is not above mediocre. It would need to be amazing to justify that.

boC3s-cCMtRv_IRLDQViZg.text: I placed on order to go after a night of partying and gambling and the food was terrible. Everything taste extremely salty. I called the next day to complain and the manger Suda said "There is nothing she can do and that I waited too long to call and complain" I explained to her that I was up all day traveling to Vegas and that I didn't know that there was a time limit on a complaint. I stay at Caesars Palace all the time and I've never had food that bad and customer service so unwilling to listen to a complaint. I went as far as to tell her that I didn't eat the food and she said " There's nothing she can do". I refuse to ever eat at an establishment that has that kind of customer service.

auI0SuOcEPLnpSZMLYEjqg.text: 24 hours a day?!! How cool is that. Right in the middle of the lobby. Superbe location. The bar seats on the inside and out for best access and people watching. I was able to catch a quick snack or meal with my friends. The food was well made and tasty. Fresh and appealing. Homemade guacamole. Thick tomato slices. Perfect pizza with custom ingredients. I really appreciated the staff for their genuine hospitality and willingness to add sides when we wanted a little something extra. Great in every way.

aZniYWRf9cuOCkn2qTzKTA.text: Good food but very very expensive. Service was slow too which made no sense since was maybe 1/4 full with plenty of help around.   Ordered 2 burger/fries plates and had to ask for condiments.  Also got 2 stir fry (lunch menu) meals.   Food quality: 4 star  Service: 2 star  Cost: 1 star - ridiculously expensive. Our meals with tip were over $135

CIdmh5FktyaTUjs9l10u5w.text: We do not mind paying a little more for good food. Had omelette at $24 each and I can bet every casino chip I have that it was not cooked by a chef. Has browns were full of oil and potatoes hard. And if you advertise freshly squeezed orange juice please do not serve it from a Carton. So so disappointed. Avoid

oKVwhubpsodlTzAJ22Pmzw.text: Love the breakfast here. Yes, it's expensive but isn't it expensive almost everywhere else on the strip?! At first, I was surprised at the high prices but when the food got into my belly...it made me happy. The corned beef hash was delicious. I'm still day dreaming about it. The yogurt parfait was very good. Waffles were light & good. My mother in law & sis enjoyed breakfast and they also agreed, it was delicious. Service was attentive. I would definitely come back again when I'm at Caesars.

1nyoHTOox8felOPavF14uA.text: My friends and I were HANGRY on a Friday night so we stopped in this restaurant while walking through Caesars (it had no crowds, no lines, no wait). This place does not come close to any of the great restaurants in the area, but the price does not reflect that. We paid for mediocre, overpriced burgers and pastas which was a huge disappointment. Will not be back.  In hindsight, we should have toughened up and took our money elsewhere.

wkGpUuCdKp0qOcvUFgtI4g.text: Totally serviceable food at reasonable prices. Not gonna knock your sox off, but it gets the job done. Had a salad and an omelette here. No complaints.

EVYw_Dzgid9mBt_d6IfL7g.text: Unfortunately I ate here on fathers day.   I ordered the all American breakfast scrambled eggs with cheddar.  They only have white cheddar, weak.  Home fries came with sweet potatoes mixed in. That's fine with me but should be mentioned on the menu. The bad part was the home fries came out luke warm to cold.  The wifey ordered a salad with a mimosa. My son ordered 1 pancake, not the stack, sausage, and sliced bananas and Apple juice This meal came to $111... yes that is correct. Way over priced!

fsC6d6pOtY6MrJ3xbbMufA.text: It was my first trip to Vegas this week! We stayed at Caesars, and had an amazing experience! But by far the best part of my trip was the service I got from the bar at Cafe Americano! Patrick was so pleasant (fairly handsome as well) and the drinks were great! Props to him! I will definitely be back!

Cafe americano keep up people like Robbie around and u'll Have late ngt visitors all ngt Long! ND btw the roasted red pepper bisque

rxur1JOMUaBD1GYGLXumEg.text: I recently visited Vegas with my mom for her birthday. We stayed at Caeser Palace. We ate either breakfast, lunch and late dinners our entire stay. The clam chowder soup was the best I've ever tasted, the short rib nachos were delicious!! But most of all the service we received from our server Saoul and his manager we're impeccable, excellent, superb!! The bar star Chantel/Shantel made the best Cadillac Margarita I've ever tasted with sugar rim glass for me and salt for my mom!! She was a joy to talk to while sitting at bar and has a lovely attitude. I had her delicious potent drinks while dining and on the go!! I enjoy a good Margarita and hers was the best I've ever had in Vegas or any other city I've visited. Shantel and Saoul were the sole reason we ate their everyday during our visit, we couldn't get enough of this place!!! My mom and I had a great time and will most definitely be returning and staying at Caeser Palace! The breakfast and the New York Steak was also delicious!! Thank you all for making our stay and my mom's birthday rememberable!!! You ladies and Gentlemen ROCK!!! From daughter and her mommy!

4wSqp98Un-i3G_PO9-PY8Q.text: My first impression looking at the menu was wow this place will be fantastic food look amazing and I am sure taste fantastic but when seating down the server assistant ask if we would like coffee we said yes do you have cafe latte or cappuccino and the server assistant well what do you want to be that reply was extremely rude they way he said it

K1Yo85R4UfT9IsJOFTRxWA.text: Well if you can get past the over priced casual menu, maybe the almost average service will be acceptable.  When it came time to pay our bill we were asked cash/credit or room?  We were not given a bill but were told "about $50" (2 unsweetened teas, appetizer meatball and personal veggie pizza) so we handed him $60.   He came back and said "it was $52, thanks" and walked away just taking the change!!!!   The 3 stars were solely because the food was decent.   I failed to mention above the pizza was messed up and he tried to talk us into taking it anyway!!!!  Over priced and under delivered .....

__rO8i8-RILOQrauv_sxrA.text: We sat down at Cafe Americano after arriving In Vegas around 11:00 pm. We came in on Monday so most restaurants were closed at this time. The restaurant is located in the lobby of Caesars Palace. This honestly wouldn't normally be my first choice while In Vegas but I was pleasantly surprised. The bar seating was great for essential Vegas people watching and bartenders provided fast friendly service. The Cuban Sandwich I ordered on the bartenders recommendation was very tasty and definitely hit the spot after a long flight. The bread was the perfect amount of crispy and all the typical Cuban sandwich flavors were present. I would definitely eat here again for a quick bite if my choice of restaurants was limited.

ZF_x_r4MuZ2qgc_vRU-wpQ.text: Dear Saul (The amazing waiter),  You recommended the Clam Chowder. And in all my travels, even Seattle Washington itself... i have never had Clam chowder THAT AMAZING. I am a foodie at heartx food is a passion to be enjoyed not just consumed. And the Clam Chowder at Cafe Americano can only be described as Orgasmic. It gave me goosebumps with every bite. The broth is so flavorful, the fresh herbs added on top with the cripy fried bacon pieces gives it some bite and crunch. The whole baby clams, pieces of red and sweet potatoes gives it a noce rustic feel. Hands down... I will be having this again before i leave Legas. Saul... you are very knowledgeable about your menu and I can not thank you enough for an out of body experience.   Sincerely Tiffany Hall

go7-M3T7nckPbS1S6vuJUw.text: We ordered food and drinks at the same time. Our drinks came after 25 minutes. Our food came about 10 minutes later, and they got none of it right. In the meantime, two of our friends left because they weren't feeling well (it was a long travel day!). The restaurant couldn't cancel the food, but when we told the person dropping the food that they had left, she just took it away, and they didn't take it off our bill until we complained. The food was mediocre and cold. They wouldn't take off the beer for the guy who left ... understandable, but frustrating. It was literally 25 minutes. They said they'd take off the cocktail for the girl who left, since they never brought it. When the bill came, it still had their food and one of their drinks on it.

oxVKqScn30YAAKRu4Vlp8w.text: Great location Food tastes good Service was very questionable for the amount paid for meal. It appeared they had enough help but no drive. Would I come back probally not.

Dbdw9vWJSg4qkvwx-lNe-g.text: Good place. A little pricey, but what do you expect at Cesar's Palace?) I had a Salmon Poke Bowl. Very good dish and paired perfect with my wine. Service was friendly and prompt. I would visit again

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

NiwFDs0xsmB1UKY_VPoRLQ.text: Best clam chowder of my life.  My server recommended it as a meal rather than an appetizer, and he was absolutely correct. I'm stuffed but it was absolutely delicious. It was creamy And had bits of bacon and actual clams, that shivers were perfectly done.

vkRnV4n76iS9rOJz43tA7A.text: No complaints,  food was amazing, service was good and the environment was nice, there's not much else to say.

d2PN4iICNUuyb9PrO1QyOg.text: I would NEVER go there again, even if they said I could have free food for life! Last trip I had a pastrami sandwich for lunch and it was fantastic. I ordered another one this trip and it was so thick and chewy I could not eat 2 bites. The fries were soggy The place was not even half full, but The service was laughable (it was laugh or get frustrated) Walked out hungry and got a pizza.  Next day ordered a MEDIUM RARE burger. It came out well done, not juicy, no flavor just like spam. The tomato on the burger was half white and 1/2 inch thick - it was picked too soon and cut too thick. Why anyone would actually pick this piece of tomato up and proudly put it on a sandwich is beyond my comprehension! Obviously Quality Control is not discussed there. Soggy fries Sent it back  The water was cold and the bus boy was nice.

w5ypMX3_R2GN7lOJrYcIbw.text: Have to say sadly disappointed in food and service. Only check back was when we were done eating and both meals where underwhelming, both of us were done so meals couldn't be addressed. I'm not a fan of Denny's but I would have gotten a better meal and service.

dhlCbK02sN9j5wArNWU6Vw.text: This place was awesome....everyone  of the staff was friendly and more than willing to meet your every need.  Eddie was energetic  and a lot of fun as as Chantel. As we depart we engaged in two custom bloody marys...made by Kristina...which were Awesome. If yu are ever at Caesars Palace..this stop is definitely a  must.

kSJr_eFFaL9Ma5N1pnm2Eg.text: Very overpriced! $22 for basic breakfast and $8 for each additional side (bacon, potatoes, etc.) is even high for Vegas. We left and went to HashHouse A GoGo only 8 minutes away by walking.

IE7a_fPgFJVEP7PBCqOQuQ.text: There is one lady in management who is super rude. Not a shred of customer service. 110% sure she would not have spoken to me that way if her boss had been there.  Not worth going here. Everyone makes you feel like you're making them go out of their way to do their job. Thank you, Next. A million better restaurants in the area. Not worth it.

yy0eVPtrB3y7DrMUDI2ZxQ.text: This place sucks ass , inside a busy hotel , starving barley had anything ..... but no one is planning to serve us anytime soon ... still waiting 15 mins later .. people work here just passing by looking at us and not giving a flying fuck .. and who charges $50 for 3 eggs

SZmT4eFHY1ZSuRuBYG0s0A.text: I concur with the reviews regarding customer service and training.   My friend and I walked in and asked the hostess if they had soup, she nodded yes and then I asked her what kind. She showed us the menu and we decided on the Clam Chowder, we told her we wanted calm chowder, she then asked where we would like to sit and we told her the bar.   Couple mins later bar tender (super nice guy) showed up and asked us if we wanted anything and we told him no, we already had drinks and had placed our order.  10mins later I asked if they had a bread basket for people waiting on food..... the hostess went and got the manager who in a very condescending tone asked if we had food coming...we told her yes we had placed an order for soup   Another 10-15mins pass and she brings us the bread basket and informed us they were still making the soup...  another 10 mins pass and she asks the bartenders if we ordered soup through them, they both responded no. She then comes and tells us that there is no order for our soup and the hostess never put in the order.....  At this point I am pissed, my friend was hungry she had an extraction and could only drink soup... and I State that to the waitress who asked us if everything is okay. She ran back to the kitchen and reappeared with 2mins with the soup and bread...  And while the bartender was awesome he did charge my card for my friends soup and walked up with the receipt...my friend had cash in hand to pay him...  Bunch of errors, bunch of misunderstanding, the manager is super rude and condescending. Just awful experience.   Food was great, but I didn't order the soup and was charged for something I didn't personally place.

9DnCyIr67DrbmaQyrDfWfg.text: Food is pretty good. Had the fish & chips for lunch - 5 stars.  Had eggs over easy, hash browns, chicken sausage and sour dough toast for breakfast - 3 stars. Decent breakfast.

5ZvQ8VAD4K8s6nixNOMjVA.text: This is my favorite place for drinks and food on the strip! The wait staff is fantastic. Saul really took care of us. Drinks were on the house!! Love the location; right inside Caesars. So close to everything. 5 out of 5 would recommend!

-LNpF-_HzUmcAEpOIP9CiQ.text: Breakfast was amazing. So tasty and not like your usual breakfast spots. Packed house but super fast. Servers at the bar are amazingly friendly. Kristina was delightful!!! Definitely going to make this a breakfast stop every time we come to Vegas!

jnC3o00gq1KXE23-cIPZzA.text: Two of us were walking the Strip and stopped by for a drink and a snack.  We sat on the patio and got guacamole and chips, and 2 margaritas.   The bill was $48. Here's the thing, I am not complaining about the price - I realize it's expensive to eat and drink on the Strip. However, give me some value for my money - the margs were made from a mix with cheap tequila. If I am going to spend $15 for a cocktail, that's fine.  But: Make. Me. A. Cocktail.  By that I mean, put some tequila, triple sec and lime juice in a shaker and go to town on it. I can get the shitty marg mix anywhere.   Then there was the guac - it was so cold it was almost frozen, like it had been in the fridge since someone made it several hours earlier. Again, if I am going to spend $15 for an appetizer: Make. Me. A. Frigging. Appetizer.  Don't just go grab something out of the fridge that the crew on the last shift made.   Our server was a super nice guy, too bad the food and drink didn't meet up to the effort he put into giving us a good experience. I couldn't stiff him on the tip, so I added 20% and walked out of there $60 lighter and unsatisfied.  To be clear - I am not complaining about the price, it's the value that is lacking.  There are a lot of places on the Strip that I would go to before I went back to this place.

n4K3OfYsU7Ct91uBDgle7Q.text: Checked into the hotel at 4am and we were looking for a quick bite to eat in the hotel.  We went here because it was open.  Ordered a vegetarian pizza, $19 for a small size, and a cup of clam chowder, $17.  Three small bottled waters were $9.  The food was ok and was totally over priced.  Bartender acted like we were bothering him by ordering to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. $20 pizza

De2wYrNanx52l5UDevq_xg.text: Stopped in Saturday night for a snack with some friends before we hit the casino and encountered the worst service ever. I do have to say that the cocktail I had and the Hangover Burger were delicious. There were several bartenders and the male bartender made a great drink. The "service" we received from the female brunette bartender however ruined all of our experiences. She was completely rude from the moment she threw menus at us to when we received our check mid meal. A girlfriend and I ordered our drinks and a burger to share. This bartender brings our checks and we pay. While we are eating she demands we settle up on the beer we ordered. Well we didn't order a beer. Another friend directly next to us did. When we tell her "the beer belongs to him" She exclaims "I don't care, your together so you're responsible." She didn't even give the person who ordered it, the opportunity to pay. The way she talked to us stayed with our entire group and here it is 4 days later and I still feel upset about it.

IE9HvdScCMi7AYOvZ2g0Kw.text: I did not intend to come here but rather found a friend who had wandered in after a night on the town.  I didn't order food bc of the hastiness of my situation and the price (omg everything is so expensive), but I did have the rest of my friends pancakes which I must say were amazing!  The service was also incredible even though I was just having water.  The waitress was very attentive.  The atmosphere, for a side hotel restaurant that's open 24 hours was very inviting and upscale in nature.  Idk about the other hours of the day but at 2:30am, this place was on point.

csl8tHlwy2-spp_bI9bA6Q.text: This is one of the best restaurant in Vegas! Quality and service rival the strip but at a lot lower price point. We had the Salmon and who knew Raspberry paired with it. Awesome! Short ribs better than some I had in LA.  Don't miss this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon and Short Ribs

wxJusw-PsjG0EZrhJ5lmmQ.text: Food is ok.  Over priced.  Smell in dining area is disgusting.  Smells like a dirty grease trap. Only 24. Hour place in ceasars for food.

SJnDyfV30ouhWMCRyGyzZQ.text: Ordered breakfast. the portions are huge. The corn beef hash is a little on the greasy side but delicious. Order poached eggs rather than scrambled with corn beef. The bagel salmon combo was also good.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish and chips
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Smoked salmon bagel

UmWEqL9e7Bp4sWxuqw_IQQ.text: When you're on the strip, everything is overpriced. Spent the morning at Ceasar's palace and stopped by Cafe Americano on the way out for some brunch. Ordered the American breakfast plate (I think that's what it was called), a mimosa and hubby ordered the huevos rancheros with a green smoothie. Overall, the food is really good. Fresh ingredients for sure. My hubby mentioned the huevos rancheros was one of the best he's ever had, so that definitely says something. My plate was traditional and boring, but it was also very good.   Walked out spending $80. Expensive for sure. We realize that we could've just went back to our hotel and had the brunch/breakfast buffet for $35.   With everything else that the strip has to offer, I probably won't be back any time soon.

c1l73aGXjNI1P4bsQ0LjQw.text: What an amazing 24 hour cafe. It's more of a 24 hour hipster restaurant. Very trendy decor and good food.  Thank you for the awesome service Saul.

VXh8jy9qU3BOKNbqd9-yng.text: Our server was awesome.   We had a suite at the hotel and walked down to eat at somewhere quick....we wanted not to pricy since our dinner last night was almost $400... We both got a blue berry martini and my friend ordered the club sandwich and I just had the French Onion Soup....total was $72 :/  ...I personally felt that was kinda steep for a soup, sandwich and drink.... but the manager Adrian was awesome and came and greeted every table and was so awesome and patient and cool with my silly friend.  It really was great food though and awesome customer service.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

43SounQ3J689oySQFRpmRA.text: Visited this spot twice while staying at Caesars. Breakfast wasn't very good and was very expensive. The prices are a bit over the top for diner type food. However, the food does taste fresh and hits the spot. Breakfast wrap had too much arugula, not Enough eggs. The hash browns were cooked well. The portions are at least very large- great for sharing! Wouldn't come back for breakfast, but I would recommend lunch, casual dinner or post drinking grub. The burger and fries were excellent and the Mac n cheese very delicious. If the prices were less I would be more inclined to eat here. These prices are higher than any other casino diner I've been to in vegas. Don't come out of your way to eat here, but it's convenient if staying at Caesars.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Split breakfast wrap- sizes are large so good for sharing. Pretty bland overall. Too much arugula

6Dr46fvbskuExNLlBSglwg.text: Food was good. A little more pricey than what I would normally pay for breakfast but because of the hour that I went to eat, I kinda had to deal with it. Had the Brooklyn sandwich with hash browns. The sandwich was huge and I felt I was eating 4 or 5 Breakfast Jacks. The hash browns were not crispy. If you like them crispy, let the waiter know. My waiter was a little creepy. Just caught this weird vibe. He kept hovering and asking me if everything was ok and stuff. Used to people checking on me once after delivering food but not more than that. Perhaps because there were only 3 tables occupied he didn't know what else to do.  I'm not sure I would eat there again. Maybe I'll go walk to a nearby hotel to find something a little cheaper. Food was good but after tip, $30 for a breakfast sandwich was a little much.

1FhDZ8yp24Abta9PrsDHog.text: I was in Vegas for the first time a couple weeks ago and I highly recommend this place to anyone. The food was amazing, the drinks were fabulous, and the service was outstanding. We had a group and we ate here twice and sat at the bar and got drinks one night as well. The service given to us by Taton, Eddie, and Saul was some of the best service I've had in my life! I have been encouraging anyone going to Vegas to stop here and at least get a drink if not sit down for the whole deal. It is worth the money! Thank you so much for the experience, great food and atmosphere!

qrhOmGh_6i8NkMrJDmO5DA.text: The ambiance was great but the food took forever, was served very cold and they upcharged each person us $9 a person to add one meatball (yes ONE) to a very small portion of pasta. Extremely disappointed and will not be returning.

yB3l9uWDKdjpviiH6RC5Gw.text: Ok, so we're staying at Caesars, needed food. We found this place. Not only was the food fresh and amazing, the staff (Angela & Michael outside) rocked out worlds! I had the Mahi Mahi and my man had the Mahi tacos . Super moist fish with rad Quinoa! Steve the manager was great! This place is a bang for your buck! Loved it!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mr Bigshot &amp; Angela the bartender
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Me &amp; Steve, the manager
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JmzpdEAMeMVCW3p5lGHCXg.text: I needed something to eat in a hurry to hadn't yet discovered the Forum Food Court in Caesars, so I stopped by this place (because it's in the lobby and one of 1st places you see... plus, it is open 24 hours). I ordered a BBQ chicken breast sandwich. The chicken breast was thick and juicy, grilled very nicely and basted (not drowned) with BBQ sauce. I could've done without the horribly over-fried onion ring on top, but it was a a really good sandwich overall. The fries weren't bad either.   The staff here does the bare minimum. We decided to eat at the bar instead of take it to go and not once did anyone stop to offer us napkins/condiments or ask if we wanted a drink.

qU3rx1K7k5FifhJ9at1Y0A.text: Hash browns cooked in burnt oil, tasted funny. 2 Mahi fish taco (small for $26) were old (tasted dry and had fishy smell). Overall not a good experience. Oh- cranberry juice was $8 for 4 ounces. Ouch.

nL8tzWvMTmzbyWKHGaJgcw.text: What a horrible experience we received this morning. Based on the bartenders treatment I can't really say how their food and drinks taste. My friends and I went into this establishment at 3 am we had just came in from out of town and were excited to have our first drink. We sat down and were reading the menu that was on the bartop. We were deciding on which drinks to order. I noticed the bartender busy pouring Hennessy, he then walked over to the guests next to us and he didn't make eye contact. I tried making eye contact with him he ignored my friends and I. It was about 3:15 so I just explained to my friends that he was busy and he would get be right with us. He didn't acknowledge us or make any time of effort to talk to us at any point of our visit. Then two gentlemen walk to the bartop and sat right next to us and he immediately served him that's when we got upset. We left at 3:33 am that's how long we waited for service. I recorded him so management can take action on his discriminative behavior. He definitely needs to be trained on hospitality and how racism and discrimination isn't part of the service industry. His lack of hospitality was vividly demonstrated last night, I'm sure this wasn't the first time he has done this. I work in the service industry and I know exactly what he was doing. He was picking and choosing who he was wanted to serve. I wouldn't want for anyone else to experience such discrimination. I would hope management will take my post seriously and have a conversation with him. **It won't let me post the video however if management will like to view it you may contact me.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lQPU0NUoInzKhQF63K7egA.text: Great place, good food and drinks overall awesome service! Tayton was an excellent bartender very attentive and drinks were awesome.

igJa4262dLcquoMf-QrcZg.text: Saul is an amazing server!! He is super personable and made great suggestions for delicious food and cocktails! We will be back for sure, and will be looking for Saul!!

OejYfYYvxLvCmzsznNMJYw.text: Ate here late at night and the bartender (I think his name was Tray) was AMAZING!!! I have some dietary restrictions and he was so helpful to get me what I could eat even with the limited late night menu. He spent time talking to my group and really took care of us. Great guy!

MbevRaTfFOeFsFp6rhLQQA.text: GLUTEN FREE TOAST WAS FANTASTIC SURPRISE! Fast, efficient, wait was 15 minutes  when loaded with a line. Waiter Noe A = subtle but not pushy, observant, super efficient and friendly with a smile.   Breakfast seemed pricey, but the 3 meat omelet, excellent, was half a dinner plate,  3" thick and loaded. Hash-browns covered the other half of the plate, cooked perfectly. Big guys, this will fill you up.   Mango smoothie was tasty and not too sweet. Probably too filling for me along with a huge omelet. I managed to finish the toast, omelet, and smoothie, just had no more room for the hash browns. With no refrigerator in the room, I had to leave them. There really was enough for two people.  People with smaller appetites should ask if they can split the omelet. If you can, this suddenly becomes the best and most affordable breakfast outside of House of Blues for Defcon people, and much closer to the conference. Not sure if they will let you carry out, but that would be amazing.

dI0BBlF_UDkfcEfbEuxPwA.text: Our server, Saul was excellent!  He took his time to connect with us and his service was beyond compare.  When in Vegas, please come to Cafe Americano and ask for Saul!!!!!

qliNoy9wOaSn6ixdcyfF2A.text: Saul was incredible, he recommended the fish and chips. So good. We'll definitely be coming back.

u2lCX_j0M_nETpgJ0LY8zA.text: I ordered a few drinks with my boys Tayton. He made the best AMF I've EVER had... EVER. Extremely happy, pleasant, and cheerful; Even at 4am! As a local, I know it's hard to find bartenders like this. I will definitely come back to this place. It's hard to find people like this on the strip.

CTA96uVrxJjP-l3f5BXB0g.text: When I stay at Caesars Palace I always have my breakfast at Cafe Americano, the food is great and the service is even better. Richard, Freddie and Christina always take very good care of me. If you're staying at Caesars Palace I highly recommend you have breakfast, lunch or dinner at Cafe Americano. You won't be disappointed!

dXzu9d9rbriguM7Mm0tqQg.text: Price is expensive but the food is really good. I have been there for breakfast and late night dinner . The short ribs nachos are to die for! We had 4 people and couldn't finish it . It's huge! The fried chicken sandwich is good also. They have a special where you get half a sandwich and salad (they have different options too) for 24 dollars !

lYtyPqDxmjnfIdkAaUPGhw.text: This is one of our favorite places to eat when we come  to vegas. The food is amazing and the service is outstanding.  Saul S has become our favorite server by far.  He always knows what we want and our beers get served instantly as we walk in the door. We highly recommend this place.  And ask for Saul!!

XU7ldyXNMlF-MsD0hfz4OQ.text: Been here before and service was pretty good but today they seemed to be understaffed service was very slow had to flag down to get coffee after over 10 min.  Flag down to order another  another 10 min. Table next to us sat down 15 min. after us and got there food first when our food arrived it was warm at best. Very disappointed.

-ggNZ77Ul_6P1xaAThUUhg.text: We chose this restaurant because we were seeing a show nearby and the menu offered a nice variety of choices. The atmosphere inside was very cool and our server Saul was excellent. If we're ever back at Caesar's Palace, this restaurant will certainly be on our list.

EAoEsw4fQmgXByB3XOzRNw.text: Saul is the most awesome waiter. He was super accommodating for our big party. The food was fabulous!  We had a great time and completely enjoyed our time here.

z3VVFs3WkkkfeKvovrwfLQ.text: We are always sure to make Cafe Americano one of our stops when we're in Vegas.  They have a diverse menu, taking some of your favorite dishes and adding their unique spin. This visit our server Saul introduced us to their amazing nachos and one of the best fish and chips we've ever had!  Cafe Americano has an upscale design, but is very relaxed.  We feel like the pricing is representative of the quality of food and service that you receive.

_VxuUomcNoF3UV_tuZDttA.text: My BF and I stopped in for a drink after an afternoon bus tour of the city. The drinks were fine, but I had to contest the bill. I had ordered a Cosmopolitan, which was offered as $13.00 on the drink menu. The bill had the charge of $13.00 plus a $3.00 up charge. When I asked our bartender about the additional $3.00, she said the prices had changed and their menu had not been updated yet. I reminded her that I ordered a $13.00 Cosmo as advertised on the menu, and that is what I expected to pay. She took it up with the bar manager, and adjusted the bill accordingly. In the end, I was charged fairly, but this "bait and switch" left a bad taste in my mouth. There are too many other reputable bars on the strip that don't use these shady sales tactics.

gj94aAt6df2lRuAfAZb4Hw.text: We got "late night food" here.. More like 4am after Drai's food. This was the first thing we ran into after Drai's across the street. We had a caesar salad, chicken tenders and an american breakfast. All were delicious and hit the spot! Our server was very sweet and made sure to keep our coffee cup full. We appreciated that so much! I would recommend this restaurant for those who want a late night snack or a quick bite to eat.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tJ2DUYJDhJvJ_k6CQt8vqQ.text: We went here on a Friday at 8pm. We got seated at a dirty table where the people were barley getting up from their meal. The place was dead and I should have taken that as a sign. We placed our order for drinks and dinner at the same time. It took 20 MINUTES for a glass of champagne and a margarita. When the bar was so slow. Our server was trying too hard to make it sound funny it took so long which was something we were not happy about. It took a while

e3uGhMkSP-R2y67bw2v4Vg.text: Stopped in for drinks before dinner at Hell's Kitchen. Specialty drink menu is extensive and creative. I had the Cape Codder which was a good mix of sweet and sour. Hubby had two Caipirinha's - the national drink of Brazil and they were delicious.   Jessica - our waitress was personable, friendly and speedy with the drinks without pushing for more orders. The football game was on the TV and the patio wearer was perfect. Music was a touch loud for intimate conversations but it worked and was lively.   Definite thumbs when waiting for the Absinthe shoe or dinner reservations. Thanks Jess!

EJonqsO_jQqZAhZbX-BlCw.text: Good option when you want quick food and awesome service! The ropa vieja nachos were bomb. Avoid the chicken fingers. Tacos are a winner. Saul is the best waiter!!

0SfRwI-0o1eg7CLP75nYYQ.text: Friendly service. Bar and drinks are top notch! Loved their Blueberry Lime Drop Martini.

M_mB-v1_05plEb1uaoLKgg.text: We went in for breakfast and the food was so good. Everything was flavored well and they are very accommodating on food requests. The service was amazing! Gustavo was one of the best servers we've ever had. All of the staff were helpful and kind. It's a wonderful ambiance that is moderately priced. I would recommend this to everyone and we will definitely be back again soon! Thank you!

RPnOhxGGWsnAs_NNRUY6yg.text: Was able to reserve a table last minut. Food is good. Friendly server...................

_zrjB72gAHVjayLGtroa7g.text: If you mind waiting in a super long line this place is for you. Get there before 10 in the morning for no wait. And they have a membership where you can get first seating which sucks if you just want breakfast in your hotel. The food was pretty high but it's all based on your preference. It's ok to try but I wouldn't go there again for breakfast specifically while in Vegas. Try some other places and step out of your hotel! They put sweet potatoes in your fried which wasn't bad but I wish they would have mentioned that on the menu. First time for everything though. They do stay open all day which is nice when coming from a night out.

Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wTxKscBUelw4hH_qBJnJTw.text: Open 24 hours! No wait to be seated. Fresh and delicious coffee. Steak and eggs! Potato medley. Sourdough toast! Our server was great! She kept the coffee coming.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs!
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No wait!
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cafe Americano! Fresh and delicious! No wait!

PAojJUPBWBijcnCaA5Hhww.text: This spot is located in the Caesars and open 24/7. It's extremely pricey so be prepared. I ordered the fish taco, which came with 3 tacos. It was ok I've had way better, the price is $16. I doubt I'm coming back here for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos

oEmb9eHXGvj5f-zDRTigWw.text: Great service, meatballs were fantastic! Chris, Jon and Dave were fabulous! I highly recommend hanging at this bar.

TugZuoMTHJtEsAI8quxfVA.text: The food was very good  was it worth the price um NO. I got the fish and chips which was good. My daughter got the chorizo tacos which she sent back. Even the server sad it wasn't good. She ended up having the spaghetti which was good.

sq1vZQV-cNAnFexbdKOKew.text: The food was incredibly expensive and you do not get what you pay for. I ordered the huevos rancheros which was very bland and it was not hot. I also order the French toast as dessert and I did find that much more enjoyable then the rancheros but would probably never order it again. My friends ordered the steak and eggs and they said the steak was very dry and their skillets also did not come out hot. I'd rather eat breakfast at Starbucks for 1/3 the price and their breakfast sandwiches actually come out hot.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

dyJRCz7D3ng0W-fmIRNH1Q.text: Before your jaw drops because you're spending $22 on an omelet, remind yourself that it's Vegas and if you want somewhere with a great waitstaff, tasty food, & beautiful atmosphere, it really can't be helped.   Super happy and impressed with our service and experience here! The line to be seated moved fairly quickly & our server, Maggie K, was very kind. We had a round of margaritas first which started the breakfast off on the best note. My water glass was never empty, thanks to the multiple assistant servers & the meal itself was perfect. You really can't go wrong with over easy eggs, bacon, hash browns, & toast but WOW they hit the spot. I don't know what they do to their hash browns in particular but they stole the show.   I saw someone walk by with a breakfast burrito that I will be back to try sometime!

Pa2Awv72YnZoEVkuJnuQCg.text: I ate at this place on 6/27/19 during my stay at Cesar's. I have never heard of it, or tried it, but I was looking for a quick and easy light dinner option. We ordered 2 appetizers, some meatballs and a chicken quesadilla, with 1 margarita and 1 other cocktail. The meatballs were not hot, almost cold, and the chicken quesadilla was very bland. The margarita was also awful, and tasted like a bad sugary limeade without alcohol. After a completely mediocre meal, we were slapped with a 70 dollar bill for 2 appetizers and 2 drinks! Needless to say, I was shocked at the prices for such terrible food and drinks. I will absolutely never go back. I ate the next day at The Wynn and had a delicious meal for only 56.00. Go elsewhere if you want good food.

Thz77m7Sjtc2EbryZu_Mpg.text: OMG! I can't tell you how nice a time we had here... Saul S. was amazing, I didn't know exactly what I wanted and his recommendations were spot on.  Home run!

rq34I4fsAhpfv_gVI8zndw.text: Food is subpar, management is kind of pushy to get you to order more expensive items...one even said "if you want cheaper pizza there's a food court ". That's no way to treat a customer. Probably won't come back but like Vegas it's very hard to get into good cuisines so I just might have to :/

7JzXzOKOnpwe9OLQDQTY-Q.text: We ate breakfast here every day of our stay because of the convenience, service & all around good food. We were lucky every time we arrived as we were seated within a few minutes each visit.  Their eggs benedict was my favorite. Crispy, light, fluffy English muffin topped with ham, perfectly poached egg & hollandaise. Annnd perfectly cooked hash browns! Yum-O! I did try the lox & bagel & was very underwhelmed. So much so that I stopped eating & picked from H's plate. The OJ was very fresh, cold & delicious & the coffee some of the best I've had in Vegas.   The staff was phenomenal! Very attentive even though they were packed & very friendly. So while Caesar's closed my favorite breakfast cafe, this is a nice alternative.

e9J-DLvjMaFfJc_H9oFnjQ.text: Our waiter saul  was amazing made me feel at home highly recommend you asking for himTheir nachos are the best nachos in vegas!! And they have a great late nite snack I enjoy their wings.

EEW_GqOIUPNx7qUaWkjFAg.text: Food is amazing! Saul was the best waiter. He was kind and respectful. He made us want to come back everyday! Best waiter we have ever had! The nachos were also sooooo amazing, I definitely recommend! If you are at the Caesar palace you have to come here you can't pass! Has everything you like! Best place ever!! Amazing!

TcfHFof452sytxC5KeeZWA.text: I'm only giving Cafe Americano a 1 Star because that's the lowest rating Yelp allows me. The seating process was not complicated, but it was inefficient. We went New Year's night. It was busy, but the lines were only 3-4 families deep and there were plenty of open tables. We got on a seating list and told it would be 30 minutes.  An hour later, with no contact from the hostess, we asked what the issue was. She told us that "something broke" in the kitchen and they were no longer going to seat us.  This "midnight snack" would have cost us at least $200 with a party of six and pancakes costing $20! Fresh fruit would have been $25. I don't mind the high prices, but with $$$ should come courtesy, consideration, and customer service.   There were no apologies...."we can no longer seat you, something broke in the kitchen." Not acceptable... not after an hour of waiting.

yNFAXkCc9F8hasEDkd4tDw.text: Wonderful service and even more wonderful food! If you can, ask for Saul who is an utter treasure.  Definitely recommend

21xfUCJ6xxMGoiMepqQr0Q.text: This place had terrible service. The managers mom was sitting on the table next to us. They not only ignored us, but our food came out before our drinks. The food was cold too. Wings were under cooked. Cesar salad wasn't even mixed properly, beer came with hair in it. Not even an apology. Stay away

0NbDCmSA_0nvdmPA-7rqjA.text: I have ate here twice, once for breakfast and this time for dinner. I will always remember two things about it, overpriced and the food isn't that great. It's basically a 24-hour tourist trap. And, it's independently owned so you won't get any Total Rewards credits for eating here. The bill was about $75 (including tip) for one beer and two hamburgers. The hamburgers did come with french fries that were OK. I ordered my burger medium and it came out well done. I only ate half of it. And, seriously when I eat there are maybe two crumbs left on a plate. The service wasn't great either. Overall, save your money and try a different restaurant. There are plenty to choose from in Vegas!

5IcGwAbiBUnlq1rwbHEgxQ.text: Has a good experience here. I was tired from traveling and didn't want to expend too much brain power figuring out what to eat so I just went to the lobby and found this place. Amazing service! Water glass always full, perfect pacing, polite and efficient. Manager stopped by to ask how it was going (I always love that!!). I had the all American breakfast and all was delicious and cooked perfectly. My guest has the wedge salad and that was superb was well. Loved the presentation. No issues and a good spot for a wide variety of options.

dIOr9ximM2oMLaxofeR3Tg.text: This place is in the lobby at Caesars!  I Grabbed a bite here for dinner at the bar. I Was simply looking for a quick burger or fries, and on Ryan the bartender's recommendation, I tried the patty melt.  It was absolutely fantastic.  Like--melt in your mouth insanely good and I'm irritated with myself that I didn't go back and have it again for breakfast today before leaving Vegas!  Great open bar--plenty of people watching, and super attentive bartending staff.    It's NOT CHEAP and you can expect to pay $20-$25 for a burgers and fries --but it's convenient and delicious ..and considering the location .....when in Rome!    Delish!!

dB_86T9pYPA9wcJPim79pw.text: Tayton K. was a great bartender/ server! Very personable and friendly. Would definitely return. The food and drinks were also a great ending to our night. Thank you, cafe americano!

6J9cZ-QjVEu_L9-BJkukxQ.text: I love that this is open 24 hours a day all day everyday. Even in Vegas sometimes I find the shops and restaurants aren't open long enough for me. We were staying in the Augustus tower which is right next to this restaurant. It was the obvious choice for breakfast. I'm glad I had us head down at 8:30 AM on a Saturday because there was a huge line around 9 AM. We both ordered mimosas and the breakfast sandwich. The sandwich was very filling and so delicious with everything you could want in a breakfast sandwich. We'd definitely eat here again for any meal if we can get a table.

-Og2dznDjpK7bfsj1uwhZA.text: The late night wait staff was nice.  Period.   We went in because nothing else was open after a concert.   My girlfriend had a pepperoni pizza that tasted worse than worst cardboard flavored frozen pizza.   It was really, really bad.  I had the spaghetti and giant meatball which is something that I never order.  It was like getting a Chef Boyardee crater with a giant round cold meatloaf meteor in the crater.  Nasty alien stuff.   To add injury we were looking at a $50+ bill for the crap.   All I can say is plan ahead if you need to eat late at Caesars.  You have been warned.

saPvF7cJHke7uppuJSOo3Q.text: We ran into this place by accident after a Plain White T's show. Thank God we did. Food was amazing.  The short rib nachos on the appetizers menu is to die for. Sooooo good!!! The staff here is very good, we had Jessica Y, feels like we have known her for years. Very personable. I highly recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_Ph9v8MA45ZTL-8R-iJNWQ.text: Stopped by Cafe Americano for a breakfast after early arrival to Las Vegas.   Cafe Americano located right by the main entrance to Caesars Palace casino and it is open 24 hours. The menu is reasonably concise and makes selection easy. I had traditional Eggs Benedict, which was served with the potato hash. Hash was perfectly crispy and very well seasoned (this is not always the case -I'm sure you can relate to that). The eggs were just a touch overlooked, and would wish for Hollandaise sauce pour to be a bit more generous, but overall it was quite tasty dish (I'm somewhat nit picking here).  What I have a problem with is prices - I know it is Las Vegas, but $22 for eggs Benedict is steep (I guess I can live with $5 coffee as it comes with refills). Interestingly enough, pasta dish on dinner menu costs $25 - hard to figure out pricing strategy.  Well, during the late night, this might be your only option anyway...

XLB0d1PRuhyuO4v-L2sV1A.text: Please don't be fooled by its great location of right inside Caesar lobby.  Terrible service.   7 friends ordered 7 dishes plus a pecan pie. After an hour of waiting, the waiting brought out 6 dishes (missing one order) plus a crumble looking pie. Turns out Two out of six are completely wrong orders. And when we questioned if it's a pecan pie, they asked us to cut into the pie open to double check - turns out it's a peach pie! What a surprise.  .....  Finally we received three correct orders plus a pecan pie.  .....  Truly a h-angry and befuddling experience

3pB6xv8-pfhCK_ihLJb_wQ.text: This place was just okay. We went to the 8PM show over at Absinthe (totally recommended!!) and then were looking for a quick bite to eat. Enter Cafe Americano, which was right outside the door and advertised being a 24-hr place. We decided to grab a seat on the patio, so we could share a hookah while we hung out. The price was pretty steep (like $40 if I remember right... about 3x a normal place, but hey, it's Vegas, so I get it), and we went for the apple+mint combo, which to be fair, was great. I ordered a glass of prosecco that was absolutely flat when I got it.. The fish and chips I had were delicious, but the breading on the fish was REALLY heavy. I'm not sure I'd order it again because it was a bit much for me.   About an hour into our evening, they began shutting the patio down. The hookah (understandably) can't be moved inside, so we had to finish up and get on our way. All in all, it's a fine place to stop if there's not much else open. Our check was split 3 ways and for the items I've described here, I paid about $70. It was the most expensive meal I had in Vegas and probably one of the least impressive. To be fair, though, it included hookah, which was kind of a fun experience.

t9ydkmSmNzdB3il86UAErQ.text: Eat somewhere else if you value your money.  I ordered the clam chowder. $19 for maybe a cup of liquid, two clams, 4 pieces of potato and some bacon slivers. And a slice of sourdough dripping in oil/ butter, it was hard to tell, it was so greasy.  I think Caesar's is trying to get out of bankruptcy on this one meal.  Like Oliver in the Dickens take, "Please Sir, I want more".

9zKEbT-smjylb6q0BOwmyw.text: Too expensive for what they serve but it's Vegas and late night at a casino not much options unless you drive. That's why all Vegas casino food places are a rip. Very few bargains left for food choices on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My 25 dollar burger and fries/ worthy maybe $10 but not $25 they sure love to gouge you just because it&#39;s in a casino.

Furybr5ndJSKcdWLAizMjw.text: Came for breakfast and it was amazing!!! Pricey definitely, but well worth it!! They have different type of dishes than what is normally at breakfast places but I highly recommend trying it if you are in the area

LTAvbD-RgpEQLR2JaFD59g.text: I am going to come out right away and say the Cafe Americano's food and service is solid for a lobby restaurant, significantly better than its predecessors Central and Augustus Cafe.  I understand the nature of commerce. This is a prime space in the most iconic hotel in the world. Im not cheap and we spend a shitload on our Vegas trip.  $6.00 for fountain drink $15. 00 for bread pudding dessert $24 for Pulled pork sandwich and small portion fries $19 for 4 whole chicken wings split in half.  That is greed at its finest. Even for Vegas standards, its an obscene joke.

b-UfxgKuMhPFQVpQ-iNfAg.text: Good food but over priced.  Had the buffalo wings you get 8 in order and they are above average in size for. Hi ken wings.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffalo Chicken Wings.

9-Ul03AUJCxVLpq3k8cpMQ.text: The only reason I gave this restaurant 2 stars instead of 1 is because of the setting.  The food is bad and the bloody marys were the worst I've ever had in my life.  Top that off with outrageous prices and you've got a recipe for a very expensive disappointment.

M6oapxcr-xP7pAENgHepGw.text: Wife and I had the same breakfast, 3eggs over easy, ham, home fries, toast, and coffee for 60$ plus tax, plus tip. No matter how good the breakfast is, I cannot give more than 2 stars. Very very overpriced. Next time I will look at the menu before I am seated....Live and Learn !!!

yf4wgMFLZaIKG6Mh5VsTVw.text: Why do they have to overprice such bad food ? At least serve decent food if you are charging $130 for a breakfast for 4 people. I'll rather make my eggs  in the sun on the asphalt than dining here again.

fRDB736lysQ1FqDhl2afpQ.text: Had the pleasure of watching the super bowl here today! Drinks and food were delicious.  Jose our server provided 1st class service and was attentive and friendly.  The best nachos we've ever had!!!  Such a fun and pleasant experience.  5 star service and food!!!

mi4tQZnUEJX1HP-ohcXWMQ.text: We stayed at Caesar's palace and Cafe Americano is located within. Tried this the last day I was there. Qabxp8jA14r2s0HqbV6arw.text: I ate here twice on my recent stay. They have outside and inside seating.  Service is great!  Food can be a bit pricey, but not terrible.  I had the Brooklyn Breakfast Sandwich both times.  It is HUGE.  Comes with two very large pieces of bacon, cheese, ham and huge egg patties, as well as a side of homefries or hashbrowns.  If you're hungry, this sandwich won't disappoint.  I couldn't finish it the first time I went, but finished it the second time.  This place is located in Caesar's Palace lobby near the check-in desk.

_3MxXJB1SFGV7uYXYwjpEQ.text: This restaurant is way too overpriced, the burgers are average, in n out burgers are way better. I got the hangover burger and the braised pork in it was soooo hard. I really recommend not coming here because the food isn't really that good and the price is definitely not worth the average quality u get. I only rated it 2 stars just for the food service, other than that, this place is not worth the money. $25 for a piece of shit burger!

asMd4GdIl4f3uDpuSoTm_g.text: Great food! 45 -50 minute wait was irritating. $28 smoked Salmon bagel was a bit high. Our first $100 breakfast. My son wolfed down his breakfast sandwich...Pancakes were really good. Worth going to once

lqH8y2o-RAT3dWDHLoso_Q.text: We are locals but sometimes go to the strip for lunch.  I mainly eat chicken and thought a burger would be a nice treat. $24 for fries and an overcooked, dry burger on a too thick bun was a poor choice.   My friend ordered  a BLT, $25. It was served on 2 slabs of brioche bread, extra lettuce, a minimal amount of tomato and bacon. His side salad was a few bites of various greens.   $5.50 for his after meal coffee.  Not worth $59 plus tip. We liked the music but it was so loud we could hardly  hear each other or the severs. They had to talk louder and we did too when placing our order.   As locals I doubt we will eat there again or take visiting family or friends either.

VUb1y_spPvco68wm0sE1Gg.text: Had a quick lunch in this location.  The food was good and was a very large portion. I opted for the Cuban with fries.  There was a large group of us there for lunch, but the amount of time it took for burgers, Cuban, and BLT sandwiches was on the border of too long.  We did have a good server who was working hard to get orders in and keep drinks filled.  There was nothing that was horrible about the location, food or service, but nothing that really stood out to me so that is where the 3 stars came it.  It was convenient as well as not too busy for lunch so we were able to talk and catch up.

Y5jCS2yHvxRBGaf_-uUEfQ.text: Let me just get to the worst part. The rudest thing I ever witnessed from a server.   Me and my boss was in the middle of ordering and the server stopped looking at us and turned his head to watch the game. My boss had to stop midsentence because he was no longer paying attention to us...   I was shocked. He was completely rude to us. All your employees were so focused on the damn soccer game that we were 2nd. Maybe if your staff can't handle TV's around them, it should be turned off.   Horrible service!!!!!

lXbIfmLjavK78xv9Br6TcQ.text: At our recent stay at Caesar's Palace, my wife and I had the pleasure of having breakfast at Cafe Americano.  Excellent food at a reasonable price.  But I also have to mention and applaud the excellent service by the staff.  We had the pleasure of having Kristina Hernandez as our server.  She was excellent. Kristina was extremely helpful with menu options which was important since my wife is on a gluten free diet. In addition, she was extremely personable.  We were so impressed and pleased with Kristina that we requested that we be seated in her section for the rest of our trip.  Kristina and the rest of the staff will make your meal an enjoyable dining experience.  Also want to give kudos to Jessica who served us dinner at Terrazzo, the outside cafe. She was fun and very helpful in assisting my wife with gluten free dinner choices.

B41VN-aFQqbAqmGGVo8ugw.text: We stopped in for something light and a few cocktails. Our waiter, Saul, explained his favorites on the menu and gave us time to look over the menu since we've never been there before. We ordered drinks, then he proceeded to talk me out of my drink order. I gave-in to try something different and waited 20 min. Drinks came and this Ginger drink was horrible. I returned it to get my original order and waited another 20 min! We were also talked out of our food order!!! He told us if we don't like it, he gets to eat! It's a win-win situation. We said "we'll try the Quesadilla", he said "the Nachos?"  If you like being up-sold by a car salesman and slow service then this is your place! As more people came in, the slower the service became. We had to call the water boy over to get service and the check. We became irritated with the Sauls scheme. Our $90 ticket for 4 drinks and Nachos could've gone a lot further for better service and authentic food elsewhere.

k_uxSQCorGlHHVkr4YYhWA.text: Service & food were amazing. Really enjoyed the pizza & brunch service. Drinks are pricey, but when in Vegas expect that!

GR003tiQcaV-piPuKcKoKg.text: My friend and I attended the Hall and Oates concert March 22. We chose to eat at the American cafe. Glad we did. The "cadilac" margaritas were great and the halibut tacos delicious. However, the most delightful surprise of the evening was the outstanding service our waiter, Saul, provided. Man, we talked forever, about everything. He's been there a very long time, and has such an amazingly positive attitude about Caesars, his family and just about everything. He really made our evening special. We shall return!! Also, thank you to Gerado, the manager. He was great too!!!!!!!! Love good customer service. Dorothy the vegasgolfergirl@aol.com

v_4CF9iFw_ZWdk-QDRRbdw.text: Saul was awesome! He really knew the menu. The Moscow mule didn't disappoint and the nachos were delicious. I didn't try his other recommendations, but he also suggested the clam chowder, Cuban sandwich, fish and chips, and garlic shrimp.

x2JeRqYveBz2KFr1z_7Znw.text: This place is ok. If you want perfectly mediocre food it's the place! The classic breakfast was ok The turkey club sandwich was really good! However - the Caesar salad was horrible. I have never had one I didn't like. Ever.  Brian was our waiter and he was nice.

-Y0ioIvEqPDVn7l6NIGISg.text: Anyone who gives them less than five stars is nuts. And I'm basing that on the food only. The service was just ok, but the food was off the hook!
