TeKhSrwxYsOY88fEjhRTAw.text: Id only come here to wait for a horrible check in process at this hotel. The service is comparable to the hotel in that it was awful. We sat at early afternoon with an almost empty area and the waiter never looked at us. Walked past us and waited on someone who just got there after us. Overpriced short poured wine and a clueless waiter. Maybe the managers should ask you when you leave how it was. Asking at the table is hard to communicate bad service, since your waiter is still trying to serve you. Food was bland, resist the urge to eat here

292ytJ9HAHBTDF-QWK1tFQ.text: Had breakfast here. This is what replaced Central at Caesars Palace, and is located just around the corner from the hotel lobby. Service was good and prompt. They have good coffee and a good juice selection, though it's a pricey juice at $7 for a small glass. Had a Crab Cake Eggs Benedict. Overall, the dish was good. English muffin perfectly toasted, eggs perfectly poached, and hollandaise sauce was great. However, the crab cakes could've used a little more crab and a little less bread so I was a little underwhelmed having previously lived in Maryland where there's a very high standard for crab cakes. The meal came with breakfast potatoes, which were good. Overall, this is a great place to come for breakfast.

uWHJ0RFTT9lwP-eEMlrHWA.text: I like the Caesars property and play here and stay here but this cafe just makes everything miserable and makes me want to stay at another property.   This is the only cafe really close to the registration and Augustus and Octavia towers so unless you want to hike a bit, you're stuck here for convenience but be prepared to wait forever for a table even though there are tons of tables that are available.  I never understand it.  The two girls at the front are on a power trip because they can seat people how they want and they give attitude unless they like you.  Maybe they expect bribe money for a quicker table.  The atmosphere is nice and the servers are ok.  It is overpriced but that is expected inside the hotel.   For the Price you expect exemplary service and courtesy and professionalism which you will not get here, not even close.  Be prepare to wait again after you are seated like 15 more minutes before you get your food.  Save yourself time and money and go anywhere else for food, and if you don't like hiking for breakfast, then you have to stay at another hotel too.  UPDATE:  I am a 7 stars member, and it didn't make a lick of difference.

hvBTxEDt2PjaDywazhKQsg.text: Wish I could say something good about our breakfast visit.  You know you should turn around and leave when the coffee is only warm  and taste like water.  The food and service only got worse.

5g2e57kYZq4eNOonra1Dog.text: I'm not a morning or breakfast person, but with time change, hangover etc. I was up early and hungry every morning at Caesars and checked out Cafe Americano (open 24/7, BTW) first day there, and it was so fabulous I ate there every morning. The first breakfast place that excited me since I was a kid eating at diners on Long Island, so much so that I had to submit this review. If I was still a party animal, I could also see eating there at 4 am after clubbing - but those days are sadly long behind me...  Food awesome. The American breakfast - with the typical eggs (three), meat choices (ham steak thick and succulent), potatoes (incredible crispy thick hash browns or home fries), half dozen toast options, etc was perfect. The huevos rancheros (again three eggs any style and delicious chorizos) with lots of extras including avocado were better that I can find in Dallas where I now live. The plates of French toast, fruit, etc that went by my table looked fresh, authentic and amazing. Coffee just as tasty as Starbucks.   Ambience bright, open and delightful. Big TVs over bar in case u want to watch games while chowing down (NFL ticket allowed me to watch four games over breakfast on Sunday morning).  Tip, if not watching ball games, ask for table towards rear by windows, unless hangover won't allow u to be near sun!  Also nice outdoor seating.   Service excellent, too.   In closing, I can't imagine eating at a breakfast or brunch buffet for two or three times the cost over Cafe Americano if staying at Caesars.

GqimJ0H3jo-a6QeZfOPy9A.text: My last day at Caesar's, my family and I ate here for brunch. We ordered the American breakfast plate, breakfast burrito and fruit platter. The portion sizes were so big! The breakfast burrito was really good, along with the breakfast plate. The reason why I rated 3-stars is because of the quality of attention given to food served. The fruit platter looked amazing from the table next to us, but ours didn't look as fresh and it wasn't. The watermelon looked as if it had been frozen and melon looked a little dried. In addition, the grapes were moldy! When we pointed this out, we were discounted merely $5. For those of you that don't know, one moldy grape usually means the other grapes alongside it aren't good either. If the grapes were next to other fruit, the possibility of the other fruit being bad are higher and restaurants are advised to get rid of them. If you find a moldy slice of bread, you don't throw that ONE out and try to eat the others. You throw the whole bag away. Cute cafe, good food for the most part, but quality definitely matters.

K2s0y9KSr0SEL71G-Hl4ew.text: Cafe Americano is the best place to eat, drink and have a good time. The food is great with huge portions and the service is excellent!! I ordered the BLT sandwich and it came on very think sourdough bread, with thick pieces of savory bacon. With me being a man with a hefty appetite, I'm more than pleased with the portion of food. All of the bartenders bring life into the place with their fantastic social skills to their need to please the customer. My bartender, Courtney N., gave high fives to all of her customers and brought a family element to the establishment.  A fantastic culture has been created at Cafe Americano. Everyone should give it a try.

5zHvVqQe730m4_roWaHKMw.text: Magic eggs is right.....Giving it one star and here is why.  Service was fairly good but the prices and nickel and dime crap was outrageous.  $70 breakfast...one omelette, one eggs Benedict, an OJ, and a coffee.  Are they out of their minds?!?!  There was nothing special about it, as for the OJ, it was 1 cup exactly....how do I know???? They brought it to me in a mason jar that had the measurements on the side!  Coffee wasn't impressive, nothing about this place screamed....hell ya fuck ya....it was more like....congrats, you have survived, and if I had known that, I would have hopped a cabby outta there and gone someplace worth my money...and probably would have been cheaper with a taxi ride.  Dine at a risk to being robbed by the check

0tQWQTeMR17aohQlkWhgYA.text: We were looking forward to our light dinner at this cafe today, but the choice was not a good one. We ordered two entres the first was a salad with avacado, greens, and chicken.  The greens were stale and the chicken was hard as a thief's head.  The second entres was their breakfast item steak and eggs.  The steak was described as ribeye, but its name was the only relationship with it and a ribeye steak as we have come to enjoy.  It was tough and contained gristle.  The eggs were ordered over medium and were served nearly uncooked.  Bottom line we cannot recommend this restaurant and are surprised it survives as a companion to Caesars hospitality. PS the price was $65.00 before tax.

AXN8dLbx8w-Mp86RjgS8WQ.text: We ordered spaghetti and meatballs and it was absolutely delicious! I loved the sauce. You get one meatball but it is HUGE and delicious. I wish I took a picture of the meatball. The spaghetti and meatball dinner was quite expensive at $26.00 (no soup, salad or bread included) but that's Caesars and I don't mind paying if the food and service is excellent which it was. We also ate breakfast here; the All American Breakfast ($22.00!) included eggs, potatoes, toast and choice of bacon, sausage or ham. It was good and fresh. This restaurant is very pleasant and has an upscale feel to it.

SCwg54Ah8yCvHwsa4NWL2Q.text: This company has not paid me my final payroll, as of now its two  months. This is not the way a company should treat people, it's not nice or right!

vsqDmO0GujWz7n1bLVfIXQ.text: The corned beef hash and the Bellini were delicious and the service was quick and courteous.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

mfhLJiHjIINJUREmoBGrtQ.text: We went to Cafe Americano for breakfast on a Monday morning. We'd tried to get in the morning before but there was an hour wait so we made reservations for the next morning of our stay. Caesars Palace has very few options for breakfast. I'm not sure why one of the other umpteen restaurants at Caesars doesn't host breakfast. We enjoyed Cafe Americano. Portions were much too large for us and while some might find that a plus, but it feels wasteful to us. Our waiter was attentive. The food delicious. My bf enjoyed the pancakes and I had the classic eggs Benedict. Would've been nice to have a piece of fruit on the plate. Coffee was good.

czSuX7BuCV5AFr8D54SW6A.text: This is a really nice place to grab lunch on the strip.  Very well decorated and comfortable inside.  Cool and very clean.  Portions (burgers, fries, etc) were HUGE.   Food tasted superb (LA Burger).  Service was pleasant and attentive.  Prefer coke over pepsi but but that's more of a Caesar's thing.  Well done, Cafe Americano!

9qtWS8uXOsrJST6fUsXJ7g.text: Living in vegas we don't tend to eat out on the strip but as we had friends visiting from out of town we spent a day doing the tourist thing!  Came across Cafe Americano the other night and decided to stop for some dinner and drinks.  I ate the giant meatball and my friends had a Cuban sandwich and a pizza - food was so tasty and although a little high in price we expected it for Caesars Palace but to be honest I feel the price was worth it.  Drinks were tasty especially the espresso martini!  The best thing about this place is the service - our server was Danielle and she was excellent - such a nice lady and incredibly attentive to us.  We were also checked on by the manager (can't remember his name but he was British) - he stopped and chatted to make sure everything was ok a couple of times.  Will definitely recommend this place to my friends!

uecmCdu1zRuJyUDmO_d8yA.text: Food was delicious and the staff even better. Our waitress Jessica was amazing, attentive, and very affable (manager was just a great). I highly recommend this place for breakfast or just enjoying drinks with a staff that understands the little things that make for a great dining experience.

kbP0hfha2OEkpaWIhFUXFg.text: My wife and I tried the Bellini, mimosa, latte, and corned beef hash. Surprisingly good food and drinks with friendly service.

F120TiMQtd9e8G3EGG1vIQ.text: enjoy my time in this establishment.  the service was.professiobal ,friendly and the food was good.  would definitely cone back. Melanie  was fantatic !!! Magic hat elect wow

QnvxlBheEXk5vi0aq4jp0g.text: It's my first and last time the place is good clean everything is good except the server Jessica young is mean disrespectful have attitude and races she didn't even ask us what we want we were sitting for 25 minutes when I ask about the manager he was so nice but she is still bitching even after he talked to her and told her to help us she still didn't help I don't think she should be here propably go find a job where she doesnt comunicate with people or send her to the kitchen to wash dishes  then they send us a nice guy called Jonathan he was great but still I'm gonna give the 1 star because of that B Jessica Young

64xcWCDYCufvK-yjS0NMIg.text: My friend suggested we have breakfast here, and I remember coming twice before and it was good. Turns out, it is no longer Central by Michael Richard. I thought it would still be good. Nope!  We were there at about 11:30 and they said they couldn't do Eggs Benedict anymore, they stopped serving that at 11. OK. I ordered some pasta with sausage. The other 3 people in my group ordered breakfast from the limited "after 11" menu.   They have a free margarita with a Yelp check in, which my friend got. It was served in a soda cup, and he said it was the weakest margarita he had ever had. Why was it not in an actual Margarita glass with a salt rim and all that jazz? It looked like a cup of lemonade.   Food came out, my pasta was dry and lacking flavor. It had sausage, fennel, red bell peppers, cheese, and olive oil. More oil, more cheese, and more seasoning on the veg would have made this good, but it wasn't. Nice effort, but no, for $28.   Husband got the Brooklyn Breakfast Sandwich with cheese, eggs, and ham. It was put together very poorly and did not taste like a $23 sandwich.   My friend had a basic breakfast of bacon, eggs, potatoes and toast, very underwhelming at a high price point. My brother got the pancakes, which were undercooked and not good.   The bill was $130 for 4 crappy meals. Save your money and go somewhere better!

9LwBg0kXJNekrkWgwWHq5Q.text: We stayed at the Caesar's for almost 2 weeks and I'm not kidding, we had breakfast here everyday. Thank Goodness my honey is a VIP here if not we would've have to make a long line everyday .  They have such a big menu, I tried different plates every day and everyday I was happy with my meal.  What I loved the most about this place was that I was able to make a few changes to my order. One day I just wanted 1 fried egg (wasn't too hungry) and they were able to make it for me. The service was great, all the servers we had were awesome and always checking on us that we were fine. It was a big group of us all the time and waiting for our food was never an issue.   There were other places that we could've gone to but we really liked it here. Convenient, good, and not expensive.

Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

izjhcdjg7XRzjDDDBj1VIQ.text: Outstanding service from Alex S. At dinner tonight. I thought service was good in south Florida but this is outstanding attentive 5 star. The chopped salad with chicken is so fresh! Made to order and grilled juicy. Excellent experience. The bus staff and bartenders are smiling attentive patient and again 5 star!

DKKdbviccPc_QxSXH3Nt0A.text: I really liked my quinoa salad. It was a good lighter option after eating buffet after buffet (not complaining). The food here is about $20 or more a plate, but it's solid. I also appreciated my free margarita (like a sweet lemon drop) from checking in on yelp. It really brightened my whole dining experience... I wonder why :)

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

r2M3rnn9K8Ai2_-LdDpIBg.text: Of the many times staying at Caesars Palace, I never visited Cafe Americano.  Until my recent stay.  The first visit was great with an absolutely best breakfast that I have had in a very long time.    So, I decided to return and dine there again.  Wow!  Was I so intoxicated that I didn't notice how filthy the tables were on the first visit?  Or that the utensils had food debris from a poorly washed effort?  The placemats had crumbs and other sticky stuff still on it, which I hadn't realized until I rubbed my hands across them.  I wanted to leave right there and then but I had already ordered my food and drinks.  The glass of water didn't come for about ten minutes after placing the request.  The coffee took even longer and should I mention that refills on the coffee are not guaranteed?  At least not during my visit and when I did get a refill, the coffee was warm at best.  The breakfast wasn't as good as before, but that may have been because I had such poor table service. We didn't finish our breakfast and left, deciding to eat an early lunch elsewhere.  I wanted to give them 2-stars because the first visit (while in my drunken stupor) was good.  I wouldn't recommend dining here since they are over priced and not a good reflection for Caesar's brand name.  I know Cafe Americano isn't a Caesars establishment but they are inside Caesars and should have high standards and quality service.  Next time, I'll walk across the street and dine at Denny's, I heard they are open 24/7 and have endless hot coffee.

E09zlVt31bQ88qrQ9xmHoA.text: This is supposed to be the breakfast and 24 hr cafe inside Caesar's casino.  It is way overpriced and food is just mediocre.  We had brunch and for the two of us, it was $150 for some eggs, salad and meatballs.  The meatballs were tasty and portion was huge.  This was the best value on the menu.  Would not come back again.  Skip this place and go to Searsucker instead.

3q1feSFkaPt4niRym193-A.text: We were desperate for somewhere to get a good meal late at night, and this place was a 24 hour cafe, so we were so happy to find it. When we were seated, there was food all over my husband's chair, and the floor hadn't been cleaned under our table. Strike one. Then my husband sees a cockroach run by our table. Strike two. We think about leaving, but are starving and don't want to walk to try to find another place open, so we order. After getting our food, NO JOKE--we see another cockroach run across the walkway right by our table, and a server walking by steps on it but doesn't notice and keeps walking! WTH? So we stopped eating, got the check, and got the hell out of there. Disgusted & STILL HUNGRY! Don't waste a meal here when there are so many better places to eat!!

ZdeV31wRIKdVpm3ML8JR1A.text: Flew in late Monday night and was surprised to find that a lot of restaurants were shut except for this cute joint. Cafe Americano was a beyond awesome experience... The ambience, food quality, service and portions were all amazing.   The music videos are a nice little touch and the drinks are also amazing (Lychee Martini is to die for).  I highly recommend the Tuna Poke Bowl as well!

DScD9-VjlH_qz0QRh33I1g.text: Saul was a great waiter! He was friendly and helpful with recommendations. I had the clam chowder in a sourdough bread bowl. The soup was rich and had excellent flavor. The only thing I would have liked is for the sourdough to have more of a sourdough flavor. My friend  had the nachos with brisket and they were delicious!This was a good spot for yummy food and quick service.  We were seated and taken care of quickly.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pZV4i3-CoOrDPM-KBCB_2w.text: Our waiter, Saul, was great.  He was humorous, knowledgeable, and friendly.   The Mexican tortilla soup was absolutely delicious and had huge pieces of chicken breast - a winner!  The meatballs were very dense but the sauce was very flavorful.    The salmon poke (and mixings) were very good however the rice was undercooked to the point of being crunchy.   The lobster ravioli was under seasoned and lacked salt.  The onions were undercooked too. However, the mushrooms were absolutely perfect.   My second martini was to dirty/salty.  It was returned and taken off of the tab.

cCajHE39kUaTBiddwjmw5w.text: Saul was a fantastic server, tended to our every needs. The restaurant had a great atmosphere, and the food was good as well. Saul did a great job making us feel welcome and checking in to make sure we had everything we needed. I'd definitely come back next time I'm in Vegas to see if Saul is still here to provide a great experience.

xh8E_VMNIqGYpDylQAOoiQ.text: Super overpriced cafe in Vegas. Every hotel has a 24 cafe but this place is just crazy expensive. Me and hubs ordered an all American breakfast which is 3 scrambled eggs, 3 strips of bacon, 4 slices of tomato and toast for $22 + tip + tax. Insane. It wasn't organic or free range eggs. Bacon was standard and over cooked to the point they were like crackers. Toast was not buttered. No cottage cheese as a substitute for hash browns. Thin measly slices of tomato were overripe. With a cup of a coffee, our meal was $35 bucks. Do yourself a favor and go off strip or even across the strip for a more reasonably priced breakfast. For this price next time I'm going to order room service and eat breakfast in bed! The only redeeming thing about the place is the ambiance is nice and the staff are really great. My husband couldn't finish his coffee and they brought him a fresh to go cup after we paid.

qusMI3nnCAOJNx0Sii-ozQ.text: The hostess didn't seem tp care about assisting me when I got there for a take out order.  Just told me go wait by the bar.  She was too busy on her cell phone.  The manager & bar personnel were caring, polite and seemed to do their job.    Food is A Ok!

TLGNj82XWZth4PPjFG1F_w.text: This is the 24 hour cafe/restaurant that caesars palace has to offer. It's pricier than usual hotel/casino cafes but the portions are huge & our breakfast was really good.   The buttermilk pancakes could easily serve 4 people- Each pancake was large & fluffy & easily bigger than my face. They were served with powdered sugar, whipped butter, & maple syrup. My 4yo son was in pancake heaven.  We also ordered the loaded hash skillet with home fries. The apple wood smoked bacon, pork belly, peppers, onions, sweet potatoes, topped off with a sunny side up egg was really delicious.  Our table of 3 shared these 2 orders and we couldn't finish all of it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

vfNFDIG_PkUaCrNv75QGzg.text: What a pleasant surprise! We were playing it by ear... looking for a last minute meal before seeing the show Absinthe. The food was terrific. I had the roasted chicken (after strongly considering the buttermilk fried option) Wow! it was tasty! Served with an au jus on a bed of fingerling potatoes and covered with asparagus and green beans. Soooo Yummy! The service was a little slow but they made up for the delay with a lovely birthday cheesecake! I would definitely go back when in Vegas.

UlsjswQVn4Zw-G0oghYizg.text: Food was good. Had breakfast, how can you screw that up? The place was cute to for a hotel coffee shop. We sat outside in the patio. Our server was awful. Just lazy and rude. Asked for extra ketchup gave me one, asked again gave me one. As if he was squeezing the tomato himself for it. The glasses were dirty and so was his attitude.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Basic breakfast

DQgMZ3GEgNCamPdEvgI6kA.text: Pretty much a go to, run of the mill, can't go wrong place for 24/7 eats at Caesars. I've tasted many dishes in the past but usually go for one of the omelette variations. I also like their fried chicken and waffles but wish it was white meat instead of legs.   Service - 3.5/5 Food - 3/5 Ambience - 3.5/5

k2ePSPIw8YUMSqvDhk3ZHQ.text: Options you have a lot in Las vegas but finding something good to eat early morning is tough sometimes. I remember seeing this place on my way to the pool prior day so I decided to give it a try. We waited about 10 minutes to get seated, not bad at all. As soon as we sat down, we were welcome by our waiter. He was very nice and he provided excellent customer service. It's too bad I don't remember his name but I hope all employees are just like him. I ordered steak and eggs and orange juice. I loved both. The orange juice, small serving though, was delicious. Natural and hand squeezed orange juice. For me that makes a huge difference. The steak was served in slices but daaaaamn it was a lot. Cooked to perfection. I enjoyed it. Every penny was well spent. The atmosphere was also nice. It makes you feel comfortable. No needed to dress up. Very casual environment. Highly recommend it!

5HbgbnZT7AwbVgXvOPUhtw.text: Food was amazing. The cowboy rib eye and poke were amazing. Tayton at the bar is a master of mixed drinks, including experimenting with different ingredients. Chef Rob cooks a mean steak. Will definitely be coming back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glorious concoction from an outstanding bar tender
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Glorious experiment from an outstanding bartender.

e7ALWbbM9sDafs2pkUDsaw.text: This is the Sister restaurant by Cafe Americano!  This place is Amazing! Not only do they have temperature controlled patio seating, it is on Las Vegas Blvd!  Great place for sports watching, they have a 16ft by 9ft tv screen that can separate into 4 screens!  This 24 hour restaurant offers not only American, also, Latin American, Tex Mex, and Asian!  There is literally something for everyone here, from breakfast to lunch to dinner and Brunch on the weekend.

ilFY-BTLDH779Z--hdF-ww.text: I came late at night so maybe that was my problem. Restaurant pulls you in because its by the lobby. For a "cafe" it was over priced. So much was over priced that I ended splitting a dish. 25 for breakfast food?  two drunk girls came in with a cigarette and was smoking next to me (who doesn't smoke). managers came over to move her. much appreciated but my question is how did a cigarette get in by one manager and one host?!  just one of those memories you will only remember for the wrong reason =/  on a positive note the server and mac and cheese made this place 3 stars

yVQ-fCL5tDVq5pFDftC2wQ.text: Avoid for breakfast. Poorly prepared, and outrageously high prices for poor quality and basic food. Couldn't even get a decent cup of coffee.

_VLkugO9-EU_E-n-RV9V6Q.text: This place has a great vibe and it's my favorite spot in Cesar's. The bartenders are cool, and friendly (not your typical casino bartenders). Chantel is my favorite. She remembers my name and my drink. Daisy is a doll too. The food and the atmosphere are great, but those two girls make this place. I'll be returning soon.

vNHdIY_wU_btRuHK3HMCgQ.text: We love Cafe Americano! We've been a couple times for lunch and have had Eric S. both times as our waiter. He was unbelievably attentive, kind, and efficient! The food both times was amazing. As with anything down at the Strip, the food can seem pricey, but the quality and the amount of food you get is worth every penny! My favorite thing is the Short Rib Nachos. Also love the atmosphere. Highly recommend for anyone that has a stomach and is in Las Vegas ;)

qZhdokyaSiPVSGpt1HIlMw.text: Great service! Our server Saul was extremely friendly and helpful with our party. We had a group of 9 (4 kids!) and he was so patient and kind. Food was great but service was better!

Pir8BJT7g8Y_FjumH78VIw.text: Brian was such a great server!  We special ordered our breakfast and he was super accommodating.  Thank you, Brian!

5swkeY8HhcrvTDYXTsJ0Bw.text: Had their pizza to go and dined there for breakfast. Everything was very well made and delicious.  The sandwiches are huge, and that definitely makes for good sharing choices if you're watching your budget. However, $13 for a mimosa is just crazy. Vegas in general is just expensive when you eat at the convenience of these cafes, but just share wisely. $20 for a tiny pizza is also not the business, but it was good! So.... just pick your battles for whatever suits you.   Overall seating areas and look is awesome and super easy to get to.  Service both times was just great! They're on it.

vS8dFkYzL94Kt4mdQoxt0w.text: Pretty good casual restaurant, steak is a little bit chewy, nachos is excellent, tacos come in 3 and small portions, coffee is very good. We got good service, our waiter is Jessica.

ZZgdq6vwPPwvom9-rnJAJg.text: Came here with a bunch of girls because we were staying at Caesars and this is the only place open past 11pm.    Food is RIDICULOUSLY overpriced.  I got a bowl of French onion soup.  Cost $18 including tax and automatic gratuity (for parties of 8 or more).  Service sucked.  Waters went unrefilled.  When I asked someone for more water, he only refilled mine and not everyone else at the table.  We told our waitress we wanted the bill split.  She brought it to us not split.  Stars are only for the food.  It was edible/good but NOT worth almost $20.  Only go here if you're desperate.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. French onion soup

4DfWbmdPvTYaw6V5MM3iHQ.text: We visit Cafe Americano every time we go to Vegas (which is often). The food is absolutely delicious. They offer a great variety. The service is amazing. Richard and Kristina in the bar area make all the difference in the world. They serve with a smile and keep a watchful eye on everyone who sits in their area as to make sure we're all properly served and our beverages never run low.

CFaYmEgkYKGWpdfExmo2QQ.text: Breakfast food was good but a little overpriced at $76 for two people. You get a lot of food that you cant finish.

jUkJHOWHAH0l1LDMUOcs3w.text: Our waiter Saul and the food was amazing.  We would eat here again. Best service in town.  Try the nachos, fish and chips, and clam chowder! Yum!

45rH2jX9KWYwcNN252-dDg.text: Best service you could ask for ! The food was amazing . Saul and viri were very helpful

errXVC3ZDBTvadBZradn-A.text: This used to be my favorite breakfast place at Caesar's Palace because their bacon was thick and crispy and the rest of the All American Breakfast plate was delicious.  Ever since we discovered this place last year, we've been going here every time we go to Vegas and always enjoyed the delicious All American Breakfast. On this most recent trip, we stopped by my favorite place to eat the All American Breakfast only to be severely disappointed!  My hash browns came out cold, as if it had been sitting there for a while. And if that wasn't bad enough, the bacon was greasy and dark looking, as if they re-fried yesterday's bacon. The usually crispy bacon was greasy and soggy and tough at the same time. The fatty parts were soft and greasy, and the meaty part was super dark red - it reminded me of beef jerky (dry and tough texture). I am so disappointed. Just because we came on a weekday morning and they may have been a little slower than usual doesn't mean they should serve old bacon!!!!  The eggs were the only thing that came out okay (hot and done right).  If any of the staff had to eat the same food we were served today, I do not think they would have enjoyed it and they probably would not have been able to serve the food with a clear conscience.  I didn't want to risk sending it back because we all know what happens when you do. So disappointing and upset that we had to pay ~$25 for the All American Breakfast that was not worth the money.  I can't justify paying that much for a basic breakfast if they're going to serve me food that is old, subpar, and cold.

HSuC5rSKc6YuBc3GzHv9Cg.text: Opened in the space formerly occupied by Central Richards.    This cafe located across from the registration area is open 24/7.   The owners, V & E, Cubans have a winner in this restaurant. The service great and professional. While we only eat breakfast at the cafe during our stay, this place is better than the 2 previous restaurants that occupied this space, namely the Augustus Cafe and Richards Central. They both were very good, but this place is better.  Tip if your watching your weight, even though your vacationing, share.  We share the all American breakfast and the split the plates for you. Forgot to take a pic.   Huge portions. We each had 1 poached egg,  3 slices of smoked bacon, a bunch of breakfast potatoes and half an English muffin. Toooo much food! Delicious.  Very affordable. My wife the Cuban cook, by way of San Antonio del Los Banos, Cuba was very very happy with her breakfast!   A+++++.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5pDSU9dFF2IK-Q1VuKNuTQ.text: Staying in the hotel and debated between this place and the buffet for breakfast. I ended up incorrectly thinking that Americano would be the bargain.   That said, my Brooklyn Breakfast Sandwich was perhaps the most delicious egg/bacon/cheese sandwich I've ever eaten. The eggy bun was very delicious, tasty and very fresh.  I was at the bar and service was great. The coffee was good and strong, but a bit lukewarm. The only food related blip in my experience.   The sandwich was huge so I was able to take half away for a late morning snack. However it plus a cup of coffee, tax and tip got me to $36.   The buffet was $38 and no doubt had fruit and other nice breakfast options. Probably a better split of both decadent and healthy food.  Glad I tried it, but may go buffet next time I eat breakfast inside the hotel.

utacypsCjFkci9n-A6fIsQ.text: Really impressed with the tacos de carnitas and asada!!! They also have happy hour daily!!!

T1q79g7VxXhm2W1vF6OsXA.text: Saul is the man! Great service! Great start to the weekend! Thank you Saul for all the tips while in Las Vegas!

yyO5WIeFggxC7YKGfuF4tw.text: Great spot for a less hectic bite. Chicken tacos were excellent. Great service from Saul. Not many vegetarian options though if you have one of those in your party :).  Overall a great spot.

j0CnkWH4v-UQCowTB5Y5HA.text: This is our first time here and we were pleasantly surprised. Savl was our waiter and he couldn't have been more attentive and friendly. He had several suggestions and my husband took him up on the fish and chips which he couldn't stop raving about. I had the steak tacos which were very good. The only reason they do not get 5 stars is because their chef put sweet potato in the clam chowder. This New Englander found that a bit odd and not too much to my liking

SQQrJlvmugj45MCH9DOjzg.text: Tourist trap.  Expensive tourist trap.  There were 8 of us and we opted to eat outside for dinner.  (automatic 18% mandatory tip tacked on to our $500 bill). Waitress was snarky from the sit down.  When asked, she recommended we not get the Cuban sandwich because it "isn't very good, the owners aren't Cuban and don't know Cuban food".  I ordered a pizza and got something that seemed to be from the frozen aisle of any grocery store.  The nachos were good but 3 were ordered for the table, much of it went uneaten because the portions were so large.  It would behoove the waitress to warn of the sizes.  Maybe make them smaller portions with a smaller price tag.  If you go, plan on sharing.  Only one person in our group cleaned their plate.  The food was just not that good.  The waitress's sarcasm and snark pretty much ruined the meal for me.  She took it upon herself to try to entertain our table by picking on and demeaning the men at our table.  Ugh.  No, not what we do.

IBfrCMC4X98c-6XN4uMSww.text: Just like to say breakfast was really good, we will definetly come back , best on the strip  !

nsCzlV43HtGcDgJ5F3Ts0Q.text: Had a late night bite of ceviche. It was mediocre but the service was good and fast. Good for a late night snack.

YvsNp0WvFnDlwQp19hk-JA.text: First time eating here...food is a bit pricey $20 for a burger and fries. Don't get me wrong the burger was huge and delicious. However, I was disappointed in the service given that it is located inside of Ceasar's Palace. The server acknowledged us after being sat at our table. He did not return to ask how our food was or if we needed anything else.  They got my husband's order wrong. I probably will not return.

q1iEQ9MMFxS2t61Gyc15Ig.text: Great food - especially the pizza!!! Pricey food, but it's 24 hours, so it's there when you need it the most.

bko4BfargSDB0SxDMbIt4w.text: Don't use your debit or credit card here. Pay with cash. Most likely someone there is using a credit card or debit card reader to save or steal account numbers. I've gone there twice on two seperate occasions both several months apart. Both times the only time I ever used my debit or credit card was at this place only to order drinks as usually everything else including dinner and hotel were being charged to a master account for the company I work for. Both times I've come back home to San Diego only to about a week or so later get a call from my bank that my debit or credit card was being used in Las Vegas at Chucky Cheese and some Waffle House. Oh let's not forget Frys Hardware for $400. Then there was also the gas station. The bank asked me to recall where I've used my cards on these seperate instances and it's only ever been at Cafe Americano so I put two and two together. Highly unlikely that it's mere coincidence that both times I've gone to Vegas my info gets stolen out of thin air. You've been warned! Cafe Americano please look into your POS systems. Something is going on and I can only imagine how many people have repeated fraud on their bank for coming here. I'm only giving one star here because there was a very attentive waiter on the patio bar so service was good but besides that I'll never not pay with cash here

MwmuOX9LbbKhTeP2WDQc_w.text: Late night Robbie is the best bartender this side of the Mississippi. Don't sleep on this place

4Fng7nGLRYP4xHJytJBx9A.text: We stopped in for a small bite to eat for breakfast and were promptly greeted by our server. That was one of the 3 times we saw him all morning, his presence was bare. When ordering he asked me what kind of toast I'd like which led me to believe my meal came with toast. Wrong we were charged $8 for the toast I barely nibbled on. So watch out for sly upcharges... I asked for a cup of hot water to drink, at first the cup seemed clean until I noticed the hot water loosening the dirt off the cup which was now floating around my cup. So of course I requested a new one, but had to ask the manager because our server was no where to be found. The manager himself brought me an even dirtier one this time the inside was stained brown and streaky. Gross! Kudos to him for not looking at the cup before he brought it to me. After my boyfriend brought it to his attention he offered us the dirty cup discount which covered the toast I didn't really want to begin with. Thankfully the food was decent.

tb8F0psgQPze8ehYl9ZLkQ.text: Our waiter was friendly, however breakfast potatoes were undercooked/hard so we sent it back, the new potatoes looked nothing like the previous ones and were still hard. I ordered a well done classic burger and was given a raw one, sent it back they brought me a different burger w/jalapenos & avacado. Told a different waitress that our experience was not good and she responded with "is there anything else" and just walked away before we could answer. Two thumbs down

r47k10MlvxozYuQQD0WW6w.text: Waited for 15 minutes in prominent area of restaurant - completely ignored - left - avoid!!

GQuxEiAqwat7AuuIfiM5Cg.text: Everyone is SO HELPFUL and friendly and at your service. Food is awesome. Definitely coming back next time I'm in town!

kyW_6hxqdLhPUxQc0l4t4g.text: Good food, but watch out- it is EXPENSIVE! We're talking $100 breakfast for two people! As long as you're aware of that, the food is very fresh with good sized portions.

Mf1TVY89kpL7mzep19OkvQ.text: Three friends and I make a "reunion" trip somewhere every few years, and Vegas was this year's stop. We stayed at Caesar's and so the Americano Grill off the lobby was a great stop - not only convenient but very friendly staff, helpful manager(s), (Marco and Carlos) and wonderful pizza and cocktails! Relaxed atmosphere which is nice after the rat race of the strip and noise in the casino.  There is also an outside patio area for dining and drinks - very nice! Told my son and friend's to definitely make a stop there (or more!) Thanks!!

hivybUpCqKaZJq_irgxfeA.text: We had dinner here one night and it was amazing. The Asian chicken salad is awesome, and the pizza is out of this world. We would have eaten there more often, however just like everything else at Caesars, it's overpriced. $20+ for a BLT. No thanks.

wFioV6uXJbxmHeQHsigyew.text: Open 24 hours, convenient location inside Caesars, pricey, macaroni and cheese with way too many bread crumbs and a super thick alfredo sauce and dry chicken was $32, service was good, $1 off for Total Rewards members.

-pqPU5dtxkrnJnXCZbOSBw.text: I ordered a pizza that was great my Sister ordered clam chowder And it was really good i would definitely come back.

bcjRjeCVyf2mtImjXoZvgA.text: Walked by this restaurant on several different stays at Ceasars. Had tickets for Reba and thought let's have dinner and be close to the show. HUGE Mistake- 45 minutes to get our food (with an almost empty restaurant) then 2 out of 4 meals were incorrect. We sent one meal back completely, I ended up sharing my meal and the other meal was barely touched because it was basically inedible. The server apologized and sent the manager over who basically offered to 'comp' the cup of coffee!  Really! Very poor service, we will never come back to this restaurant and will probably think twice about staying at Ceasars palace.

Qkx-nDJEQVjJkC1q41ahEw.text: Food was great but the service sucks had to ask for a refill on the coffee 3 times before I got it

GUoOZJq3Y98oQ-mbraH8PA.text: We stayed at Caesars for a bachelorette party this weekend and loved Cafe Americano.   Perfect place for grabbing a bite or having a drink.   We hosted my sister's bridal shower on their outdoor patio and it was fantastic!  Thank you for taking care of us!

wNvUjRrM-lanSliWLWpvYg.text: Everything was great.  I had the Cuban sandwich.  I would recommend more mustard on it, but that is probably a personal preference.  Braised beef short rib tacos were great.  So many comfort food options on the menu that I would test out many of them.  That is saying a lot considering I am a one dish type person when I find something that I like on a menu.

1HCEd9K-eu7Sgm5-s4pmug.text: Great spot for breakfast - they have a couple of all day breakfast items (just in case you slept in). Enjoyed the fresh avocado and bacon add on with my eggs that were cooked perfectly. Tip: ask for your coffee to go when leaving and enjoy your cup while walking to your next destination.

Pe_C2llHx_FR7DFryPyU0g.text: The pizza was really good and so was our waiter. I'm giving it a 2 star for the fact that they seated us next to a table of 4 drunk spoiled young "adults". It was 10pm and the place wasn't that crowded. The sad thing is the staff did nothing to quiet then while they yelled dropped the F bomb repeatedly drawing attention from all around us.

g_YHiWlPeq91sDSKQq610A.text: If you want phenomenal drinks and a staff that caters to your every drink need, this is the place to go. Luis S is the BEST bartender I have come across in Las Vegas. His customer service supersedes all expectations in the City of Sin. His service is fast and friendly and he's got the inside scoop on the strip.

Q4begTziIPgSuq4TEVHpyw.text: When you come to Vegas you think that people are going to give you decent service because you are going to be in and out and they'll never see you again. Ryan, the bartender here, spent time chatting with us, getting to know us and just having fun which is why we made it a point to come by EVERY night that we were in town. We came here our first night for dinner and really enjoyed all of our food and the service we received. Then we met Ryan and came to the bar every night. His amazing service and awesome personality were the key to our experience. We will come back and visit again because of Ryan and his team.

KjfqYfFSwgcxBKboFnep7w.text: Robbie and Luis make amazing drinks! The espresso martini and the sexy 24 by Luis are perfection. Try it! You won't regret it.

sTTmPRo2rjXv2S5IwRsFiQ.text: Great spot to eat dinner and have some drinks. Food was yummy. They have basically any drink you could want, with some liquors bars don't usually carry. Friendly staff with great eye candy. I'd definitely go back.

5MEG7diTjj8M2L_5xblAkQ.text: 24 hour restaurant located at Caesar's Palace. We went there for breakfast and liked the various choices available. Took a bit longer than we expected so I dropped my rating to 4 stars but the service was friendly and the food was very good once it was served.

ABRDxBGLhqWkac9FB_wKzQ.text: This was the most i have ever paid for breakfast...however it was money well spent. The foot was scrumptious and the service was great...

ym1O4VhteczxkuvB6M968A.text: Was in Vegas nearly a week for a convention and had the opportunity to have two meals plus drinks and appetizers here. Their customer service was top-notch and the food fantastic on all four visits. Paloma (manager), Andrew (bartender), Maggie (server), Stephanie (hostess) and Tyler (server) all gave phenomenal customer service. Personable, attentive and professional, the staff at this restaurant is terrific. The salmon is wonderful, and I highly recommend the entire experience. Thanks!

0iMcj0S46OsyGy0-P71SSA.text: Only if you are super hungry and need overpriced food should you come here. Definitely over priced Vegas at its best. I would recommend getting an Uber to In N Out since it will cost you the same in the end. As far as burger places on the strip (or near the strip) you can find better elsewhere. Service was reasonably quick and courteous. Miss the old celebrity chef restaurant when I could get a great filet mignon at 2am.

hf3z-BXWH92MvX3HhIAZog.text: First time in Vargas I was still waiting for my room to be ready. I came here with the family and they had really good appetizers and good food. I had the magi mahi taco for lunch.

zvPwcqooDb7P_Ld1kR8Pug.text: $138 dollars for eggs and pancakes, tea and chocolate milk, 2 adults 1 senior and a toddler.I was charged $9dlls for a side of bacon (2 strips of bacon) This place is a rip-off!. I was told that they are under new management but this place has been historically bad...My advise is don't eat here might as well hit the buffet you will pay less and have a lot more variety. BTW I order the skinny omelet and it was not good at all...the service was Ok the food took quite a while everything else (pancakes and eggs where just ok not great) not worth the money...

lO1xJTjeHM43eXIxsNbliQ.text: I wish I could give no stars at all. Horrible service, horrible food. Waiter is very cold and unfriendly. The pasta tastes like it was boiled and they put marinara over it. It was cold, no taste, nothing special for the price you pay. They were nice enough to take the food back. But I came in hungry and leaving hungry. Bad food!

g9jRkTMtHdJjHdKnYoYgzw.text: Luis our waiter was amazing! We stopped by at 4am after leaving the club. Even though it was 4am Luis had a great attitude and was very helpful. He made a great suggestion, he told us to try the "Short rib nachos." These nachos are the best nachos I've had in a long time. Everything was delicious on these nachos. The chips were perfection. Even though it's an appetizer it's a generous portion. My boyfriend and I were happily full by the time we finished the nachos. So remember if you come during their "Late Night" hours DEFINITELY get the short rib nachos. I promise you won't regret it. Thanks again Luis! You made us feel very welcomed on our first visit to Cafe Americana.

GIuVa4O_bU5mdSbuoFtkNQ.text: This place is overpriced. The food was good and the service was good but it wasn't $22 an omelette good. I get that it's Vegas and I'll pay a premium for that as well as good food but with that said, not sure it was THAT good. Putting an expensive restaurant in the lobby of a busy casino/resort means you get no peace and quiet but an expensive bill. The decor felt like a shitty hangover where you just do it because it has to be done. Would I go back? Maybe only if I have to and was staying here again.

1vTq8_lBikuGZdJuTIDD1w.text: Awesome and friendly service. Robbie was very nice and friendly. Unlike the guys at the balagio who are very serious and don't even smile. Luis also served us and he was very nice and friendly as well

GOHAsDSn3_bu6mQyAxLo6Q.text: I had the most unpleasant experience meeting Ryan K. and his crappy attitude. Apparently we made the mistake of ordering a few hot chocolates and he was less than thrilled. Our order was responded with a sarcastic "Great, just how I would like to end my night, by making hot chocolate." The passive aggressiveness continued with a unnecessary attitude towards us and ended with a "Come back and visit when you are ready to have some cocktails." It was just completely rude and uncalled for. So I guess don't go if you plan to order anything that isn't alcohol.

3PayPJ89l-oWakj3tgGxMg.text: The meal was good. Little wait time.  As a matter of fact, i had to tell the waiter to stop hovering over the table until we decided.  Price was ridicuolous for what you get. Lettuce on hamberger was not cut for hamburger. Just one large leaf foldwd in half.  The manager ran past us without stopping in the middle of the meal and asked us how the food tasted. He did not wait for our answer.   Bottom line, food tastes good, price was at least double what should be paid, wait staff was attendant, manager doesnt care what you think.

JNdH7Y4tBbwaogUY3KE0ww.text: We went in for a traditional breakfast, and returned every day of our stay at Caesars.  Did breakfasts, late lunches, and great full meals with a bottle of wine.  Chef Matthew has developed a great menu for each. Try the Huevos Rancheros, or items from the Skinny Menu, or his Home Fries with sweet potato pieces. The salmon fillet with citrus spinach was excellent.   The Cafe is considered casual dining, the ambience was relaxed but the wait staff was friendly and attentive;  so though the prices are Vegas Strip (you are at Caesars), it was great value - excellent menu, attentive service.  We loved the location just across the main lobby from the casino hustle.

X9rzHhETF7XwQgPa_wX4gA.text: So we ended up here right before a concert when we were STARVED and had minimum time to eat. The place was pretty empty around 7p and the prices seemed a tad high for a "cafe" but we didn't have much of a choice.   We got 2 pasta dishes, the prosciutto pizza and the pork belly nachos for 4 people.  The pizza flavors were SO good - I only wish there was more prosciutto.  The pasta was perfectly cooked and the pork belly nachos....OMG I wish I had saved much much more room for those...they were SO good.   The drinks were also very good, although I think a bit light on the alcohol...   Overall, a solid choice for dinner - the ambiance is really nice despite the fact that it's called a cafe, the food portions were solid but not overwhelming and the food itself was great.

Gdp1cga2BXD1ihMdfUi-bw.text: This restaurant is located on the opposite side of the "check in" desk for the hotel. I've only had 2 plates here being the "All American Breakfast" and the "Steak & Eggs." The service here is pretty good on timing. They won't have you feeling left unattended after they've taken your order and served your meal. I felt the staff was professional and did their part. They don't play that "I didn't see/hear you" typa stuff like at other restaurants. Both the plates I ordered were made very well as well as for my family members. If you need condiments or anything extra just ask. For both my visits it seems they don't want to waste condiments so they'll give it upon request like sauces, ketchup, jams, etc. It's also nice that they have lines for people of status in Total Rewards because our first time eating there, there was a fat line but since my pops is diamond status, we got seated within 5 min which is really cool if you play with Total Rewards. The only thing I think was a little overboard was the price. I know we're in Vegas and all and the atmosphere is cool, but a traditional Steak & Eggs plate usually goes for $17-$22 at most place. Over here it was $45. Despite that it was actually cooked well, I still felt it was a bit too much that I didn't want it the first time around but on my 2nd visit I said I'll try it and wasn't disappointed. I would recommend this place if you're staying at the hotel and don't wanna lose more $$ and time by having to try and leave your hotel to go somewhere else. They also have tvs and played Sunday football which is also a plus.

xYQ5trbsVYJ_Gc7gfyWQrw.text: The selection is great. Lots of options to pick from: pizzas, soups, salads and sandwiches. It's located conveniently in the middle of Ceasars. I am warning you: portions are huge. I've ordered an appetizer of nachos, they were gigantic. Two of us got full, even not finishing the plate. Very nice service and vibrant ambiance. I liked for sure.

2innw87Sm2BDGjLzKdEGAQ.text: This place is so convenient, it's open 24 hours a day, so it's great when you want to eat something and you can't find anywhere open. The area is huge and has cute trees with lights inside. I ordered the pepperoni pizza and it was pretty good. Overall pretty satisfied.

R98S4PFN90V2w-t1eLPuyQ.text: Came here for lunch and Eric S. Was our server. He did a fantastic job and we will definitely come back. Awesome food and great servers

XSsqNxeHxpdwaF7fnXMLzQ.text: Came here for a hearty breakfast before running around the strip. Menu is full of a variety of egg dishes which was exactly what we were looking for. Our waiter was a jolly, charismatic guy. He was quick to greet us and take our orders. I went for the egg white frittata and my boyfriend had the American breakfast. The portions here don't disappoint. They are huge. My dish was full of spinach, avocado and and a variety of veggies. My only issue with my eggs was that they were cooked with too much oil. Besides that it was tasty. Love the avocado addition. My boyfriends eggs were over easy and cooked perfectly. His bacon wasn't very crispy but he really enjoyed the hash browns.

X1pqE3THPNCq0UKioT1b1g.text: So tasty! Went here before a show and got the burger and a vodka cran!   Tasty!  Boyfriend got the bbq chicken. Large portions but so good!!!!!!!

Upva0FozFCUN5w7puqTbgA.text: After running through various options for breakfast, we came here because of convenience. We were staying in the Augustus tower. The menu has pretty much your standard breakfast options.  WHAT I ORDERED:  Dirty bloody mary (extra spicy) - I was pretty impressed!  Huevos Rancheros - loved everything about this plate! The sausage was a bit salty but the beans were surprisingly good! Very flavorful. I'm not even a bean person!  Just those 2 items alone ran me about $50. Pretty steep especially for breakfast. It was good but nothing different than any other brunch spot that will cost you a fraction of the price.

Not coming back here again, so many other places to go then here. Plus my waiter was kinda judgmental. Must've thought there was no way someone so young could afford all that I ordered. Was happy to prove him wrong. Two stars for the fake nice treatment

qDSOIpy-eZbrRrq5CI52GA.text: I'm so glad they're open 24 hours to fulfill all my cravings at the end of a long day

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ham and Turkey Sandwich

F6cYpn032UNZdh6r6R8cZw.text: Not only was the food delicious but our waiter Gustavo was kind and attentive to all we needed! His smile brightened our morning and he took care of everything we needed! The portion sizes were great and shareable!

zrubpqJpNX8RXmNyPgaYYw.text: Patio plus Jalapeno Margarita is a recipe for a great afternoon. Thanks for the great service Viri!

UWbphXix2ML9VdrRob-ytw.text: Came here with a big group and had a lot of fun! Saul was an EXCELLENT waiter! He was extremely accommodating and so friendly! He took such good care of us and had great recommendations for us. I had the short rib nachos and it was definitely enough to share with a couple friends! Overall, delicious food, cool ambiance, and attentive service!

C2_qsY2Q0y_KPwA-ZAU-kg.text: Overpriced and low quality - bad combo.  We've eaten here before so you'd think we'd learn.  This was for breakfast.  A cup of coffee is $5.50.  I'd rather have Starbucks.  My omelette was browned and over cooked.  The over medium eggs were hard and had to be sent back.  The crisp bacon was charred beyond recognition and had to be sent back.  They charged me $2.00 for salsa - really?  The meal included two cups of coffee, omelette combo, and egg combo.  Total with tip was $75.00!!!  Insane.  We have learned our lesson and won't return.

oMC-ibDtNEeRUQtXKqIPqg.text: Delicious eggs Benedict for breakfast. The fruit cup was amazing with pomegranate seeds, blueberries, and blackberries! Eric S. was our server and took great care of us making sure our breakfast experience was awesome on our last day in Vegas.

k_AP3hiOL6MUIVqXXsj6fA.text: They dont offer military discounts food was ok wait was short sevice was good a bit pricey

_d8ZFnHGdUDmo7pa36wuLA.text: Okay so in the world of overpriced vegas, the bartenders at this place are amazing. They are so personal and will give you honest suggestions and opinions. Love them!

M9pDkG9FIz-ZncFT9b6Jig.text: Bad food. Felt like a child cooked my meal.. Nothing was fresh. Extremely slow service and the prices are high for no reason.   Don't go there if you are in to good fresh food.

lR1vAnj0P3LY-mWHyHY_dg.text: We stopped here after not finding any good restaurants open at 11:30pm. We were seated fast and the hostess was friendly. My outside drink was allowed so that was a plus. Our server, Alex, was friendly and prompt. During the meal, my cup of water was filled 3 times and was filled when it got half way. The restaurant itself was nice and not many people were there at that time. I ordered the BBQ burger and it was delicious! It had pulled pork and  a beef patty. The fries were a little salty though but still good. We ordered 2 burgers and 2 modelos, $68. Overall, very good and would definitely come back.

nd1T1ItOUFqfWHjNUm06Qg.text: My wife and I dined there on Feb. 26, 2019.  We decided to select from the special offering for $40 pp.  We were able to choose a starter course and an entree.  Cafe Americano did ok with the entrees.  Actually, the sea bass my wife ordered was delicious and I wished that I had selected that instead of the "Best Fried Chicken" entree.  Where this Cafe Americano fell flat on its face was with the $15 Caesars Salad I ordered.  I mean, "Come on Cafe Americano!!!", I had better side salads in my junior high school cafeteria!  It was absolutely ridiculous and my wife and I have not stopped talking about it since.  For $15 I got an 8 inch cereal bowl filled with chopped Romaine, two little plastic containers of Caesar's dressing made off site by some company, a few croutons and a slice of fried parmesan cheese.  What kitchen in their right mind, at Caesar's Palace no less, could think that kind of salad is a worthy menu item?  And then ask $15 for it?  It was outrageously bad for any restaurant to serve and if they did serve a salad like this, it would be worth, at best, $3-4.  This should have been an embarrassment for this Cafe.  I can safely recommend eating the Sea Bass entree there, but that would be it for me.  There are better places to eat nearby, including the Cafe Hollywood at Planet Hollywood.  I will not ever take a chance on Cafe Americano again unless someone from that Cafe contacts me to explain to my satisfaction what happened that night and makes amends.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the Sea Bass entree.  Well done.  If I had a Caesar Salad pic you&#39;d still be laughing a week from now.

rTJDjWlGKq2YxrhR9Cnf9A.text: If the prices were a little bit cheaper, I would give this place 5 stars.  It is in Caesars Palace, so everything is expensive so maybe I shouldn't give them one less star over it but I feel like I have to. We had a burger and fries that we picked up to go one night and then we picked up some a la cart breakfast menu items the morning we were leaving.  The food was surprisingly good both times.  Granted, you are paying a lot for it so you would expect it to be good but it was still better than I had expected.  They were also very fast and the staff was very friendly and helpful.

BBGm7svnJofFo3Cfn9HCMw.text: Good thing about this place to start off was the free margaritas with meal purchase on check in.   The food was ok, a bit overpriced for what it was. Though, it was ok. Giving that it is inside a casino hotel, prices justify it. They also have a late night menu for the all nighters.

X8bYWI00SD5WH8DeOusCDw.text: Had a 3.5 star breakfast at Cafe Americano, which would have been a 4 star breakfast had I ordered the hash.  We arrived around 8:30 on a Friday morning and the place was hopping.  We had a 5 minute wait or so, but it was not bad.  Our server, Brian, was fantastic.  Even with how crowded they were we got refills, condiments, and our check very quickly.  We got some drinks to start, I had a mojito.  It was strong and minty, but at $15 it was overpriced, even for a coffee shop in Vegas.  Not very large, but that didn't stop me from ordering another one.  To eat, I went with the breakfast burrito and a side of home fries well done.  Our food arrived after 15 minutes or so and it was hot and fresh, clearly just prepared.  The burrito has chorizo, pork belly, white cheddar, pico, and eggs.  It has another salsa on top along with some crema and avocado.  It is very large and easily shareable.  My biggest complaint is the ingredients were not mixed well.  I only had everything in a single bite for about a third of the burrito.  Those bites were great, but the distribution was off.  Also there was not much meat.  The home fries were fine, nothing to write home about though.  They needed seasoning.  My mother had the hash, which was fantastic.  I would absolutely order this again, and it is also a ton of food.  It was the superior dish by far.  Be advised that some of the breakfast stuff is not available after breakfast.  This was annoying when I tried to order a smoothie after 11 am.  It's Vegas, everything should be available whenever...  As a bonus, check in on Yelp gets you a free margarita as of October of 2018.  Overall, I have had worse 24 hour coffee shops in Vegas, and I have had better.  Cafe Americano gets the job done, and the service really is good.  I would eat here on a future trip to Caesars, but I would not make a special trip to eat here.

Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mojito.
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

3UFR1Bjiy8B3PSjvbRqlZQ.text: The food was pretty good but they are over priced. For the price of two people i would rather go to the buffet for like 10 bucks more. Other than that the service was also really good. We had some awesome conversation about baseball with our waiter who happen to love the As! That was awesome since we're from the bay.

FURZdwIBJSXUbxOKGoiTlw.text: I have been to Caesar's many times and have never noticed Cafe Americano.  I seriously don't know how I missed it, but on my most recent trip, there it was right next to the hotel check in.  Decided to have a quick lunch with some co-workers in between seminars, and let me tell you how happy we all were!  First of all, there were lots of fun martinis to choose from.  I got a lychee one and it was pretty tasty!  For food, I chose the tortellini with cream sauce, peas, tomatoes and bacon.  It was wonderfully colorful and sooo good!  I couldn't have asked for a better, more satisfying lunch.  One great thing about this place is it's open 24 hours a day.  A definite go-to place when you're staying at Caesar's and get the munchies at 2am.  Next trip to Vegas, I'm definitely coming back here.

lKfi2fg8GooO0PkrmPgVRA.text: Wow...Night and day difference from our original dining experience; our meal today could not have been more lovely! The manager Gerardo was amazing; he is quick, competent, very aware of his restaurant, everything that is going on, and has done an incredible job with this cafe. He is also accommodating and extremely personable.   We arrived during the madness of the business conventions lunch rush and yet were warmly greeted by the hostess (who was handling the rush in a very calm, cool, and collected fashion) We were then seated at a spot just inside where we were promptly greeted by our waiter Gustavo. Let me just say Gustavo is the man! He is very knowledgeable about everything on the menu, has a great sense of humor, and made sure we ordered exactly what would be pleasing to our palates . We ended up ordering the chopped salad, cuban sandwich with fries, and the BLT sandwich with fries as well as diet Pepsi's. Our drinks came out right away and were never even halfway empty before they were filled up again. The food came out quickly and was absolutely beautiful! It was hot (just as it should be), plated in an appetizing manner, offered generous portions, and cooked to perfection  We were starving to we dove right in and each thing was delicious; the fries were crispy melt in your mouth fried sinfulness , the BLT was on toasted sourdough bread and stuffed with goodies that included lots of bacon and avocado which added just the right amount of creaminess. The cuban was huge, and had an abundance of shaved pork layered between a flat bread with yummy sauces to accompany it (Gustavo highly recommend this one and he was right!). The chopped salad was good and once again a very large portion (which is nice for the prices in Vegas) but nothing out of the ordinary. It's clear that since the last time we dined here the food has become high quality both in appearance (we eat with our eyes first), and in taste. We are looking forward to coming back and trying the rest of the menu...they have lots of options for everyone (including the picky eaters); they offer salads, sandwiches, fish, pastas, brunch and obviously a huge bar menu. It isn't cheap, but the quality of food and the amount that you get is well worth it.   The atmosphere is hip and happening; it is fun to see the hustle and bustle of Vegas all around you. Inside is nice, but the patio appears to be even more so (if you can score a patio spot on a nice day I say go for it ). Every single person who waited on us in some fashion were friendly, competent, and actually seemed to enjoy working there (even though they were all so busy). The right hand all appeared to know what the left hand was doing which is clearly a sign of a well managed restaurant.   My family and I look forward to returning to the cafe again soon, we had a fantastic experience and all recommend you make your way there for a great meal (24 hours a day btw)!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. BLT and fries (yummy)!
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cuban with fries (amazing)!

le3OtqSWUqVjDSHHBeZmHg.text: Saturday morning and looking for a place at Caesars to have a brunch. No interest in the buffet. A very long line at Giadas Pronto. We walked over to Cafe Americano and got the last table for four with absolutely no wait! Lots of interesting options for a brunch. My wife and I decided to share the bacon bacon waffle ($24). The waffle itself had bacon and jalapenos baked into it. In between the two waffles were eggs, more bacon, melted cheese, and bacon jam. Absolutely delicious. They split it for us in the kitchen which was very nice. Even sharing this menu item was more than we could finish. $24 for a brunch item is a little pricey. But when you consider that it's the Strip, it's not unreasonable. Plus we were able to split it, so $12 ahead is not so bad. There are about five TVs over the bar, so it's a good place to watch sports while you have your breakfast. Unfortunately, I would never come back here to eat unless I was staying at Caesars because of the $18 surcharge for parking. Clearly the powers that be at Caesars have no interest in having locals come to eat at the restaurants. Too bad

MwOBNDKeMTglEhvZkP0eLg.text: At first glance this strip side cafe/cantina looks like a fantastic watering hole for a few good drinks and some snacks.   After further review it couldn't be farther from the truth.   With a party of 11 we received MEDIOCRE service through and through, from the waitress to the manager Danny T....4 separate orders did not arrive in our 90 minute stay.. the management was notified. Upon arrival of management the gentleman was explained the situation, and was explained to that the food that did not arrive. He explained those items that did not arrive after 60 minutes would be compt (thanks cafe americano LV for making us not pay for the food we didn't get) plus 20% after bringing another manager into the equation and getting clarification  of the issue to fresh eyes.  Big thanks to the OTHER manager giving us 50% off the total bill   End of the day.. there are a million restaurants in the beautiful Las Vegas strip.   Let this one be a pass over.   Danny Terreres manager June 10th 2019

ZErINhhLxPWsTTvHduC1mw.text: Tate is the best bartender in Las Vegas.....  and the people watching ain't too bad either!

8mepdNX--c4pBvIXaemTuQ.text: Awesome food & service! Literally #bestofvegas   We loved the chicken and waffles! All the portion sizes are gigantic so consider sharing. My FAVORITE part of the meal was the 5 star service from Raul, our server. This trip I'm here with my kids (picky eaters)- he made sure all the meals were "adjusted" to make them happy (and make my life easier ).  Check it out for breakfast, lunch or dinner while at Caesar's Palace.

eNICC3aRY-WquGmSiXCllA.text: I have to confess that I was a bit put off by the prices. Sure it's Vegas but $25 for breakfast (plus coffee etc) is just a bit much.   That said this is the probably the best place to catch a full breakfast beyond the buffet at Caesars.   I ordered the huevos rancheros. I was expecting one thing but it came out somewhat fancy. A tortilla with beans on top and cheese and for me an over medium egg perfectly cook. Times three. Plus a grilled pepper and a huge sausage. Honestly it was really big and filling and surprisingly delicious.   Service was very good as well.   The prices aren't necessarily worth it but at least if you go, hope you have a business picking up the tab.

3ZQhnDdXV2W-BqqqxvyDNw.text: I was recently in Vegas for a conference and found myself staying at Caesars Palace (where the conference was!).  For this day at the conference, we were on our own for lunch; and a few of us decided to stay at the hotel and hit up one of the many restaurants.  We landed on Cafe Americano.  So, this place is your run of the mill hotel quick service sit down.  You want something quick, go here; have more time, go somewhere else.  We had a group of four and were quickly seated (it was lunch time, around 12:30pm).  The lunch menu was fairly extensive and I ended up getting the Cuban sandwich; hey, I'm a sucker for those, okay?  The others got salad, BLT and pasta; like I said, a run of the mill hotel restaurant.  Now, what you get is average food at Vegas hotel pricing (my Cuban was $25, yes, twenty-five US dollars).  Did it taste good, meh, it was okay.  It had the basics like a bunch, cooked meat, pickles (needed more) and mustard.  The fries were good, but how can you mess that up?  If you are about to faint because you haven't eaten, then eat here; if not, I suggest eating somewhere else in the hotel (if you don't want to travel somewhere else).

bM-oHfq1fDNsRhlqKI9j2A.text: It's okay, it's really overpriced for what it is.  Hi by got steak and eggs, I got the corn hash.  The steak was alright, lacking good beef flavour, but it's great if you have a big appetite.  My corn hash was literally corn on hash browns with hard poached eggs and guacamole with even more cornn $25 for a lot.of.corn that sells at $0.50 an ear.  Wouldnt have this again... It's not worth it.

GpoyP72hS9WYNARjjrbQQw.text: Went in with the husband and daughter for dinner on the patio.  Even on a hot Vegas late afternoon, the atmosphere was pleasant with the overhead misters keeping us nice and cool!  Our server Jose and manager Danny were awesome!  They had great suggestions for both food and drinks.  The Bahn Mi sandwich was awesome!  We ordered a dessert off the secret menu to share.  Will definitely go back again to try something new!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. #SecretSundae #CafeAmericano

9vfMQt_W1-84MZ2VuOAl0g.text: convenient and delicious! We ate here twice, once for lunch and once for breakfast. The service was quick and friendly.   OK so the food! I got the hot wings, that were lolly-popped. They were buttery and meaty. I also got the fish tacos that tasted so clean, not fatty at all, very tasty.   For breakfast I got a pretty basic, meal. Sausage, bacon and eggs. Very well made, all tasted very fresh. Eggs were perfect. Service was very friendly.   I highly recommend eating here if you need a quick tasty meal.

g-c_pm2RlO5q-maxDbNwPQ.text: Great contemporary restaurant open 24/7 with a little something for everyone on the menu from breakfast, burgers, tacos, pasta, and Steak and Chicken. Its in such a convenient location right in the lobby of ceasars palace and such a great place to get a place to eat for breakfast, lunch, dinner, or late night that is still more on the upscale side of casual. My all time favorite dish from this restaurant is their Free Range roasted chicken (picture provided). I could eat that entree multiple times in a week its so delicious. The chicken is cooked so perfectly that i can honestly say ive never had chicken cooked that well in my life and it is consistantly cooked the exact same way. It comes with this sauce to dip or pour over the chicken that takes this dish to an entirely new level, then it comes with a side of Roasted Asparagus and Green Beans that are perfect.

HbpSYLZC8fmrllVBKpaP5g.text: I had a lovely waitress who was super sweet. I think she is what left an impression on me. The food was ok. It wasn't memorable and if not for the waitress I wouldn't have bothered to write this review. The food wasn't bad, but, it just wasn't as good as the other places that Las Vegas has to offer.

rMz60xMgHGp1WCq5lv1_EQ.text: Our server Saul was the greatest. Highly recommend getting sat with him if possible! Funny, witty, and always gets the order right!

HCLOmpxTAuhOY_Jk0JVUYA.text: This was a great haven to get away from the craziness of the Caesars lobby and have a nice little dinner and drinks after our travel to Las Vegas. Food and drinks were plentiful and very tasty, particularly the nachos. Our server was Saul, and he did a great job of not only taking care of us but sharing a number of stories about his time in Las Vegas that were interesting and informative.

dGBzZzwzVTzCmFy2Jpj5-A.text: Poor quality of food and bad service. I called a bartender several times right in front of him he ignored. I had to wait for a menu for minutes.  Cheap meatball spaghetti, salty chicken wings and poke bowl with cold hard rice.

95rPqlDXR_9K63pDOpZP8Q.text: I had the vegan poke bowl. It was okay but I was hoping the dosh would be warm but its a cold dish (even the brown rice) so I was a little disappointed.
