tjlfL89IqvwLtTz8tyop4A.text: It's difficult to rate this place accurately as the service is slow and unfriendly, however, the food is pretty good. It is over-priced and underwhelming.    It's most redeeming factors are that it's open 24 hours, and has a limited number of Vegan menu items.    I have been here on several occasions, and have always found the servers on the less enthusiastic end of the scale. My most recent visit was the worst ever.    When I arrived I told the hostess I just wanted to order something quick to go and take up to my hotel room.  She instructed me to go to the bar and order from one of the bartenders.  As I approached the first bartender, he stated "I'm off the clock, go see him" as he pointed to the opposite end of the bar.  I walked down to that employee, and he said, "please go see the other bartenders, I'm very backed up helping the servers."   I went to a third bartender back on the opposite end of the bar, and he directed me back to the first, that was off the clock.  After the five minute runaround, i walked out.   Still hungry, about two hours later, I returned and asked to be seated at a regular dining table. Service was still as slow as I expected it would be, but the food was pretty good.    Lower you expectations, which I've done, and life will be good.

ChVZ6w8JO5RkD_eRpnDTcg.text: High priced food but not worth the value paid for. I ordered scrambled eggs and sausage links. Eggs were runny and undercooked. Sausage casing was like biting through a rubber band. Cold toast. The worst part? Paying $22 for this poor quality, flavorless meal. $5 for the coffee. Talk about gouging for inferior food. Sent the food back to redo. Absolutely not worth it.  Wife had the Bacon Bacon Biscuit, which was cold in the center. Also the way it was described in the menu did not convey it would be served as a sandwich. They also charged for the salsa. Talk about nickel and diming. Will never return here. Dined here for breakfast on Monday, June 18, 2018.  We ate breakfast the next day at Claim Jumper at Golden Nugget. 100% better for much less money.  Again, we were very disappointed and had the impression since it was Caesars, they would strive for better. Not on this occasion. Will never go back.

zDBbpEgV_gHAraCcLPBCAg.text: My only 4 stars is the short rib nachos. I'm a frequent visitor of Caesars Palace every quarter of the year, and the restaurant is just a more expensive option in general. Food and service is fine, but I don't recommend unless you are too tired/lazy to seek out other options.

Mh3royrToAnVGvDQjbrUuw.text: The service was tremendous and the servers Viri and Nikki were very attentive and accommodative. Ask for them.  The food is delicious and reasonably priced for the quality. Cool atmosphere and trendy outdoor patio. Would come again next trip

LhaRsIs0Tgmj288KmtrEQA.text: Great atmosphere but other than that it was very disappointing. My family had one continental breakfast and two omelets, none of them were satisfied with the food. I myself had the huevos rancheros; it was terrible.  Eggs on cold tortillas on top of mildly warm canned beans with a hard half avocado and a cold "chorizo" link (spicy sausage). The only reason I didn't return it was because we were heading out to the Grand Canyon and were limited on time.

rC5tX43WZXEMSmdNORJ1zg.text: We chose Cafe American for breakfast while staying at Caesar's. Lovely decor, clean and bright. Big TVs strategically located for diners' AM viewing pleasure.   We were seated on arrival, water glasses filled, menus distributed. Server was pleasant and efficient, coffee fresh and delicious, refills offered. I had a breakfast burrito, hubby had hash and eggs. Hash browns were obviously house made, fresh grated, soft inside, nice and crispy outside-best part of the meal! Breakfast burrito was huge, otherwise pretty unremarkable. Over easy eggs reported as good, hash ok, nicely crisped. 24 hour service, conveniently located in hotel lobby, but pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nice ambience, in main lobby.

h0DnVhqdW3e307f-zywWug.text: My friend and I stopped here before our flight leaving Vegas. We loved it so much, we ended up deciding to miss our flight, just so we could stay longer.  First and foremost, the service here is 100%! Luis was super sweet and accommodating--giving us drink suggestions and also phone chargers (because basic white girls and dying phones are a regular problem).  I don't know if it's a compliment or embarrassing to say that we stayed here for about five hours. However, in the course of those five hours, we had (each) 1 Bellini, 1 Bloody Mary, 4 cross between a Moscow Mule and Mint Juleps, and a beer. We also were responsible adults and ate. I opted for the chips and guacamole along with the Blackened Mahi Tacos, while my friend had the AMAZING Clam Chowder. Safe to say all the food was devoured and the drinks were slurped down.  I can't sing the praises of this place enough. We loved it so much that my friend and I decided to stay at Caesar's Palace during our next Vegas visit, just so we can hang out at this bar.

hF9riwmpEhyZvuRvWx_JZQ.text: Magic eggs!!!!! Order the magic eggs!!  They must be magic because when I ordered a Denver omelet $24 disappeared from my wallet...abracadabra, poof, gone. Combine that with an $8 orange juice and $5 coffee and you have yourself a stupid expensive breakfast. Adding to the ridiculously priced food the cafe plays thumping, loud dance club music at 6:30 AM to help you wake up. Next time I visit Caesars I'll make a point of leaving the building for an alternative to the Americano Cafe. Congratulations to the management for crossing the line and driving me to a competitor.

VkVcN1p-BCguyAL5t9zadw.text: We decided to go here one morning while in Vegas, because we wanted to enjoy a nicer breakfast (not many big restaurants open other than buffets).   The ambiance is great, the service is impeccable. My husband ordered the huevos rancheros (not pictured), and I had the eggs benedict garden style with asparagus, roasted tomato, spinach and homefries on the side.   My eggs benedict were perfectly runny, the greens were a great touch, and it was greatly seasoned on an english muffin. My husband enjoyed the huevos rancheros.   I will say this place is definitely PRICEY for breakfast. Our bill after tip was $75. So be aware before you take that seat that this will be one of the most expensive breakfasts you'll have.

5BqrmZ6p2_EOuEtVzJb3rw.text: As many of the other reviews have mentioned, great place to people watch.   The food itself is mediocre and extremely pricey for what you get. I ordered the chicken tenders, they were pretty average but they were for a whopping $18. Most of the menu items were selling at a 50% to a %100% markup from their average prices. However, the quality wasn't even close to being that.  The place itself is nice... with great atmosphere and service. If price isn't an issue, then have a nice casual experience here. However, if price is a factor then I would recommend this place.  Really nice 24 hour place though ! Fancier than most of the other food places that would be open late.

Mind you we have been partying for about 3 nights so anything probably would have taste good. Lol jk

pd5GT9p6bc01dFPZ6phAOA.text: Came here on multiple occasions, every time it was after a pretty busy and eventful evening so that may have played a role in my experience. Overall the service was very nice and I appreciate the attention that was given to me, such as making sure my coffee and water were refilled when needed!  The food overall was ok but the price for the steak breakfast was probably not worth it (maybe because it was well done) and the sausages also left something to be desired but that is what sausages do I guess.   The carb portion was fantastic (sourdough toast and hashbrown) especially with the Jam jars that it comes with!   Next time I'll try something other than their breakfast menu.

O7DlYEEOTUmH-rZQKGWgjA.text: Came in for breakfast last weekend.   We were greeted with smiles and seated right away.    We've been served by Ricardo several times and he remembered us which was nice!  We ordered coffee for both of us.  Huevos Rancheros and Blueberry Crumble Waffles to share.  Huevos Rancheros came with scrambled eggs,  sausages and grilled jalapeno.   It was pretty good.     The BEST part was the Waffles!  It was DELICIOUS!  The whipped cream on the side wasn't sweetened which was a perfect compliment to each bite of these delicious waffles.   It was so good on it's own that we didn't even use the maple syrup that came with our meal.  Will definitely be back and have those yummy waffles!

fIlMmtCtX3muhuc2_blgww.text: Cafe Americano is not bad. It may be the only good place to eat in Caesars Palace. Sure other places may have better food, but the prices are worse. Food can get expensive here but not as much as other places in the hotel. One of the few breakfast options.   It doesn't matter which time you come. It's always open. This is one of the few restaurants in the hotel you can eat at any time. It's real easy to find. This is right in the lobby. Checking in gets you a free margarita. It comes in a regular glass. This is a pretty good size and it's free so you can't complain much. Breakfast items are pretty standard fare. The toast and jam is about $7, which seems like a lot. It does come with several small jars of jam. There's multiple flavors like grape, marmalade, and strawberry. If this doesn't sound exciting, you're right, it's not. They do give you lots of jam so I ate every one.   For being in an expensive place it's more affordable than other places. It's still a ripoff for some items. The breakfast items are more affordable so go then.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toast
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Margarita

klkAi_hVHAUxJAzot8L0yg.text: The bottom line is food should make you sing (well good food) and overall after long bouts of instagram hype I really feel like Cafe Americano fell flat for me on so many levels. I'll say it's definitely not the Americano that caught Lady Gaga's attention for sure!  I will say their menu is massive and at least even by Vegas standards will fill the bellies of any shape or size. Since I was a virgin (careful how you throw that around, especially in the city of sin) I was drawn to their tasting menu. A $40 price tag for essentially an appetizer and main course which is a steal nowadays.  I macarena'd towards the guacamole quesadilla which if I wasn't dying of hunger from a 5 hour car ride I would've sent back without hesitation and I NEVER do that. What killed it for me was that it came out in one big melted chunk. It tells me that it had been placed one over the other when it was too hot causing it to congeal together as one. I did like the gooey ness of the asadero cheese so it wasn't all bad, but sad to say it was a giant mess to me.  As for the main course it was their take on the classic chicken and waffles. The star of the night is their chicken. It was hot and moist to the bitter end which had me shaking. The seasoning was on point, but unfortunately the train came off the tracks from there. The bacon stuffed Mac and Cheese Waffle sounded so good on paper, but horribly prepared. The waffle itself was dry and even the syrup (which was brought out about 30 minutes prior to receiving the food) couldn't resurrect much. The macaroni had zero flavor to it and was beyond bland. I took two bites at most and apparently offended by not wanting a doggy bag to take it back to the room with me.  Another item worth mentioning was the service from our waiter. It was a welcome to Vegas dinner with family and he really brought down the mood quickly. It took multiple requests to get simple things like refills and lemon wedges for our water (4 requests actually). He looked so lost throughout the night that we weren't sure whether to feel for him or feed him to the wolves.  I guess they for months followed the wife on Instagram and reached out for feedback which apparently even that seemed as fake as the "enhancements" of tinsel town. The survey itself was done via text, but it appeared robotic and wasn't an actual live person. That to me sums up all I really need to know. Don't garner feedback if you really don't care to hear it honestly. Within a city that's constantly changing at the drop of a dime I'd be inclined to listen to the people who come through the doors or those doors will not remain open for too long.   Afterwards they stopped following the wife and safe to say our stomachs will be doing the same. There are plenty of other destinations which deserve these gurgles.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Best Fried Chicken...Ever!
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Guacamole Quesadilla

jfUXppe9P8W50FhkpvNJfw.text: I was prepared to be disappointed but left highly impressed and satisfied.   I understand that certain hotels on the Strip hold themselves to a high standard and their guests demand a certain level of quality. Still, seemingly generic cafes, particularly ones open for 24 hours, don't tend to turn out extraordinary food or service. Cafe Americano is definitely an exception.  Prices are high which frequent visitors to the Strip must be numb to. I'm not quite there yet.

hjBrw9ddc3NnxGC4oa2U3w.text: Located in the lobby of Caesars Palace, this is a great place to grab some breakfast. They had a good menu, and everything was reasonably priced. I recommend getting there early to beat the line. I got the spicy egg tacos with chorizo and a bagel on the side. I cleaned my plate. Perfect meal to start the day

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Egg tacos, with chorizo, beans and pork rinds

DbV2bUa94KU0pwEEdwAk1w.text: Came here for lunch and was blown away by the exceptional food & service. We started off with the  Blueberry Lemondrop MartinI. Wow!!! This drink was not only very pretty but it was super tasty. It is on the sweet side though which I prefer. The grilled artichoke appetizer was amazing. I especially loved the balsamic glaze & basil dipping sauces that accompanied the dish. The breakfast sandwich on a buttered & toasted brioche bun was fantastic. Our server Raul suggested we swap out the thin bacon the sandwich cones with with their house made thicker bacon. That was a good tip & one we appreciated. Finally, we enjoyed the steak tacos. Everything was fresh and flavorful and nice portions.

Q4Lghz3gaSBsh_xB3eys6w.text: We stopped here just to grab a quick breakfast before our flight home. We came here because the restaurant is in the hotel we stayed at (Caesars) and it's right at the entrance. For breakfast my husband and I ordered two American breakfasts which included eggs, hashbrowns, your choice of meat, and toast. That alone cost us almost 50 bucks. I know Vegas is expensive but that's down right ridiculous. The food tasted like the same food you could get at dennys for less than 20 bucks. We didn't even get drinks besides water...otherwise that would have brought us over 60 dollars.   I would pass if you're just going for a quick breakfast. No clue how their lunch or dinner is, the place looks decent otherwise.

oZ9kk-pY9uA3ysXUjFSklQ.text: This was surprisingly good! We stopped by here after realizing every brunch place on Sunday morning required a super long wait. At cafe americano, we were promptly seated. I ordered the all American breakfast which was super filling and a classic. I love how the hash brown was crispy and soft on the inside. The bacon was crispy as well, and the butter was easy to spread. My friend ordered the loaded nachos which I took a lot of because it was so big. They did not skimp in the meat, although their avocado was a little lacking. Definitely get the nachos to share since they're huge. Service was okay, considered it was pretty busy. Bathroom is outside of the restaurant and in caesars palace.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Nachos
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. All American breakfast

F5BsYqv4b9u8NGaGR8scPw.text: I want to start by saying I was treated to a meal here with some family. I can't comment on their dishes, but I will describe my own.   Looking on the menu at the time, the main dish I wanted to try was their fried chicken with mac n cheese stuff waffle. Their mac n cheese stuffed waffle sounded very interesting to me. So when the waiter came to take my order that was what I decided to order. To my surprise, the waiter told me that someone else had ordered the fried chicken already and that if I ordered it, my meal would take 30 minutes to make. This was ridiculous to me considering the restaurant was very empty at the time. So I couldn't understand why one person's order of fried chicken would cause my order to be delayed for 30 extra minutes.   I decided against the fried chicken and went with the ribeye with a sweet potato and chorizo hash. Surprisingly, my order came out very quickly and I finally got to eating.   First I wanted to try out the sweet potato and chorizo hash. The chorizo was very flavorful and had a hint of spiciness to it that made it a great contrast to the sweet potato, but the big problem was the sweet potato was cooked very poorly. Some pieces were overcooked, while others were slightly on the raw side. This made this side very unpleasant to eat since each mouth full was a mix of good raw and overcooked sweet potato.   Next the ribeye itself, was slightly overcooked (I asked for medium rare). Most of the edges of the steaks were almost welldone and very dry. The steak was also unevenly seasoned. Half my steak needed some salt, which I got from the chorizo, and the other half was well seasoned. They also included a sweet steak sauce, which I did not enjoy. It was too sweet and seemed to have come out of the fridge because it was very cold. Overall, for the price of this steak, I expected much better quality and care for this piece of meat.   I did not pay for this meal, but I felt robbed for my family that paid for this meal. At this price point, I would look elsewhere for steak.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

VKuCbVPAZEr09fp94j-moQ.text: It's big and gaudy. I know, in Vegas, right, who'd have thought? But I have to say that we were seated quickly, the food was quite tasty, the waiter was playful and engaged, it was a nice experience overall. Would go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

deWXBOI7QQ_kWOiPvlBSkQ.text: the atmosphere was superb and the decor was beautiful. i got the best fried chicken and it's size was pretty decent. it came with 2 fried chicken breasts and 2 mac and cheese bacon waffles. wish it came with a sauce because it was so dry. the pizza wasn't that great, and the salmon was small for the price. the service was very slow and horrible. our server also told us we couldn't split our checks but then she allowed the table right by us split their checks into 6 different parts.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. fried chicken

qKIv_63HC_2Q8djNLWYZxA.text: Cafe Americano is the perfect go-to when in Caesar's Palace. This place is a great sit-down restaurant as well all bar, but the best part is that it's 24hours!  The food here is generally pricey, but it's Vegas so pretty much everything here is. The food you get is also very hearty and very American. My fish sandwich was close to $30, but there were some very large pieces of fried fish in the sandwich.   The service here isn't overly tentative, which is perfect if you want to be left alone but not so great if you want more than one glass of water. The cocktail menu is also very extensive!  If you ever end up at Caesars Palace in the dead of night, I would highly recommend you try out Cafe Americano!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy fish sandwich
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak

Df7spaWF2Kdh6jeO496HQA.text: Food is decent, but the prices are steep. One of a handful of places that is open 24/7 so I guess it's got that going for it.   Being on Central Time, we woke up much earlier that expected and this was one of a handful of places open at 6am serving breakfast. We were the first ones seated for breakfast as only the bar is open during the wee-hours of the night/morning. Once seated, no issues with service. Ended up getting the breakfast burrito which came with a side of home fries and marked up at $26... Yikes. Food was fresh and good. But yeah, that price though. Never paid so much for a breakfast burrito I'll tell you that much.  Anyways, when you have no where else to go and stumble upon a 24 hour spot I guess it's a god send. I think the only thing that made the price sting a little bit less was the free margaritas with Yelp check in. Yeah I redeemed it at 6am... Gotta make my money back some how.   'Til next time, cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YCfKiQXKdpr8rqlpOFnpCw.text: FOOD & DRINKS: The food and drinks here deliver solid flavor. I had the buttermilk pancakes and was pleasantly surprised that they actually tasted like buttermilk pancakes! Most places get that all the way wrong. I also had them with Nutella. They were huge and fluffy, but fell apart a lot. I was willing to forgive that since they tasted acceptably good. I say acceptable because they were not the best I've ever had in life, but they were good.  My drink was a Bloody Mary, and even that shocked me with how much liquor I tasted. It looks watery and very plain when you stare at it, so I was skeptical. But you really taste a lot of liquor. However, I think the liquor may have been cheap because I didn't get much buzz.   PRICE: Eeeeek! $20 for some pancakes???! Total price tag for a screwdriver, Bloody Mary, milk and pancakes -- $61.  I know I'm in Vegas, but really?? So, your meal will be good enough, and you will pay a hefty price for "good enough".

ys9XjxTT-ebdxq_mEIh_lw.text: Good people watching spot. And cold beer. Mike makes a mean margarita. A wonderful place to spend an afternoon drinking.

rORnZcma9aGzoo9wyFZ-PQ.text: We went for dinner after a show. It didn't look like much from the outside, so the expectations weren't that high. We had a group of 6 of us and we all enjoyed our meals very much. They have a quinoa bowl and a salad for the vegans in the crowd. Others had tacos, buffalo wings, steak sandwich, spaghetti and meatballs. They all liked their food. The portions are large and the service was great. Prices are a bit high, but it's Vegas and its in Caesar's Palace hotel. I was really happy we gave it a chance

sYdnfwkgNykOOiB8OjrAMA.text: Great place that is open 24/7. We got the Cubano sandwich (on 2 seperate occasions) which we split and they did not charge us a plate fee (for splitting) which was nice! Great food and atmosphere, and the manager came over personally to check on us which we appreciated. Would highly recommend!

wK2Gs100Z3W30QtY3rYLGQ.text: The food, even if half the cost, would not have been worth the price. My wife and I went because she was hungry and we were seeing a show at Caesar's Palace. She got the Margherita pizza, which was pretty solid, but my meal was not good at all. I got the grilled free range chicken off of the skinny menu and it was bad. The chicken was dry, way over cooked, and stringy. I literally had to put some water in my mouth while chewing to soften it up. The asparagus was bland and chewy to the point I had to cut it in individual pieces to swallow because it was not al dente and my teeth couldn't cut through it (and I have some respectable chompers).  The brown rice was good, but hey, I never met a plate of rice I didn't like!  Overall, it wasn't good, and given the price, it was downright bad.  Go elsewhere and spend your money.

ceQ8lkNlWUuV3aLmr3rdKA.text: Went to Cafe Americano (a Caesars property) during a weekend bachelor party in early October, 2016 for my son, joined by my other son, the groomsmen and my brother. We went to Cafe Americano for drinks and appetizers. When I  was in the process of cashing out, one my son's childhood friends who moved to Vegas and worked at Caesars stopped the Cafe Americano staff from checking me out. He wanted to apply his employee discount to my bills (2). One bill was for $123 and the other $198. I was told drinks were not eligible for the employee discount. The American staff re-rang up the 2nd bill with employee discount applied. I have 2 receipts - one for $123 another for $68. When receiving my credit card notice of the billing - I noted I was charged in full for both, $123 and $198. Tried to work this discrepancy through 2 assistant managers at separate times then finally the head manager for a period of about 3 weeks. Each time I was told they would work with me though nobody would get back to me and nothing was done about the discrepancy. I then disputed with Chase and they tried to work this in my behalf. They sent Chase a $198 receipt with chicken scratch for a signature while I have a physical copy for the $68. I can contest further with Chase or the Attorney General. At this point the effort is not worth it. In the end, Caesars never honored their own employees' of their employee discount privileges. Very disappointed in this dishonest business establishment - won't be back again, that's for sure.

UdBbJjWE5WGJBxSy57BvDQ.text: Our entry here was a bit of a hangry decision, as in I'm hungry... Now... This will do! It was convenient and suited us at the time. The service was fair and we had a pleasant evening although I feel it was fairly pricey for what you got. It was a good stop gap for us.

zoSz6qSm1a4jVHpG6ergPQ.text: Navigating around Caesars Palace can be daunting but in all the chaos I discovered a constant haven of friendliness and really terrific food!!! My first morning( a very early 4:30 AM I was greeted by Taten and Robbie with excellent coffee and a welcome that set the tone of the rest of my trip- amazing!!! These two gentlemen had been up all night and still they were charming, attentive and funny. That goes a long way in Vegas! So I brought my husband back for breakfast and we met Kristina and Richard, a slam dunk!!! Could not have been nicer! The poached eggs and omelet were eggselent!!! Bloody Mary selection was creative and satisfying. These people are first class-kindness, personality, and bringing a bit of home to a great big place! So we finished our trip with a lovely breakfast of smoked salmon platter and omelet and our new friends!!! Same time next year returning with fond memories we will not forget anytime soon!!!

J7dCqTPdHChdxakzqJQC-w.text: On our recent Vegas vacation, we stumbled into the Americano and I had the best sandwich I have ever eaten! The Cuban sandwich had nearly 2" high of pulled pork, a perfect size slice of real country baked ham, Guyere cheese, mayo, pickles and onions, all on a grilled slab of bread with no grease. One-half of the sandwich would've been more than enough. It came with choice of french fries or salad. I had the salad, all a spring mix of greens. My husband got a Reuben with 2" tall of corned beef and the traditional Reuben items. He got the fries, a very generous, very hot portion. Great atmosphere, sandwiches served on a thick wooden cutting board, linen napkins...manager (in a suit) stopped by our table. Highly recommend!

fNc8b3Xm0Le_0eKcShUbNA.text: Screwed up our order. Twice. Also took 30 min for our dinner, we were 1 of 3 tables. We are staying here at ceases for the week , and it would have been very convenient to come back here, but that will not be happening. Very disappointing.

6fUvNVjOpYlThPXyfbLNMQ.text: OK Food - Distressingly TERRIBLE service  After teaching all day at Caesars was hoping for a simple dinner and then some rest.  Thought I would try Cafe Americano.  Did a very simple order, a glass of wine and a pizza.  I actually had my food before I got my glass of wine.  Then discovered the crust of the pizza was burned black, tasted terrible.  Staff agreed to get me another pizza, which took a bit.  Good thing is the pizza tasted ok.  Waited a very, very long time to get my bill.  Then the server actually brought me a bill for both pizzas!!!  Upon request it was fixed.  Staff was unwilling to even offer me any kind of concession, dollars off bill or another glass of wine.  Very disappointing service level.

mMN_zglkLQ7KpcysImm3wA.text: This restaurant is amazing. The food was excellent, but best of all Saul, our server was phenomenal. He made great recommendations, was personable and professional. We enjoyed this restaurant more than any other restaurant in Las Vegas, and will be back tomorrow to try more of his recommendations.

KzuoegC2u7KtbrNy-INidg.text: Had nachos and grilled chicken. Tasty food. Atmosphere is LOUD hard to hear both inside and outside of venue. The food service was quick enough but waitress was phoning it in

qpceU13FB2LEPcKyxLA8Yw.text: The atmosphere was great and the menu had a lot of variety. I had a blueberry lemon drop that was so delicious my Mom then ordered one for herself and ended up finishing hers before I finished mine. I only am giving 4 stars instead of 5 because I did not love my BLT, overall the taste was there and good but the bacon was intertwined which made it difficult to eat. The fries were crispy which I love. The highlight of the meal was our waiter Saul. He was very friendly and pleasant. I would certainly come here again!

OSNHqmYS9vx8KkMA2SCmcw.text: Had lunch the day after Christmas and our burgers were wonderful!! Service was great!! Price is a little high, but hey we were on vacation in Las Vegas! Will absolutely return!!

1gLGO_XyjmmUP3bIjPEWhA.text: Very convenient, next to Starbucks inside Ceasers Palace. Great food and excellent service.

4dafVdYBVABIYEtxeNQ0-g.text: Great 24/7 spot in Caesars.  I had a California omelette and a green juice. Exactly what the doctor ordered after a long night! Service is a little slow, but the food was worth the wait.

cPGUCrD1bihpW-uyEZ-cVw.text: Great spot to stop before going to the Celine Dion concert. The only downside that kept it from a five star was we waited quite a while before anyone came and filled our water glasses and then came and took our order for food. Saul was our server and was wonderful. He gets 5+++ stars. Ask for Saul if you eat here. He recommended nachos and they were perfect for us to split. Huge portion and delicious.

76g-Z3kecizL2jgYdz-6rA.text: Saul was AMAZING!! Such a great guy and waiter and we will be back because of him! He gave great recommendations for dinner and is super nice!

uaON8NSahzUORGTN0L6hSg.text: Great dining experience today at Cafe Americano in Caesars Palace. Our very attentive and knowledgeable server, Saul made great recommendations for both food and wine. The restaurant is away from the crowds in the casino, and the food and wine were excellent. We would recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for good food and great service on the Strip.

ZT822sgyEvIwucWO9csFjw.text: We went for breakfast and we got the omelette. You get to choose every hash or home fries. Both are tasty. The cafe atmosphere is loud. Cause it's open from both sides. One on a terrace and the other one on the hotel.

fiZDt0l2juer7obTtuetDg.text: Outstanding service by terrific server named Saul.  Really helpful with the menu.  Great food but Saul was the difference maker for us. Customer service like we experienced I'm betting is the norm than the exception. Just another reason why there is no place like Lass Vegas

X8SE97Xs_ENgKDVAksa46w.text: Our dinner was delicious, and our server Saul was great! I had the tortellini, and my husband had the spaghetti and meatballs. All was perfect!

W826iS6hrqrWikOqi1q18Q.text: Every time I'm in Vegas this is my mainstay. They have an amazing 24/7 breakfast menu. It is more expensive but they have quality ingredients if you want cheaper there is a Denny's down the street. The staff has always been great to me over the last 3 years. Saul is an awesome server and a good spirit. You will not be disappointed when dining here for any meal.

ZrQ1f9Iyo41q3n-7fYnWZw.text: WOW with just 2 checkins I became a regular!    Cafe Americano is located in Caesar in Vegas.    The service was great!   On the 1st visit they were a bit understaffed but they were so nice it was easy to deal with the wait.  The 2nd visit was at the bar which is a bit odd as it's technically in the hotel lobby.    Two ladies at the table next to me were splitting the eggs bene with the caper hollandaise.  They both warned me that the sauce was a bit peppery but they were working on eating it via attempting to separate yolk from sauce.   The waiter got wind of their issue and had the kitchen remake the order with the milder hollandaise.   The ladies were shocked as they didn't request a refire. THAT'S GREAT SERVICE!!!!!  Breakfast runs between $25-30 dollars but the portions are large enough to share.  They will even divide the entree onto 2 plates.  Bloody Mary's runs $15 and coffee is $5.  This is not a cheap place to dine.  Total Rewards comps are welcomed.    I'd go back the next time I'm in Vegas but I hope I have comps or winning to pay the bill!

nH4lMmwQqquaLqdtTZHKIg.text: Try the Cuban sandwich. This restaurant is a great spot to relax and people watch. The food is excellent with good friendly service. I would like to return here on my next trip to Vegas.

jR2ZuPw9EphXel4e3WZhaA.text: So sad ! WW2 vet and today is Veterans Day and they refused to honor him . No discount nothing - all about the dollar . Disgusting ! From a line of 3 generations that served our country and nothing because it's all about the dollar . Really ? Ceasars can't afford a dollar ? Don't support this establishment unless you don't care about our freedom .Shame on them!!!!

BLD19L1lGPP4AUkO0lTR2Q.text: Ate there last night. Great service and good food. Drinks were pricey, but the Mac & Cheese was $31, and my husband said was just OK tasting. I had the Asian Chicken salad which was delicious and a very generous portion.

2Bzll-dRxx_Fuoa6i3pzaA.text: The only 24h restaurant at Caesars Palace  Every time I stop by they doing better and better  Nice patio  The pizza and the burger are great the staff is really good  And around midnight the bartenders are just fantastic

8UVvlrQJHsJ7gc2xjl24cg.text: Excellent late night eats! The Cuban sandwich w/ pulled pork, ham, pickles, & fries is massive & deelish. Easily shared between 2 people... Totally worth the $20 price tag!

um9HB6BqjJRkZrw6acK8sg.text: Food was average to slightly above, but nothing to write home about. Staff was fabulous. Ate there once everyday of my stay because it was convenient and the service was great all around. Ask for Keith.

-MJ5C9ZHTwT91LgumjPH3A.text: My drink was 15 dollars and tasted watered down. The quality of the food on the dinner menu was not that great especially for the price. However, the shrimp was good and the service was okay.

_qgc6O8Hayk94jXkB8wq6A.text: This place is excessively over priced. Every hotel/casino has their 24 hour cafe, where you can go and get a quick breakfast or lunch. They are usually reasonable. NOT this place. 22 dollars for a typical eggs, toast, potatoes and sausage. Steak and eggs will set you back 45 dollars. Subpar service goes with the extravagant prices. Never again.

GVDcjMyFLh8T9KeWQxcxyA.text: Had breakfast here this morning and it was pretty good. It is one of the only places other than Starbucks to get breakfast at Caesars Palace. They have healthy options on the menu and the food was fresh. They do not have very many hot sauce options. Only Siracha and Tabasco, which are not my favorite on eggs.

MUCf-SN9azr_qLiVB5FdvA.text: Eddie at the bar is will make your night-too funny! The food is great-I had the Latino Vegan Ouinoa! The outside Patio has like 10 TV's git to watch the Warriors continue their Streak!
