Wk_2_FaFLEp2_KbP_AAdbQ.text: My husband and I were at a conference and stayed at Cesar's Palace. We frequently went to cafe Americano for breakfast. The pancakes are fluffy and delicious! Also the egg white omelette was full of fresh veggies and very tasty! The portions are huge. Service was good but a little slow during the busy times. All the staff had upbeat attitudes. We would definitely come back here to eat when we return to Las Vegas!

g6GIiK6QaA5ExqOmPP5EmQ.text: The manager on named Carlos went above and beyond the Call of Duty. I am blown away by the OUTSTANDING customer service that I received here. Not only did the manager, but also the man working behind the bar,  made an effort to make me feel happy and welcomed. Ordering food from here was a very pleasant experience and I can't wait to go back in the future. Plus my house salad with ranch was delicious! Thank you guys!

TXjYJnk01D0YKKe-yJ5sjg.text: They changed the name, because somany bed reviews. Late night i like to try one last time. Service slow, food is terrible. I don't give one star but this place always bad management, poor food quality. Sorry but for this hotel this cafe joking.

Px5rEHHMGQhNkp2mUNB9JQ.text: The 24 hour diner at Caesars Palace...and keeping in tune with everything Caesars, the food is pricey but above average portions.  I had a breakfast burrito and the waiter asked me if I wanted jalapenos and responded that I did.  Breakfast went well, lots of coffee but the bill reflected a $2 charge for the jalapenos.  My bad as I should've checked first.    Had a nighttime snack and drinks before bed and they do serve Tito's in the bar and no where else in the casino.  Took a few minutes for the bartender to acknowledge us but maybe he thought we were just trying to get free jalapenos.  Good food but again a bit on the higher side.  Would recommend but check if jalapenos are free or not.

xV_MXey5gS8GZFdABn9T0Q.text: I would give it a 3.5 stars... The food was pretty good, the plates are HUGE! (not sure if I liked it or not...) and the cocktail I had was delicious.   The service, however, was pretty slow and inconsistent. The cocktail arrived after the food has, and both took too long. We were served by few waitresses so no one exactly took care of us / was aware of our needs throughout the meal.   Also, the check arrived before we asked for it even thought it's a 24h restaurant, so we didn't really feel like taking a look at desserts or anything.   All in all - it's a good place for you if you're in the area and super hungry, but I wouldn't stand in line for it (if there's any) or make an effort to come.

U2fYQhWGGQBpkz8-9MnB1A.text: (Disclaimer: Food consumed while highly intoxicated.)   It's 2:30 AM & my friend and I were walking down the strip when we smelled bacon. We followed our noses into Caesar's Palace and found Cafe Americano. We both ordered their All-American Breakfast ($20). Their bacon was not a disappointment. I had to stifle my urges to scream because I was so happy with their bacon. It was a big portion, so I couldn't finish it. Took home leftovers and ate it again 6 hours later--  potatoes were STILL delicious, even when I ate it cold. Only strange thing was that we had so many different people serving us, I wasn't quite sure who our waiter was. (Maybe this is due partially to my intoxication) anyway we had to ask twice for ketchup but it might've been because we asked the wrong person for ketchup the first time.  Summary:  1. Food is overpriced. Welcome to Vegas. 2. Breakfast is delicious. 3. Bacon.

5N2Exn8Fea138McNQIRCxA.text: This place is definitely not worth the money! We just spent $85 on breakfast for two and it was very underwhelming. I don't mind spending money on food when it is good, but this left a lot to be desired.   We ordered the eggs Benedict and the veggie hash. If you want food that is worth the cost, do not go here.

DwMfMMlzuPITRWLygRK_ag.text: Above average coffee shop. If your here for breakfast bring an appetite. Neither of us could finish the scrambled eggs with meat and potatoes.  Seating was no problem mid week. The service was quick and efficient. Although it's probably more than you would expect to pay for breakfast you don't do it that often. The restaurant is one of two with full service and we like to have one great breakfast during our stay and it should hold us until dinner.

pMC3MbrN_wU-Qlabhhiobw.text: I came here on Saturday night just for hookah. It clearly isn't a popular place for hookah so if that's what you're looking for this is the WORST place to come. Just from walking in we waiting like 15 minutes to get seated as to which the bartender said "oh just seat yourself" when he clearly saw us standing there the whole time. After we sat down it took 20 more minutes to get menus. They only had 14 hookah flavors (which is nothing). They brought out our hookah and the hookah was broken and the manager said "oh yeah I just wrapped tape around it" which clearly means the whole hookah is messed up. Extremely harsh and we asked for another one. Coals cost money if you want them replaced. The whole hookah overall was 40 dollars and I've had better for 15. This place was also crawling with crickets super disgusting. They shouldn't be allowed to have hookah here or even food.

Q6xcRUfDZXZ9f1iAPD-rHw.text: This place was so delicious! Had breakfast here a couple weeks ago and I'd go back! parking is pretty rough since the restaurant is in the front of the hotel but it's so worth the walk!!! Wish I lived in Vegas. I'd have breakfast here every weekend ! Not kidding.

iYd0WU7Tie-RjzO8IJhXUA.text: Ordered the bbq rib rack for about $35. Came with little half filled basket of fries and red cabbage. The rib was super salty. I was only able to finish about 2 out of the 6 ribs. It's sad when the fries are the best item on the plate.   Other item from group: Lasagna was best item on table. Fish and Chip didn't taste good. Bit fishy. Slow Braised Rib was decent.   Overall don't this place was worth it. Food wasn't good and place is over priced.

7OgdEZyujTi_7q1KCqirRw.text: Great food, generous portion sizes, excellent service... All in the front of Caesars. Def try this place!

mJtc3G356dTdo1OGT8p4Fw.text: A late flight landed us in a near-dark Caesar's. Luckily, Cafe Americano offered open arms to 2 hungry travelers. Excellent Chop Salad and a Classic Burger reenergized us.

YBOC5LRvtw_AlXVT_ub9RA.text: This is one of the main 24 hour dining establishments at Caesar's Palace. I had the pleasure of dining there twice, once for lunch and once for breakfast. Both of my meals were totally delicious. For lunch i had a Reuben Sandwich with homemade chips. The Reuben was more than I could handle. It was huge, just like most of the "over the top" entrees served in Las Vegas. For breakfast I had Eggs Benedict which were also very delicious. Service each time was great and never rushed.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Reuben sandwich combo.

gbUrwlNKIUO18_uPJUv42w.text: Ask for Saul! He's the best waiter and will treat you like family!! He accommodated our large group of 14 with grace and expertise!!

XaLLhEIC8BuGcWMgdUXd2Q.text: first off--great service. the staff is seasoned and friendly.  they take care of you. nice setting.   food surprisingly good. held to a caesars palace level of very good standards. pancakes are not the best i've ever had, but they're pretty darn good. esp with the beautiful bottle of syrup. i went back and ordered it twice.   not a big fan of the texture of their breakfast sausages, but bacon is reliable.  yes, it's hotel pricing. but overall, if i'm stuck in caesars, this is a decent option.

bLtA5bVLRmjEp_3Ucv60HQ.text: Great Food !  Ricardo Gonzalez great waiter ! The California omelette excelent choice !!!

b5opFp2oBtZehGCMMvnE4Q.text: Food is delicious and the patio IS dog friendly. I emailed the restaurant and got a response it was. Since you're in Caesars Palace expect it to be on the more expensive side but totally worth it. I was there for taco Tuesday/FIFA game and the drink specials and food specials were on point. I even had my small dog in a carrier next to my feet and there were no issues since it was so hot outside. I'd recommend. Staff was friendly, drinks were always filled, and the service was quick.

6wp3IumJ-8pum5c0xuePDA.text: Great food in Caesars Palace 24 hrs a day.  Breakfast is excellent. Go hungry because portions are big!  We always have good service, food comes quickly. Ask to be in Josue's section--he is an exceptional friendly server, by far the standout here. His section is often the most crowded!!

f1DYIHYz8y4Q4UJ3FnDvww.text: My girlfriend and I decided to have breakfast at this place because it was close to the hotel we were staying in. My girl really liked how the place looks and she insisted on going there even though I've heard before its expensive.  We go in, nice atmosphere, the servers were good but each one of them had too many tables. We order a breakfast burrito, a cafe americano frittata and orange juice. Everything was not only looking great but was really delicious too. But these prices! We could have eaten at least twice as much for this amount of money somewhere else. I know that Vegas is not a cheap town as a whole but the other places in which we ate were with much more reasonable prices.  So even though my girl and I loved the place and the food, we wont be paying so much money for a meal again.

6bbvb7FN4lV2K7VTByA0kw.text: For several years now, this place has been our "go to" spot when staying in our near Caesar's.   This trip, however, was the first time we tried their amazing (but pricey) breakfast.    Waiter was great and the parade of food coming out to tables looked amazing.    The $8 for a 6-8oz orange juice was a bit insulting (and as far as "fresh squeezed" goes I've had better for sure).    Otherwise, we were quite satisfied.  After leaving the absurd food court pizza place, we found that Cafe Americana offered great pizza, at a slightly cheaper price, and in a comfortable environment.   But I love this place.   It's expensive but hits the mark.   I don't remember (about a decade ago) a restaurant in its place (or the same restaurant before remodeling) offered a killer wedge salad I no longer see on the menu.    Bummer.

Oeiu_8Hgbdp1j8Hrl_YqLQ.text: Not good at all. 35.00 for eggs Benedict, coffee and tip. Food was tepid. I know eggs Benedict are hard to keep hot but I feel like I was racing to get them down before hollandaise started congealing. I expect better from a breakfast that carries that kind of price tag. When I told my server that it was cold and hard to cut the bread he brought me a knife. I would rather eat at Starbucks. Not what I want but the price and the food are more palatable.

4KvKG5zdpSYHKdsTn4GT4A.text: We tried this place cause it looked pretty nice, but I can say it's too over pricy for this quality of food. And service sucks!  We asked waitress for jelly for toast and he defiantly forgot about us. Waited 10minutes for our receipt. And on top of that my burger of tomato had sticker on it.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

GWidjrb74moZGKuLoPSwkw.text: The first time we came here was on our first trip to Vegas back in February. It was easy because it was inside Ceasars Palace. I'm giving it 4 stars because I remember the horrible experience we had with one of the hostess- she wasn't accommodating or courteous. There were empty tables but they won't sit anyone who isn't a diamond member or something and the line outside was growing. Eventually we were sat but it leaves a bad taste in your mouth when things like this happen. The servers/ waiters on the other hand are simply amazing. They're attentive, respectful, jolly and make amazing suggestions. The portions are really big so sharing is always a good option. They have a nice breakfast selection. But if sweet juice isn't your thing, stay away from the cranberry and grapefruit. I'm not sure if these are from the box or can but they're too sweet for our taste. Their food in general is very good, the burgers in particular  that means a lot especially coming from me since I'm not really into burgers. But you know it's a good one when I finish it and commit to ordering it again next time  the hostesses seem better now that we have returned in December. We saw the rude hostess the other day but that's ok. All in all, it's a good place to enjoy a meal at anytime of the day or night since it's open 24 hours and have a nearby toilets. Price wise, it's up to you if it gets expensive or stay within reason.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apparently, these babies are yummy
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Toast, eggs, seasonal fruits &amp; bacon
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This white veggie omelette with hash brown and a side of bacon will hold you for the entire day

rDFbi4UKbIKbiW1b0AvARA.text: Saturday morning we had a wonderful server. I'm sorry I didn't get her name because she deserves to be recognized. There were seven of us and we are not big eaters and wanted our plates split so we could share. She told us the extra cost to split and we gladly paid it. The tea tasted great too.  Now, Sunday morning was a different story. Completely different server. Asked for the plates to be split again and none of them were split. The tea tasted old, leftover. We had to ask another server to be asked for our check. All this to say your experience here will be deterred by who your server will be.

_ZpViTbgqE5bgLxz0XnBMg.text: I shouldn't say shitty service but they have 1 server covering a huge area and the manager in "blazers" are just standing around instead of helping.   The food is your typical diner food, the cocktails are  subpar, over priced as always.  Our server did do his best but we had to approach the bar to order drinks a couple times.   Over worked and underpaid I would guess.

jmJr7ojQG8hboOa1iRScwQ.text: Had the shrimp tacos..  blown away.  Best shrimp tacos that I've ever had.   Great, prompt service and OMG.....this tacos were amazing.

Jt-K5n7WnxKVngO7Evw1PA.text: Can not critique the food, just the drinks...  Bought a couple of drinks at the bar, while waiting for a show to start. The bar itself is quite elegant and the bar tender was very responsive (did not have to flag one down or stand around with my thumb up my ass). The two drinks we ordered were "healthy" when it came to the alcohol content and they tasted good, but the price set me aback when I was hit with the bill - $28 ($14 apiece). No, Toto, we were not on the boardwalk of the Fremont Experience anymore!

ox5rmzT8Awm4LMYeIfdWbA.text: I really enjoyed this place for breakfast. Service was exceptional. Food was hot when delivered. Portions had to be split because they are huge.  A great place to have breakfast if you are staying at Caesars Palace. Oh, and one more thing: they have glutten free bread!!

y-mdTlBm9J2aLrJdUcomNQ.text: Luis P. was AWESOME!!!! We had THE best service. He was attentive and so fun! He took such good care of us and the food was delicious. He went above and beyond to accommodate our requests and we felt so well taken care of. He is a gem! Thank you for making such a wonderful guest experience. Cheers to you, Luis P.!!!!

SHwi8Z7SP2t1AhMUoGaalA.text: This was my first time at this restaurant and the food was amazing! Super healthy ingredients. Eric S. was our waiter and he provided excellent service. Will definitely be back the next time I'm in Las Vegas!

ogSfAhgGflysnmdOtJZqDA.text: When you come to Vegas you expect a certain caliber of service and food. This restaurant was a serious disappointment.  Service: Once we were seated the waiter took our drink orders and disappeared. When he reappeared he still did not have our drinks. Instead of staying the bar was backed up or that they were coming out momentarily. After about 15 min I finally asked for the drinks. Since he were returned to the table very quickly I'm guessing that he forgot about our drinks. The food took FOREVER to come. I'm guessing that he also forgot to put our food in. When we asked the manager where the food was he just indicated that they were busy without any pleasantries or apologies. Once we asked for checks he handed me the bill and told me to split the check my self -we were sitting with two other couples. Once he returned with our cards he gave them to me instead of giving each person their cards back. I dine out frequently this was just a mess. Food: I ordered the chicken and waffles which was supposed to be one of one of their specialities. The waffle had too many flavors fused together. The chicken was... sweet. Odd. I just wasn't a fan of this place.

2s6IKT6kUxTpL1KuBwuClA.text: Cafe is at the entrance of Caesars Palace main lobby.  Came in for a drink and some simple dessert and stumbled across amazing hand crafted drinks.   My fiance had an expresso martini and I had the Bloody Murica, a spin on the Bloody Mary. Infused w beef bouillon, Tito's vodka,  and pulled pork infused olives, this was not just your ordinary Bloody Mary!   The cafe has a great accommodating staff and we had an amazing bartender named Tayton! Thanks for all the great suggestions and making us feel welcome!

vWkzxdCQdEfFSsimNgcJig.text: Service is TERRIBLE. You would think Caesar's would have better service but turns out, this isn't owned by the hotel so their staff isn't properly trained.   There are a dozen tables open but they still make people wait. The hostesses just stand around chatting and laughing instead of seating the long line of people waiting. They certainly aren't pretty enough to be that dumb.  The remaining star is for the manager who was very nice and helped us get seated as soon as she could.

jpyWmrZSaVR2tYGOSaI6pQ.text: We ate breakfast here for valentine's day and it was delicious! We got sat really quickly and did not wait long for the server either. We ate the huevos rancheros and steak and eggs with a side of a bagel with cream cheese. They were both amazing. The huevos rancheros had tortillas on the bottom with beans, salsa and your choice of eggs on top with a side of hash.  It was not spicy at all but full of flavor. My bf picked the steak and eggs skillet but was given a different steak and eggs. Still it was good, over cooked but still enjoyed it. We would definitely be back either way.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Huevos rancheros. Side of bagel.
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and eggs

zk62vn5DcscS9A8OvSfWMg.text: Sex On A Spoon! Chef Suicide! Thank You Chef At 2:00AM!! Cheesecake and Chocolate Mouse With Freash Fruit!! Thick Graham Crust Soooo Rich And Amazing! Sex on A spoon!! BRAVO! Thank You Dave The most amazing Energy at Cafe Americano at 3:00AM YOU ROCK!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sex On A Spoon! Chef Suicide! Late Night!2:00AM Chef Pick! WOW

mDnzBkfoizWWViVO2Z2VjQ.text: Hubby and I had a light quick dinner at the bar with a very awesome friendly nice bartender named Tayton and he made our experience at the bar the best! Always appreciate great customer service even at a busy place in Vegas! Woohoo! Great job Tayton!

3qRIW1X4h3HEpB77pke8mA.text: We stayed at Caesars and wanted a good breakfast. We decided to eat at cafe Americano since the menu had a lot to choose from. We sat at the bar as the line to the dining room was long. The bartender was nice and gave us menus right away. I ordered the short stack of pancakes and my boyfriend ordered the California omelet with a side of fresh fruit. The pancakes were delicious and hot. Some of the best I've ever had. The omelet was really good and healthy. The fruit salad cake with melons, pomegranate,and berries and very fresh. Everything was perfect and I would definitely recommend the cafe for breakfast.

XzpOCwUJzIze11XNqXEB3w.text: Heard about the nachos here and just had to try them! They definitely did not disappoint and could easily feed 3 people. Our waiter Saul was extremely friendly and made sure to give us all of his recommendations for favorite dishes. Definitely need to come back and try the clam chowder!

F9wfYJ01xGYIXMm4ZHybqA.text: Cafe Americano!  Alonso, Richard and Walter are amazing bartenders because they make sure the drinks are fresh, and delicious.  Once again their service was five star and added to a really great  Vegas visit!   Thanks again

Q2dYN0xfNKmryRb2LJoLog.text: I'm not usually a huge fan of Casino/resort restaurants,  but Americano hits the mark.  I had the classic burger and my fiancee had the roast chicken. Both were excellent. Our server, Tyler, was knowledgeable, courteous, and quick. Our meals came out within twenty minutes.   Great job Cafe Americano!

mZo7xAoVXthN6zIhjJm3gw.text: Great service in a comfortable atmosphere. Pretty standard Vegas fare but had a we had a excellent experience. Ordered drinks and salads. Both were made quite well. My only complaint is the extra large portion sizes. A half salad would have been the perfect size. The balsamic dressing on the chicken avocado salad was incredible.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bloody Marisco
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken avocado salad

uTFy8QZ6m0KGjGv-2P5Huw.text: Had the chicken & avocado salad and 4 tacos of different varieties. Servers were nice and friendly. Pricing would probably be one factor that I would not come back. $24 for a salad and $6 per soda/ice tea. Also, in case you guys are here for Taco Tuesday, it is $4 per taco and not $3. Posting from Caesars.com needs updating. What lure me in was the $3 Taco Tuesdays.

BnlVPWSkn5dNCjxC9Y-eig.text: I've been here a few times. I've always gotten the best service at the bar. But I've actually sat down at a table and not have been greeted once so then we had to move over to the bar. Service at the bar is great. The bar service and how beautiful the setting saves you at three stars. On a nice day hit the patio it's amazing!! Very nice setting!! Inside on a hot day is not bad, you can people watch from the bar as guest check-in to the hotel. The all AMERICAN breakfast is great, but at $22 not sure I think it's great at $18 it's eggs and potatoes with no special flare to them.. charge me more sure but please show me more give me more effort. But trust me it's a good place to grab a bite.

UfSlMOA8eDO-sevpa74k9A.text: Food was just okay, Wasn't anything special. Service was really good. But for the price I expected more.

J6oj9bLC2vBybN9WJcPe_A.text: Chicken quesadillas were AMAZING with the green salsa! Definitely recommend eating here. They also had thicker cut French fries, which are my favorite, so kudos for that! I am glad we stumbled on this place and would stop by again to try the breakfast if I got another chance.

0ak8ndnNEoIjJ1THSLjjPw.text: Cafe Americano is an average restaurant that unfortunately lacks proper customer service. Their waiters don't have any knowledge of the menu.   Our visit to Cafe Americano for dinner was very unpleasant. After about 15 min of ordering our pizza the waiter comes back and says that they're out of pizza. Unfortunately, that was the only thing we could afford on the menu and we had no clue that they were out of it until a while after we ordered. We decided to leave the restaurant starving. On our way out we let the manager Ari know about the situation. As a courtesy he said he would give us complimentary breakfast the next morning. However, when we came the next morning his co-manager said they could only give a discount. After much arguing and misleading information, they decided to give breakfast for us on the house.   On the other hand, their all American breakfast was good. Portion was great in size and delicious.

0Ycnr_9F2Og_p6v3pIngbA.text: I loved the food in this place, the service was excelente. For sure I will come back.

RIPUe7FY1Um5kP-wTt5Vqg.text: I could have gotten better food at Denny's at a fraction of the price. The Bloody Mary was good, but was extremely small, about the size of a kids school lunch drink.  Between the 8 of us, we ordered a mix of breakfast and lunch items. 3 of us ordered the all American breakfast. Not one of us ate the eggs, and we couldn't even pawn them off on the rest of our group.  The lollipop wings were decent, but for the price I would expect to be blown away. I personally ordered the buffalo and was very disappointed at the extremely basic sauce and the fact that the wings were not all cut to be lollipop wings. It just shows that they are not monitoring the quality of food they are providing.  The service did not reflect the 18 percent gratuity that was added to our checks since we were a party of 8. In reality I would have probably given a less than 10 percent at most.  Overall I would highly recommend everyone to stay away from this place.

eATHWGa1HlgcI4G11Q87mA.text: This is a must have if you're in Vegas! The food is phenomenal! I had the loaded hash, this could definitely be shared between 2 people! My husband had the huevos rancheros, we are from Texas so this was kind of a test and he was very happy with it. Luis P. was a doll one of the nicest waiters I have met in Vegas!   Definitely an A+ from us!!   Ask for Luis P.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

ghpUPKoHldsLDnwELL_9nQ.text: Great food and service. Price is high but it is worth a visit. I dont normally spend over $100 for breakfast, but this was delicious! Good food  good service, I will be back@

auKA4BryUPHbEmhf2kpgCw.text: Everything... yumm. The line was long, but I'm glad we waited.   There was four of us. The girls ordered Bellinis. Delish! I totally recommend that. And for food we got the short rib nachos, short rib tacos, lobster raviolis and blackened mahi tacos. Everything was so good. Nachos were massive. Everything with the tacos were cooked to perfection.   I feel our waiter could've been a little more tentative. But then the power went out in the whole casino so I felt back for him after.   I will return again. And I do recommend this place. I do wish we were able to get breakfast.

Im98jrhOGmupns2k16xaJw.text: We are eating here right now and AGAIN WE got an incredible waiter SAUL! Saul has been over the top personable and has had SUPERB SUGGESTIONS for dinner! We are sooo happy we stopped in here for this outstanding service and mouth watering food!! Thanks Saul for the great food suggestions and for making our night GREAT!!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

DTDsb0pafIZvincTDO5J-A.text: This was a refreshing impression of Vegas dining. The servers-Saula and Tayton were very accommodating and made excellent recommendations. The food and drinks were great. I had the Fish tacos and they did not dissapoint.

7IDq1A_u35qMlZa8Rbu-zQ.text: Went here and Viri C actually stopped by and took our order. Only reason to come back

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dos Equis

PDGIAkb7wMGsReoPtlhNzQ.text: Popped in here when checking out Caesars Palace during my first trip to Vegas.    Service was tardy.  Beer was ok - although I've had a lot better, both in choice and quality.   Food was overpriced ($19 for 7 chicken wings), especially for what you get.  Won't be back and would recommend avoiding!

OzFbJOe5S8sSsAskagsY1g.text: Stopped in for lunch while in Vegas, this place is conveniently located right at Caesar's Palace so it's easy to get to from most hotels on the strip. We chose to eat outside, and enjoyed being able to eat patio-style but still see the games on the screens at the outdoor bar. The food was flavorful and light. The boxed combos are perfect for lunch. I had the quinoa salad which was quite good and the salmon which I adored. Cheers to them for having one of my favorite drafts, Golden Monkey, available. Great casual place in a convenient location.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Monkey! One of my faves!
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Quinoa salad and salmon. Delish!
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

cmJ514lzGhJPjJU4m7ZENQ.text: Huge portions but service is iffy. Look it's a Vegas big hotel 24/7 diner; I really wasn't expecting much.   BUT the pork hash in the skillet with the added fried egg on top was divine and despite the excruciatingly long wait for our brekkie, the waiter knew to keep our cups filled with their good, strong coffee.   You can't ask for much more than that.

4aOp3WVXLCnJeIaPuhR1xw.text: We sat down and the bar tender looked at us, ignored us, another group sat down next to us, whom he immediately helped while continuing to ignore us. Finally without a word he handed us menus to which we tried to reply we were only looking for drinks and were thinking about grabbing a table for food. He walked away, still no drinks ordered (we were seated at the bar which had approximately 5 bar tenders working to maybe 7 people seated).   After a few more minutes we finally managed to get a drink order in, my boyfriend had a vodka and cran I had SODA WATER AND LIME, both came in extremely small glasses overflowing with ice. I drank my water in a few seconds as there was really only about a half ounce of water in the cup, no lime.   At this point we were reconsidering food due to the rudeness of the bar tender so we closed our tab after 1 drink. Total? $19. We were charged $13 for a extremely weak vodka cran AND $6 for under an ounce of water. He then made some statement about if we wanted a table we should go to the hostess, to which we replied no thanks.   You can go to any number of friendlier high end dining/drinking places about 100 yards away. Walk by this place, don't get tempted, you can do better!

PE1o7JZuqcAP4Xn4fDeLcw.text: Saul recommenced the Cuban and the clam chowder and claimed the chowder was better than Boston's (our hometown). Well, unfortunately, he was right. Wish we could take the restaurant (and Saul) back to New England with us!  Also they overfilled my cocktail - the nerve!!!

s_SAaiAL0B0akPl6tc3hag.text: Overall a great experience. Brian our waiter was awesome, super friendly and attentive. Got the lunch box, with quinoa bowl and Cuban salad, no disappointment at all. Definitely wouldn't mind coming back.

8zUFSyttxIJkIGvujgrf0w.text: The food here is ok.  I mean it's not terrible, but for the price, I expect outstanding.  I had the All American Breakfast which is eggs, bacon, potatoes and toast for $22.  That's a little much for just an average breakfast.  Hubby had a Three Meat omelet w/hash browns and toast for $25.  I thought the hash browns were the best part, but still not worth the money.  The staff is really nice and attentive, but I could get the same quality food for much cheaper.  I think you pay a pretty penny since it's located in Caesar's.  We've had great meals at Caesar's and we are fine to pay high prices, as long as the food is worth it.  It just wasn't worth it to me.

G5Soab4JuU20a9IX6fziBw.text: Getting straight to the point, this location is both incredibly beautiful and eloquent, and the prices on the menu match it's appearance. The items on the menu, for the most part we're nothing short of ordinary cuisine. Some food items such as fettuccine alfredo and spaghetti and meatballs we're priced  at around 30 dollars, just as a general basis for entire menu. The food itself is really good, the quality exceeding my expectations. The wait time for the food was around 15 or 20 minutes, manageable by all means.  The service was nothing short of good. The server ensured that he communicated our preferences with the chef and returned any given responses and knowledge upon our wishing to. Considerate and friendly, our server was everything we could had asked for. Although his knowledge of the menu could be improved upon, the server had still done a well, and thus I decided to not count this into the review.  All in all, I would recommend this restaurant, with warning to the near absurd prices of the food items.

nIFxeCeI058pCMoqEa0D4Q.text: We tried to get a last minute reservation at Hells Kitchen but no luck so we ended up here at the Cafe.   I had a chicken avocado salad. It was great with the think Caesar dressing on the side. My crispy onions were stale so I had to send my salad back. Meanwhile while I was waiting for my salad to come out, they sent some calamari to the table and was just okay. I didn't care for coating.  My friend ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and she said it was good for not being a fancy place.  Her red table wine came cold. Not a fan of cold wine.   The Music outside was a little to loud for us.   Service was just okay. The waitress kept calling us honey & sweetie. Lol! Also, it looked like she was the only one serving outside, so she was over loaded with customers and was always in a hurry.

j65GrbjcpkbNrOd8xcws2g.text: Started off rocky with horrible service and an even more terrible manager who I suspect wasn't even a real manager. She had no skills to be in management. The general manager came over and was actually a good manager. He took the time to listen and did his job well. He spoke to our new server and must've told him to take care of us bc service was very good and he was very attentive but not overly. GM came over again to make sure everything was good which it was and we let him know. Luis is a good server ask for him if you go. Food was ok. It's loud inside.

lp7ai1YDGHeHqDBSIl5N0A.text: Awesome location to people watch while in Vegas! They offer a brunch menu that has reasonable prices for the location within the forum shopes of ceasars casino.

t3kwg97k38A034FKhrtkiQ.text: This place is a total tourist trap! Located a few feet away from the lobby and the Augustus and Octavius elevators. After I drank a whole bottle of Bacardi at the pool, I was craving something that would absorb the alcohol. I decided to try out Cafe Americano just for the fun of it. Prices here are super high but that's what you'd expect from a 5 star resort.  The waiter was attentive and quick to take my order. Water was the only thing I can drink after devouring the whole bottle of Bacardi. I ordered the poke salad that came with fresh tuna, seaweed salad and other Asian veggies. Food was excellent. The ambiance was classy as was the rest of Caesar's Palace.  Nothing was cheap at this tourist trap so since I was too hungry to walk across the strip for a cheaper dinner. This place had to do with it being a few feet away from the elevator.   Next thing that happened, the liquor started to kick in and I ended up vomiting the whole meal in the restroom! Ugh...

IdzvX3hOuos8A-z8Gtx8qg.text: Food was decent but we ended up with a horrible server. Never came to give us water, check how our meal was, and changed us to a new server without informing us. Disappointed when we left.

ZAYVO8yiHhfx3c3bj57XfA.text: Cafe Americano was fantastic! My husband had fish and chips Wich was fantastic and I had the Cuban sandwich so authentic and mouthwatering make sure to ask for Saul he is the man! Very helpful and on top of it so nice! Over all 5 star experience!

CyNQCTP0qVVfT5vcRzYgzQ.text: When are the best places I've had for fish and chips very good food very good weight staff if you are lucky enough to get Saul as your waiter you are one of the lucky ones. He's an awesome guy very informative and takes his time with you very cool guy and awesome food what more could you ask for!!!

ell1HPmQJCdWQ3nKlWeVKg.text: Before I review on the food I want to say how awesome our waiter Keith H. was, he was very polite and on top of his game. He made sure our glasses were full of what we were drinking, food was brought out and properly set on the table to make the presentation of our meal perfect. During meal he checked on us to make sure we were good and I noticed he was this way with all of his tables.  The food was great a little pricey but it's Vegas everything is pricey.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lkM_zUJNRCpsKgqxar54SA.text: Stopped in for some hangover food, it's open seating outside and a waiter comes to you. They must have been busy inside because it took 15 mins to see someone. Bloody Mario's are great, coffee isn't lol. Tortellini is good, Denver omelet was meh. The waiter was having a rough day, didn't listen when I said no dairy, had to take back my food and the new food took 20 min to come out which was frustrating. Didn't fill waters or check on us until it was time to collect money. One waiter was on top of stuff, the other (one we had) wasn't. Food was decent, pricing is high but that's Vegas. They're open 24/7, and have breakfast all day which has its appeal.

1q0TJSQVSqAdLYE4IEET3g.text: Overrated, overpriced   Passed by this spot a couple of times when in Vegas. Decided to try it for a late breakfast. They told me they were not serving breakfast anymore but I could still order some eggs and toast. Well, 2 fried eggs and 3 slices of cheap white bread.... Payed $14 bucks ($8 for 2 fried eggs and $6 for some piece of cheap looking and tasting white bread), not counting on tip and taxes! Insane! Ended up paying around $20.  In general the staff is nice and the location is good but....pricey pricey pricey for what they have to offer..

CMPp2Xl3guPeFg79aKUH0w.text: I've been here a few times for breakfast.  I've had their rib hash which i remember being a huge portion. I really like their breakfast burrito, its so delicious,  just the right amount of chorizo which if its too much i get too much chorizo flavor if that makes sense. The prices are a little high, you can expect to pay about $25-30 on 1meal plus drink and tip.   I'll will definitely keep coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast burrito

XV0lptTYd8fqlUeemOLeBA.text: First time here absolutely loved it!!! They have very good vegan choices ..5 Stars for Nikki if i had the option i'd give her 10 she's phenomenal..

wMm9csCWRN426PMVrr86lg.text: Located near the reception area, it's definitely an easy access. We were looking to eat a pretty late lunch (around 3pm), and since this place was open 24 hours, it was perfect for us. The service was nice, very quick four requests. However,  the food itself was not great, and to price a burger at $23, regardless of where, I still expect juicy bites. I ended up getting the Carolina Melt; the portion size was definitely nice,  but the burger itself seemed lacking in flacor and a little dry in my opinion. Also, there was an imbalance of cheese, covering every bite. The classic burger also did not look too appealing, seeming a little bland. However, its convenience definitely helped.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carolina Melt

daAQADIAezrDiKtyeU7gFA.text: This was the only friendly staffed place during 2 day stay in Vegas. Friend had a room associated VIP card and we (2 of us) could use $150 worth of food.    We ordered bunch of food including $45 (maybe 47) steak visioning a French chef putting fingers near his lips saying things I wouldn't understand. Hell no.... it was no better than $15-ish steak from Sizzler.... quite possibly worse.  I've never tried a poke so can't really tell if it's good or not, but it didn't impress me at all.  Clam chowder was GOOD.  It had lots of real clams and thick bacon pieces.  Bacon was a bit too thick to my taste, but still it was one of the best I've ever tried.  Food overall was better than other famous places, but prices were extreme.  I won't visit this place if costs wouldn't be covered.  Looks like everything in Vegas are now bubbled up where hotels provide and cover very high limit on meals, but food prices all went up as well.  There's no chance that I pay for it on my own.  On a side note.... I am one to think and say racism doesn't really exist in US, but I sensed strange racially biased vibes all along in Vegas.  Staff at many places were saying nonsense and didn't seem to answer what we asked.  This place was the only exception in Vegas where I didn't "felt" being a bit discriminated.... maybe I just looked poor....  Anyhow, I felt welcomed here.  Will I come back ?  Unlikely.

8HLJJPvVqU5YZEwAgodjqA.text: Love this place, if you like chicken then you need to try chicken sandwich, always a lot of people there, they have full bar and nice cocktails.

4FnMj1KjPFM2Fhxqkw4NGw.text: Delicious breakfast! Classic 2 egg sunny side up and a continental breakfast with lots of fruit and pastries. Easy and convenient place to grab breakfast. Food was really good but high however you know everything is when you step into a casino. We sat at the bar which I believe you get served faster and you can watch the crowd in front of you. Fun fun !

fpPfW_mHd7y1wwTuPyrvSA.text: In a sea of either ultra expensive restaurants or food courts, Cafe Americano stands out.  It's menu is well-rounded with not only something for everyone, but something for every budget.  We were greeted and seated immediately and it only got better from there.  The Fish and Chips were fresh and delicious and the Roasted Chicken with fingerling potatoes, charred green beans and tender asparagus spears was outstanding.  Our Caesar salads were crisp and perfectly dressed.  While we were pleased to have found such good food, our dinner was raised to a whole new level by our waiter Saul.  He was the BEST!  A perfect melding of professionalism and personality.  He took care of our every need and helped guide our dinner selections.  Saul took a very good dinner experience and make it into a memorable one.  While we have gone to more prestigious and expensive restaurants during our stay in Vegas, for the four of us, our dinner at Cafe Americano will stand out because of Saul.

NcBF9o3XXqqm13gGJ-c-hQ.text: Went there with my boyfriend while we were staying at Caesars. The first time we sat outside on their amazing patio and Anthony was our bartender. He was so attentive and made the best mojitos! We must have sat there for 6 hrs! They have delicious food as well. Because of Anthony we came back the next 3 Days. We also met another bartender Chantel. She was so great to talk to and made a mean martini! Talk about great customer service!! Hands down the best bar in Vegas!!

dWHsrj8Cym7kloFIQwR7NA.text: Our waiter gave us great service is the only reason I am giving 2 stars. Those of you who know me know I am a total "foodie" and the food my Mom & I were served here doesn't warrant a star!   I am never this harsh but my Fried Chicken Salad promised assorted lettuces and I got chopped up iceberg, the tomatoes, at least the ones I could find, were grape tomatoes cut in half, and there were few small pieces of cucumber AND then the "FRIED" chicken (I expected a sliced fried chicken breast), consisted of small breaded chicken nuggets - seriously! McDonald's probably does a better job on chicken nuggets as these were still slightly frozen in the center. My Mom took one and hers was more frozen in the center than the one I tried.  My Mom's fries were Luke warm and not crisp either. This was a total shame as this was our first meal when we arrived at Caesar's Hotel in Las Vegas Obviously I would NEVER recommend!

M1m-biCiv-T-amMkK02k0g.text: Love, Love, Love Cafe Americano! Our waiter Saul is amazing and so professional. I wanted to order the Halibut but wasn't sure if it would be good. When he came to take our order he suggested the Halibut and said it was amazing! I was sooooo happy I got it! Man oh Man...the dish is the BOMB!!! So good! I will be back tomorrow to get it again! Lol! The Manager Geraldo came to our table to check on my Mom and I and made sure we were happy with everything. Love the customer at this establishment and will always come back when visiting Las Vegas. My Mom had the Tortilla Soup and she loved it. Another fave! Love Saul!!!!

cLvnIljb7LmeOq7VEoQ8Gw.text: For a 24 hour casino diner, its very pricey...very.  No kids menu, lost a star.  But they did a side of mac and cheese for my boy, it was great.  Side salad was great and the nachos are pretty bomb.  Huge to share and worth the $23 yes for nachos!  But damn good!  Service was on it.  Atmosphere is great and so is the bar.

l7Kp6vLUyRgmiiQ4xJBYHA.text: I love this place. Great food. Open 24/7!!! I always eat here at least twice on my monthly visits to Vegas!!

SrWM75I-wovAm5YF_Ex5RQ.text: My mom and I walked around most of the morning and we were pretty hungry by the time we stumbled upon Cafe Americano at Caesars. First we sat at the bar since you can order food there too, but the bartenders were too busy attending to 2 tipsy blondes' needs. So we decided to ask for a table on their outside patio, only to find out later that the menus are different inside vs outside (pretty silly if you ask me). We finally got a table inside and even though the cafe was pretty much empty on a Saturday, the service was nonexistent. Our waitress didn't show up for about 10-15 minutes to get our order. The food was yummy, except for their grilled mahi mahi which was too salty. The skinny flat iron steak fry was very tasty and filling. For the prices they have, they should definitely step up their service game!  I would probably give it a 3.5

zS-YfjNqhe0zKQ02pI5pRw.text: The food was great.  Servers were very nice!   The only thing I would warn about is the cost of food!   It is on the expensive side...But I'm ok with paying the extra money if the food is great!   We may try again for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

_HdwRkkajEEg7LAWxfaH9w.text: Standard fare, at a very high price because it's right by the lobby.  The food was ok, the server was a nice guy but service was slow because he had to handle such a large area.  This restaurant basically counts on the huge lineup and overflow of the front desk to catch hungry travelers that are pressed for time.  If you're on an expense account and don't have time, this is a convenient option.  Otherwise, I suggest elsewhere...

vI13UIiNx9jfgowHsUZXkQ.text: Food Quality - 4 stars Service - 5 stars Value for food -2 stars  This reataurant is conveniently located inside Cesars right by checkin desk. We ate here twice in 24 hours and I decided to write the review after trying it twice. First was last night. We got there right after 11 and the menu had changed to late night. We ordered the sliders and the mac and cheese. Both really good. The service was good too. Biggest problem is the price. Average price of entree was $20+ per plate. Expect most items to be twice the price of any similar venue outside the casinos.  The second time we ate there was this morning, we were running late and just checked out. I ordered a breakfasr burrito and mimosa. Gotta say the mimosa was fantastic. The breakfast burrito was so-so. Again this place is very conveninent if your other options are limited.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. breakfast burrito

o7Q7dbpDAqGB83sPLC3DMw.text: We went for brunch, and it was pretty slow- a total of four tables, including us.  Our food was fine and came out promptly...but that's where our service ended! We were never checked on again or offered a refill of water or coffee.  The simple, drip coffee from a coffee pot was $5.50 each, by the way.  I know that we're in Vegas so we should expect higher prices, but we should also be offered a coffee refill!!

K6hgrD13CZ1YtNMFruFw9A.text: Took my family here for NYE. We had a reservation down but for some reason "we weren't in the system." But the hostess and manager had no issues with accommodating our group of 9 which was very surprising for such a busy night. Our waiter was very friendly and personable. I ordered the short ribs nachos and smokehouse burger w/ the salad amongst all the other dishes my family ordered. It wasn't until this burger that I realized how important patty density is. This burger was perfect in that department. The portions were relatively large and left my family feeling satisfied. Prices are a little expensive but for the quality and location, what do you expect. I ordered my typical drink, the Gin mule which came in copper mug, which is very crucial. The drink was very balanced, better then a lot of other mules I've had around town. I wouldn't hesitate to come back if I'm in the area.

ezOIq4y8W8cNGRTG6EWTMg.text: Excellent food! Caesar salad, chopped salad, smoked burger and Cuban sandwich were all very high quality. The service was prompt and very polite.

csVjsmv6YnDqeORYg2L7wg.text: I ordered the short rib beef nachos. My wife and I were able to share the huge amount of nachos. I have eaten breakfast and lunch several times at Cafe Americano . The food has always been tasty and the service has always been good. I definitely recommend the nachos.

Cp2mx12GUyig9bbEIjkT-A.text: A little expensive but it's in a hotel so it's to be expected. I ordered the egg white wrap and got the cilantro crema and ranchera salsa on the side. $2 for a side of salsa but again to be expected. My grandmother got the Belgian waffles. Both were delicious! And I'm normally not a huge fan of hash browns but I liked theirs. Our service was also very nice. There was some kind of mix up and I ended up with a burger with bacon I didn't order but they got it fixed promptly! For having the word cafe in their name I didn't see anything other than regular coffee but maybe I just missed it. All in all a good experience.

Suv-BC8sERUXJgI7XwSZow.text: This is the 24/7 restuarant at Cesar's Palace. New menu is much improved. I have only eaten breakfast here but always good and now better. lots of healthy choices.

gQoerwhZu1tTPnkZn6WKTw.text: This place is a huge disappointment. You think you would get some class in Las Vegas....

Kk4W7I-FrmSpEMfHVFfhkA.text: We were seated immediately upon entering. Staff was very welcoming and friendly. I ordered the chicken salad. Chicken was dry and over cooked and overpriced. I'd skip this restaurant and try one of the many other places around.

G8Njv6MC-3JAfPBmxN9bjA.text: No real wait at the front for a somewhat late lunch (unlike the 20+ minute wait quoted for breakfast at Monte Carlo's Pub which was half empty/closed off).  Since I had only consumed a protein shake and was starving, and was planning on a late after-show dinner, I decided to get something that would "stick" with me: Pasta!  The chicken carbonara mac and cheese had perfectly al dente penne pasta along with a fantastic cream sauce, just enough cheese, and large pieces of crispy bacon and moist chicken breast pieces.  It was an excellent meal.  Their soup is only sold by the bowl, not by the cup, which was disappointing.  Also disappointing to a family member was their lack of Eggs Benedict on the abbreviated all-day breakfast section.  But the do give out condiments in tiny little glass bottles and jars!  Our waiter did keep vanishing for long periods of time, so it was very difficult to order additional items or get refills.  Hence only 4 stars.  The prices made me go a little wide-eyed, but I wasn't paying, so I didn't really consider it.

PwAod3nOLJxXnUqxk6EbnA.text: Jon T is the best bartender ever!!!! He makes AMAZING drinks, has great conversation, and is just all around great. If you know what's good for you, you'll just come check him out!

8JQVHEX8wcwWelsRSm26pg.text: My friends and I came here after the club.  Good thing they're 24 hours.  We order some drinks along with fish and chips and other finger foods.  Everything tasted good.  So glad they had sriracha.  I scarfed that down. We didn't finish everything so we had our server get us boxes.  Then we needed more and another server went to get it.  I had asked for some sriracha to go and he said they didn't have it.  What a liar.  I called him out on that too calling him a liar.  Moments later he returned with a box and a container of sriracha...  Our main server was awesome.  He did everything as expect and beyond.

IWjIFO8gr_wMnuwg4YJLdQ.text: The Margerita  pizza was good. The bartenders are good looking, charming, and entertaining. Overall we had an interesting night. This was definitely better than going to some food court.

Vn02PV0nqiY_nPB384u2GQ.text: Overall a GREAT dining experience here last night.   My family and I were hungry for a late night dinner and we stumbled upon here in Ceasars Palace. Open 24/7 but Very cute set up, a little more on the trendy side and not your normal 24/7 cafe place.   Our food was delicious. We all got a variety of different things, and they all were great! We had the Octopus Pizza, the Burger, the Breakfast Platter, and the applewood smoked ham and turkey sandwich.  The thing that truly made our visit great was the service from everyone Danielle our waitress- Jonathon- our waiter/bus boy and the Bar Manager Adrian. Everyone was so friendly and great. I would like to especially recognize Jonathon for his above and beyond service to us, even offering us water cups to go since it's hot outside! He was great.  We will definitely be back. I am in the restaurant industry and heard this is their first one on the West Coast- so I truly do wish you all the best of Luck! Continue with the great food and service and you will do well- that's the recipe for success! Thanks again and see you all next time!

UVrbrm-R3Ej3c1deEweihg.text: Food was really tasty, however the guacamole avocado type sauce has a little bit of a texture thing that wasn't my favorite. We got the brisket nachos and they were great. I also had one of their lemon blueberry martinis and it was delicious. Very well balanced with little "alcohol" flavor. Super impressed.

INSOaqQKAeBZ_vt8e51mmQ.text: We've got to the restaurant after a long day of fun and gambling and when myself an my wife got to the restaurant to order something to take to our room we encountered a hostess that did not want to work and told us to order at the bar. The bar staff, 2 people a guy and a girl were obnoxious and when we've asked about recommendation about food and available draft beers they simply handed out the menus like they could care less. Caesar Palace or the restaurant owner should choose their staff better. We've ended up leaving without ordering because they don't deserve anyone's money. Simply horrible staff!

5faqQRjXECY_y0k2Z1-3dQ.text: Got the nachos which were not bad. Filling and good for 3-4 ppl  Friend got the fried chicken sandwich which he gave a 5/5 (one of the best he's had)  I had the burger which was a solid 4/5   I would defiantly go back on my next visit.

X6I44TmbblEIN4X9ma4PTg.text: The food was great, but too pricey. We asked for one extra English muffin and we were charged 9 dollars only for that.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast menu

k5P3gnJkBFCz-eIT3P7cYw.text: This is a great spot to grab a bite to eat after a long night of entertainment on the Las Vegas Strip or if your flying in on a red eye. It's open 24 hours a day, and they offer quality breakfast, lunch, and dinner options at any hour. You'll definitely find something to fit any craving at this place. The service was great, and my eggs, potatoes, and bacon came out perfectly.  They also have a full service bar located at the front of the restaurant, right across from the hotel check-in. There's no better way to start your Vegas adventure than with a drink in your hand!

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2LYODhVDJsuGH_MdxIBIBg.text: Absolutely go anywhere else in vegas but this restaurant. We sat down to order our food at 2:15 AM, the waiter did not put in our order until 2:47, and we did not receive our food until 3:20. The server refused to come by and fill up our water, and essentially avoided our table; taking preference to the tables full of drunk girls. When we addressed the manager, he took 15 minutes to even respond to our claim and when he did he raised his voice and threw the bill on the table. I have never received such rude, neglectful service in my entire life. And as a service industry worker, I can barely believe the level of gross incompetence and inattention to guests at this establishment. I would not go back here if it were the last place in vegas to eat and I was starving.

uxX-hMXbeAzMu_625bpfAQ.text: Very Good Breakfast Spot The Food is a 7 out of 10, its one of the only places open early in Caesars. Great place to eat breakfast and watch the early football games on sunday. The service was really good.

wXqKcDhjG0tcp1btAMoctg.text: They have no vegetarian options for lunch. The veggie stack was a packet of salt on sour vegetables that I couldn't eat. The servers have no ideas for vegetarians, I mean no customization.

photos.caption: Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Look at the veggie stack! Sucked.
Photo of Cafe Americano - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old refried fries

L6X0oPNZ73GEWBy1Vkfnzw.text: Service was not that great. Prices were outrageous but we were hungry so we stopped to eat. Our bill was even more outrageous as the restaurant charged us $30 for gratuity. Needles to say I will never come back here, starving or not

49bM9VnZb8InDAQGrNy1fA.text: Great, accessible, 24-hour place. I am a sucker for breakfast food so I tried both this place and Cafe Bellagio. This place wins, easily.  First of all, it is ever-so-slightly cheaper than Cafe Bellagio (okay, $1-$2 isn't much, but still). Don't get me wrong, I don't eat or drink at places like Caeser's Palace and Bellagio to save money, but it is still an indicative factor.  Second, hash browns, much better than CB, smaller portion, BUT- you also get toast. At CB toast was a separate side item, cost extra. What.  Third, the toast comes unbuttered so you can portion the butter yourself. Thank you! More places need to do this!  Fourth, the service, once seated, was phenomenal. I believe I was helped by Ryan K, at least that's what is on my receipt, and he was prompt, courteous, professional, and checked back often to ensure I had everything I needed. More servers need to do this!  Getting seated, however, was disastrous. It wasn't even busy. Lots of open tables, but for each group in line they were setting up tables ad-hoc. Maybe I came right after a huge rush left? I don't know, I'm not docking any stars for this - I just felt for being third in line, that the wait was kind of laughable.  Will definitely be back.
